Reviews.Title: “A very personal haven in Downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Individualtraveller7
Reviews.Content: We spent a whole week at The Listel in Vancouver. It was a fabulous experience. The hotel is perfectly located within a few minutes walking distance to the Vancouver Convention Center and the harbour. There are plenty of beautiful shops and restaurants around. The house is very special and tastefully decorated with lots of stylish art works on all floors. We had booked a Standard room, which was well equipped and absolutely spacious enough for us two. The bathroom was a bit small but impeccable clean. It had everything you need. There are bigger rooms available for higher room rates. We got high speed internet connection in the room both via cable or WLAN. Fortunately we could switch off the air condition and sleep with an open window. (Don't know what air condition is good for in Canada...). The staff is extremely friendly and willing to help with anything you need. They found a solution for whatever special wishes we had. My wife does not like to use elevators. That was no problem at all: The hotel opened the fire stairs for us and gave us a room on second floor. Breakfast is not included, but you get the best Muesli out of Switzerland in the attached O'Doule's restaurant which will probably be one of the best restaurants in town. Every single meal was gorgeous, and on Saturday evening there is live Jazz music (which you will NOT hear in your sleeping room!). The bar in the restaurant is also a great place for drinks and meeting people. We can strongly recommend this house for everyone who looks for a very individual hotel that makes a difference to the boring sleeping boxes of the big hotel chains. Nothing to complain? Actually no. Nothing!

Reviews.Title: “Listel Vancouver Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: Buttons H
Reviews.Content: I had been travelling for four nights on a train in economy class which was nice but not very comfortable. We arrived in Vancouver and found our way to Our Hotel the Listel. I had picked this Hotel because of its location and art work. I had read the reviews on this very site and it seemed to be in a great location and only a couple of negative reviews. I must admit I was a little nervous about the negative reviews. It is true one negative will cancel all the positives. We arrived at 11 am and were not to check in till 3, this was no problem they took us right in with no questions I found the staff so helpful. The bed and room were incredible. We had a view of the alley but that was fine we loved our room.It had everything we needed. After a long nap I walked everywhere the location of this Hotel is fantastic. We stayed there for three nights and I would certainly stay here again without any doubts.I felt very safe. Best stay in Vancouver clean, friendly efficient staff and location. Thank you Listel B from Ontario.

Reviews.Title: “Two nights at the Listel”
Reviews.Content: Having come up trumps with various Priceline deals, we did something similar with the Top Secret hotels on last minute and the Listel was the hotel allocated. The hotel is decent and gave us nothing complain about but having sampled Vancouver's other 4 stars for the same bid price, it was disappointing, in that it does not have the same level of facilities as the others, such as pool, hot tub etc. It was nice to be situated in another part of town and it's in walking distance of Stanley Park and plenty of good shops and restaurants as well as close to the Waterfront. Whilst they present themselves as a boutique hotel due to the artwork and sculptures situated around the place, there is little in the rooms that sets them apart from an average hotel room and I would place the rooms at more of a three star level than a four star as once away from the main Foyer and lift areas, the decor was a little tired. The bed was comfortable and the staff very friendly and helpful, with a wine evening offering guests complimentary glasses (we already had arrangements and did not partake), there is nothing to complain about as such but it also lacked any real wow, where you walk into your room for the first time and smile that you've got a great one, especially when we have stayed at the Westin, Rennaisance and the Hyatt for the same bid price as this.

Reviews.Title: “Great place; Clean; Comfortable; art is really quite wonderful”
Reviews.Author: verycriticaltraveler
Reviews.Content: Read the reviews here and was not disappointed. What I was really surprised by was the art. The art here are from previous exhibitions, museum quality, interesting, fun, and phenomenal in places. The rooms are spacious, the bathroom a little smallish and perhaps will need remodeling in a year or two. The internet was a little sketchy. With wireless, I would get bounced off a few times an hour, but was able to get back on right away. The location is great and safe and walking distance to a number of things. A bar named O'Doul's raises different expectations (if one comes from Boston) -- this bar/restaurant was pretty classy with really nice waitstaff, excellent wines, and jazz trios 3 nights a week. If I come to Vancouver again, I wouldn't hesitate to just book here. Almost totally satisfied (remembering I'm the "verycriticaltraveler").

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected Oasis”
Reviews.Author: Teresa V
Reviews.Content: Our trip to Vancouver was business related during a stressful time, but the calming atmosphere of the Listel Hotel made it seem like a relaxing holiday. The room was quiet and comfortable for relaxing, yet with free WiFi and all the outlets needed it was also ready for business when we were. All the staff were friendly and ready to help when we needed directions (driving or walking); the restaurant was phenomenal; the art work was tastefully displayed; with the crowning touch being the beautifully wrapped cookies left on the dash of our car for our departure. We'll definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Winter Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Lizzie3900
Reviews.Content: Everything was wonderful during our stay. The staff was very efficient and helpful. Great location - can walk to anything in the area - safe and clean city!

Reviews.Title: “Close to all the activity, but quiet enough to enjoy it”
Reviews.Author: SharksPep
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights of our Spring break at the Listel. Getting to Stanley Park was so easy! We walked a few blocks and rented some bicycles and spent the next 2 hours biking around the park. Getting to Granville Island was a short drive away too! The hotel is beautiful and the staff are friendly and helpful. Used the valet parking (only parking option) and my car was always brought promptly and with a smile. We had a room facing away from Robson St, so maybe that is why it was so quiet. The only drawback was that it had limited drawer space for clothing for our family of four, but we made it work. Starbucks across the street...free wifi there and throughout the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Unclean!!”
Reviews.Author: AInstin
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a great location on Robson Street in Vancouver. The hotel rooms were probably amazing... in 1996 when they were last renovated... and cleaned. I lifted my pillow, which was on the green comforter, and yes, it was covered in hair! The short and curly type. The bathroom, pretty much the same: watch-springs everywhere! Naturally the comforter ended up on the ground, yet now the "freeze or sweat" AC settings left me shivering all night. I travel a lot for work, and I stay in a lot of hotels, but I've never stayed in a hotel that offers a "sex kit" in the mini-bar. Yes, that's right. I guess now I know why there was so much hair all over the room. The room was nicely appointed, but pointlessly large. And no, two small crappy televisions, don't make for one decent one. 4 Star hotel? I think not! 3 at BEST!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful, well-located, good value”
Reviews.Author: TexasOutdoorChick
Reviews.Content: This is a delightful, boutique hotel, well-located in Vancouver’s bustling Robson Street shopping-and-dining district. It’s a short walk to major sights and attractions including Stanley Park, the Vancouver Art Gallery and the harbor. The hotel is clean and attractive. The art in and around the lobby area as well as on some of the higher floors is a fun and unique touch. The service was fabulous -- everyone was very accommodating and helpful. All this said, if you go expecting a four-star property, you may be disappointed which is what I think accounts for some of the mixed reviews on Tripadvisor. The Listel Vancouver is a solid three to three-and-a-half star property. I found several, significantly discounted prices for the hotel on various websites, including the $100/night rate I ended up paying so shop it and I think your stay will prove to be a very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Great quality and location amazing restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Sarah J
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for walking downtown Vancouver. I did find it not quite as nice as some of the other 4 star hotels but for the most part the staff were great. They even left a cookie in my car from the valet as a little going away treat. O'Douls restaurant attached to the hotel was exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “This Boutique Hotel is a treasure!”
Reviews.Author: eyesrita
Reviews.Content: I booked the Listel Hotel at the last minute for our Anniversary. Upon arrival we were greeted by the Valet -very helpful. The Woman at the front desk was very pleasant. Our room was exceptional-We had a deck to sit out on overlooking the city. We had dinner at O'Doulls in the Hotel and again had exceptional service and food. The whole experience was a wonderful surprise! We will definitely be returning!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good service, average quality”
Reviews.Author: tr4v3l_g1rl
Reviews.Content: This hotel is clean and comfortable and in a great location, what more can you ask? If you plan to spend all of your time in your hotel this is probably not the choice for you. The TV's are old and small, the restaurant is not that great and there is no pool or spa. However if all you plan to do is sleep in your hotel because you want to explore everything Vancouver has to offer this is a very good choice at a good price. We arrived around noon, three hours before check-in. They found a room that was available for us to check in to right then so we didn't have to store our luggage in the storage area and it was a free upgrade to a suite! Our sitting room was an art deco design, so fun, our bed was comfortable and the bathroom was fancy (rain shower head and big soaking tub). Speaking of service, they offer free French press coffee delivery every morning from 6 - 9am, it was delicious and a perfect treat. Also, when they return your car to you they give you fresh baked oatmeal cookies. Nice touches! The hotel was right in the middle of all of the places we wanted to go: Granville Island, Stanley Park, Gastown. I would definitely consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price we paid but not?what I would choose”
Reviews.Author: FirstThingsFirst
Reviews.Content: We Got this hotel through Hotwire as a 4 star in Vancouver for $79/night. It's nice, clean, friendly, but not as good as some of the other 4 stars in downtown Vancouver. We book for spring break with Hotwire each year and have had nicer. No pool or hot tub. No view. Thank goodness I checked Tripadvisor ahead of time and saw the review to be careful of the rooms near the meeting rooms that can be noisy early in the morning. They had my room ready when we arrived at 3 pm and when I asked about proximity to meeting rooms he checked and sure enough we were next door to a meeting room that had 50 people arriving for a 7 am meeting the next morning. Not only was the room beside the door and hall to the meeting room, but the offer area on the way into the meeting room was literally next to the bedroom they had us in. They moved us to the end of the hall and all was quiet but I shutter to think how mad I would have been if I hadn't known to ask. The valet parking was timely and handy, but so expensive.

Reviews.Title: “A smart choice in downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: RPaderna
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Listel for eight nights and I was completely satisfied with my choice, The hotel is on one end of Robson Street where many restaurants are located so it can be quite challenging to choose where to eat. A quick 5-minute walk and one is surrounded by the endless shops that made Robson Street the shopping belt of Vancouver. For those who would like to jog or stroll along Cole Harbour and admire the breathtaking view, it is a mere 5-minute walk away. Don't miss Cafe Villagio in front of the harbour. The service is friendly, the views unmatched, and the cinammon rolls absolutely delicious. Quite close also is world-renowned Stanley Park. The room assigned to me was adequately-sized and had a comfortable bed. The sheets and pillows were of good quality so one is assured of a restful sleep. The bathroom is modest in proportion but was good enough for a decent shower or bath. Breakfast was part of the package I booked and it was served at the hotel's signature restaurant O'Doul's. Breakfast was cooked to order and one can choose from many options listed in an elegant menu tablet. Like many previous reviews, the Eggs Benedict was indeed very good....and so was the pumpkin Brioche! Service was friendly and efficient. The Listel Vancouver is a moderately-priced, well-maintained hotel in a city known for expensive accommodations. I checked-out after nine days feeling satisfied and happy with the choice I made.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, average-quality hotel for the price.”
Reviews.Author: nrg22
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Listel during our recent trip to Vancouver from California, mostly due to a great Hotwire deal. I've seen many people here complaining about the cost of parking, taxes, etc...be aware before you travel to Vancouver that this is unavoidable. As a large, busy city, parking costs $$ everywhere you go...from restaurants to shopping to sight-seeing. The Listel does charge $26 per night for valet parking (with tax comes out to about $35 USD), which is quite pricey. However, the only alternative is trying to find a meter somewhere on Robson (good luck) or surrounding streets and then walk in everyday. As Vancouver was a very unfamiliar city to us (in an unfamiliar country, for that matter), we chose just to suck it up and accept the cost as a part of our travel budget. We were, however, expecting the cost because of the reviews here, as the hotel otherwise doesn't make it very obvious until you check in. Parking is a trade-off for the location, which is hands-down the best thing about this hotel. Located right in the middle of Robson, one of Vancouver's busiest shopping streets, you are pretty much in walking distance from lots of fun things to do, great restaurants, shops, etc. I've heard some refer to it as the "Rodeo Drive" of Vancouver...I wouldn't go that far, but it does have a lot of shopping options, not to mention the Vancouver ArtGallery just a few blocks up. If you don't care as much about being right smack-dab in the middle of all the city action, consider staying out of downtown, maybe in Kitsilano or West Vancouver and you may find better parking rates. As for the hotel itself...eh. My husband and I have stayed in a lot of hotels, and our biggest complaint was that this hotel was just "okay" for having a 4-star rating. Our first night, we stayed in a room on the second-floor, on the backside of the property. Not terrible, but not great either...just an average room. The bed was very firm, uncomfortable and "springy" which I did not enjoy at all. The next night, we decided to upgrade to the "gallery floor" for an extra $20 per night. Not too much change here (just bathrobes, free french-press coffee in the mornings, a bigger TV, and a "media bar" that you can use to plug in your iPad, etc), but the bed was much nicer, and that alone was worth the cost. Staff was ok. The housekeepers were great, very friendly and prompt with cleaning our room while we were gone during the day. The front desk staff was just alright. There was one employee (whose name escapes me) who perhaps was the valet as he was almost always the one to get our car, but he always asked if we needed directions or suggestions, and he was very friendly and approachable when we had questions about what to do. Again, can't remember his name, but I do know that he was originally from Amsterdam, and very helpful to us during our stay. All in all, I would only recommend this hotel if you get a tremendous deal (under $100 per night). And don't forget to budget in the tax and the parking, as that will be a considerable expense.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, lovely artwork and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Capt_tuBBymAN
Reviews.Content: The Listel was an excellent hotel as a base for our 3 day visit to Vancouver. The location was perfect for walking to either the harbour front or into the city centre and well placed for night time eateries. The food in the hotel was very good both at breakfast and also if you choose to have your evening meal there, with very helpful staff who were well versed in their menu and what to have. The rooms were very comfortable and a good size with great facilities including complimentary Wi-Fi. We would certainly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of parking costs”
Reviews.Author: Bewareofparking
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice and clean. The staff was friendly. I would not call this a "Boutique Hotel", but it was pretty good. It is situated in a very convenient location close to restaurants. The reason I decided to write this review was that I was not aware of the parking situation in downtown Vancouver. The hotel rate for parking is something like $27 per day plus 35% tax, which comes to a total of approximately $35/day. But this is not your only option. Right next to the hotel there is a small street (Jarvis) where you can park FREE for two hours from 9:00 to 6:00 p.m., after 6 p.m. there is no limit of time until the next morning. Beware that parking at the meters in front of the hotel is not only expensive, but during the week Robson street, on the side of the hotel, is used for rush traffic, so you cannot park there after 6:00 a.m. However, if you find a parking meter across the street, it is a good option to leave the car after 9:00 p.m. I believe you don't have to put money in the meter until 9:00 a.m. BEWARE of parking at COSTCO, it costs money!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough - doesn't live up to a true boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: sb1London
Reviews.Content: This hotel left me a little cold. It was nice enough and the rooms were clean, beds comfortable. But for an arts inspired boutique hotel it was just a little, well, boring. The lobby is very cool but the rooms themselves (or at least my room) was a little tired, functional but certainly not "boutique". However, there is nothing wrong with this hotel - service was fine (not amazing - front desk staff were patchy), it was good value for downtown and there were some nice touches such as fresh coffee delivered to your room in the morning, on request.

Reviews.Title: “"Very Pleased!"”
Reviews.Author: M G
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights and were extremely pleased with the Listel Hotel. Although we had a very basic room, it was clean and comfortable. Loved the sculptures and artwork displayed throughout the premises. The location cannot be beat as you are near fabulous shopping, attractions such as Stanley Park, coffee shops galore and many great restaurants including the in-house O'Doul's, where we were warmly welcomed and enjoyed a sumptuous brunch on the weekend. We found the hotel staff to be very accommodating, cheerful and helpful from check-in to check-out. We were also very impressed with the hotel's committment to the environment. We will definitely return!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service/Amazing Location/Trendy Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Spin22
Reviews.Content: The Listel is a fantastic choice when staying in Vancouver as it is centrally located on Robson Street so everything you could want from shopping to eateries and beyond is at your door step. The property has tasteful art pieces throughout and the rooms are always clean and comfortable. O' Doul's Restaurant hosts jazz musicians in the evening creating outstanding ambience and they serve up an amazing Eggs Benedict for breakfast. What makes this property special is the service staff. They go above and beyond to make your experience outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Nice artsy hotel in downtown Vancouver.”
Reviews.Author: kwindmueller
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great place to stay. Minutes from many downtown Vancouver. The staff was friendly and helpful. Parking was expensive, but I think that is normal for Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Surprised”
Reviews.Author: makadoodle
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stay in a lot of hotels and are owners at the Westin in Whistler so we normally don't stay in anything until a 4 star. However I have to say we were very pleased with the Listel. The hotel is very clean, room was spacious, and comfy bed and the employees were so friendly and helpful! Have been to Odouls in the past and forgot how much I loved this restaurant. Great food and top notch service. My only complaint is the tub in our room was old and small and I missed having my 5 star toiletries and lotions etc. but that wouldn't make or break us staying there again, just makes me spoiled I think! Also you can't beat the location, right on Robson! Next time hubby and I are looking for a night on the town without the kids, we will definitely come back to the Listel! Great night out and so happy with our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't be more pleased!”
Reviews.Author: Pamela C
Reviews.Content: From the Front Desk, Smiling Gracious Chambermaids, Car Valet Cutie, to ODouls waitstaff I can't enough good things about my stay. The overall ambience of the hotel with its lovely contemporary art and its very comfortable rooms you will feel better here than you do @ home! My philosophy about hotels in general is "if you aren't just as but preferably more comfortable in a particular hotel - why leave home"?? There is no bad experience here!

Reviews.Title: “Sleeping with art”
Reviews.Author: trula
Reviews.Content: Convenient, downtown, friendly professional staff. Very comfortable. Several suites display NW Coast Indian art. I would return here.

Reviews.Title: “Robson Street in Vancouver ... Lots to See and Do”
Reviews.Author: Annoyingly_Picky
Reviews.Content: We spent a weekend visiting Vancouver and stayed at the Listel Hotel on Robson. Our room was nicely decorated, although not large. The room was comfortable and the hotel lobby has a nice feel to it. Staff is very friendly and helpful. The security is very good ... you must swipe your room key to get access to your floor in the hotel. I would recommend the hotel, especially due to the location. We found a really excellent restaurant close by and there were lots to choose from. It's also easy walking distance from the waterfront and Stanley Park as well as shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic getaway”
Reviews.Author: Xanderkat
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here feb 19-20. We requested an artist suite and were impressed with the entire Experience! This was a romantic weekend and I brought a bottle of champagne with me and asked the front desk if they could sneak it into our room while we were at the Margret Cho comedy show. Needless to say the surprise was well received and the entire experience was amazing. Upon our departure, we were pleasantly surprised that when the valet brought our car out front, there was a cute little package of cookies waitin for us on the dash. What a nice little takeaway!! Thank you to all of the Listel hotel staff for going above and beyond!!!

Reviews.Title: “Understated excellence”
Reviews.Author: Richard_MLM
Reviews.Content: Perfectly situated to access the core of Vancouver, the Listel offers unpretentious but finely tuned hospitality that invites a return visit. The themed art displays, the live music and fine dining in O'Douls restaurant (attached), the quiet and spacious rooms all make for a very pleasant hotel experience. One very nice feature is that if you use the hotel parking (recommended), you can keep your car there with full access till 6 p.m. even after you check out at noon. An "extra" like that is indicative of the service emphasis at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay - as always”
Reviews.Author: geoff b
Reviews.Content: I always choose Listel (I have been coming back here for several trips now). I just feel so comfortable in the place - the art theme, the gentle jazz music background, the friendliness of the staff etc etc. It is in a good location for hitting the main street of shops, or for the stroll round Stanley Park, or for getting to the waterfront, or for things like the city art gallery: all without being in a busy, noisy place. I have never had any problems on any of my stays - if there has any tiny thing I needed it was done quickly and efficiently. I value the good WiFi, the business support etc A place I feel confident about recommending. And in Vancouver - such a great place to be in.

Reviews.Title: “Even the little things were done well”
Reviews.Author: Geoff B
Reviews.Content: This is several times I have returned to stay at the Listel hotel on Robson Street in Vancouver. As in every time previously, this time's stay was relaxing and refreshing. The staff are all cheerful and the rooms well looked after. The WiFi worked well. The meals were good. Good location for the central shopping and tourist areas and for Stanley Park. Even the smallest request was dealt with courteously and effectively.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, fun and suprisingly restful!”
Reviews.Author: JSSSeattle
Reviews.Content: We booked an Artist Suite for a 2-night jaunt to Vancouver for a pre-Valentine's day weekend. The hotel we usually stayed at in the past had recently closed and we were looking for something in the same area that wouldn't be overrun with kids or conventioneers, and we found it at the lovely Listel. The suite was large, the bed comfy, and the bathroom had a deep soaking tub that we made grateful use of after our excursions in the city and on Grouse Mountain. It was clean, the staff pleasant and helpful, and I thought it might be loud since our room fronted onto busy Robson street and we heard some noisy people in our hallway, but it was very quiet and restful. The location is our preferred one in Vancouver, on the west end of the Robson street shopping district, close to Stanley Park, the West End, Davie, and downtown in general. When we checked out we got a nice surprise too - we'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “4 day stay Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Jase495
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel as part of a twin centre break our intial impressions of the hotel was good. Our room was on the second floor with only one lift in operation and no stairs to the second floor which is normally not a problem but at busy times you could wait 10 minutes for a lift! The room itself was adequate but overlooked the waste bins and recycle area, early hours of the morning we would wake to the sound of people going through food bins and a few hours later by the bin men and delivery lorries. The room was directly opposite the service lift and the staff had no consideration to the guests on the floor, I know staff have to work but not all have to be up at 06:30/07:00 hours. Over the course of the stay with execption of 2 staff at the hotel we found that most were ignorant and unhelpful. The only positive thing about this hotel is it was on Robson Street and within walking distance of the City highlights.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location and good service”
Reviews.Author: Abelardof
Reviews.Content: Stayed 8 days at Listel Hotel in Vancouver. It's nice hotel with efficient services. All the times I asked thenfrontbdesk people information about restaurants and other attractions of the city, they were very helpful and gave us great tips.

Reviews.Title: “Not What I Expected.”
Reviews.Author: Caitlin J
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the Listel Hotel, we found out our room had a queen bed instead of a king (as posted on the the hotels.com description). We were subsequently charged a $10 upgrade fee to be moved a room with a king size bed. The room upon entering was anything but "modern", as we were told by the front desk concierge. The room had an old tube TV in a plastic-looking armoire, opposite the bed. The bathroom was so small that the door almost hit the toilet upon entering. The shower/bathtub combo was tiny at best and was not clean. The grout looked as if it had never been cleaned and the overall shower/tub had a dingy, yellow tint. The hook on the back of this bathroom door was hanging by one screw. The bedding was scratchy and overall not comfortable to sleep with. When we gathering our things for checkout, we found a black sock that belonged to neither my boyfriend nor I. When we checked out and gave the valet slip to the front desk concierge, we waited for a half an hour to get our car. We only got the car brought around after the valet noticed us sitting in the lobby and asked us if we were waiting for a cab. He had obviously never gotten the slip. I would never stay at this hotel again because the service was terrible and the room even more so.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for money”
Reviews.Author: drynanshelley
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at The Listel Hotel in Mid December 2011. The hotel was in the perfect location, surrounded by wonderful restaurants, convenience stores and other great shops. The room was a good size and very warm. I did have a problem with the cleanliness though. The top sheet was stained and there were still hairs on the pillows and the towels. Once I complained to the front desk staff everything was put right and I had no further complaints about the cleanliness. The art in the hotel was lovely to look at and the use of a computer and internet in the lobby was nice. If I had one major gripe about the hotel, it would be the parking fee. They charge CAD$26 for parking (I already thought this was high) and then they add 36% taxes (Is that even legal) and the final charge for parking worked out to CAD$35.00 - an exhorbitant amount in my opinion. It cost me less to hire the vehicle per day. I landed up parking down the road and running every few hours to ensure the meter never ran out. A small inconvenience but much cheaper. Other than that, I would recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest staff you'll ever meet”
Reviews.Author: kateisadog
Reviews.Content: I emailed and called the hotel a few times before making a reservation. At all times the staff responded immediately to my questions and offered suggestions about touring Vancouver. The Listel in on a busy street lined with restaurants and shops of varying costs. The hotel is very nice - large rooms for a city. We stayed in standard rooms ( there are two other levels of room). The only drawback was there were very few drawers to unpack into - shelved wooden baskets instead. Attractive but not too practical. VERY NICE art all over the hotel - from the lobby to the small attached gallery there were sculptures, paintings, photographs. Much less expensive than the name brand hotels and a nicer experience. Just be aware of the crazy tax rates in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Listel is Home away from home”
Reviews.Author: JohnatNanoose
Reviews.Content: The staff, facilities and food are exceptional. I have been staying at Listel on Robson for years. It is my home away from home. I highly recommend for business or pleasure. While cuisine is top drawer Robson Street also offers many other dining experiences within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Repeat customers”
Reviews.Author: ihatepavelbure
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this contemporary boutique hotel three times and about to make a fourth trip in a matter of weeks. We always have a comfortable and pleasant stay. The service at both the Listel and the restaurant downstairs, O'Doul's, has been consistently above par in our stays here. During the Olympics when we were in town (we stayed elsewhere, however, due to Olympic committees booking 90% of the existing hotel rooms in the city) we had a few drinks in O'Doul's to watch the Canada/Russia game, and the restaurant manager wandered by and gave us tickets to a medal ceremony for no apparent reason. The property is conveniently located on entertaining Robson street which is chock full of restaurants and shopping; we are big hockey fans and previously enjoyed the large sports bar across the street but on our last trip we sadly noticed it has been replaced by a Greek restaurant, which for most people will probably be a nice upgrade. O'Doul's offers a very tasty breakfast and, apparently, live music most weekend nights. I wouldn't know because there are so many great restaurants in the area at which to eat at that I never have had dinner there. I can particularly recommend Joe Forte's on the corner of Thurlow and Robson which has a great rooftop dining area in the summers. Of course, the hotel has a bunch of art in the lobby gallery and scattered around the building. Although they make a point of saying the rooms are also appointed with local art, most guests probably wouldn't notice--the room art is really not that conspicuously different from any other hotel of this caliber. One or two pieces in a room is not enough to make a difference. It does make the lobby more engaging, however. The Listel is appropriately, possibly even well, priced. It is an elegant, quiet but not stodgy hotel. We are a young childless couple ourselves, so I never really noticed, but thinking back on it now I realize we haven't come across any families here. Cars are valet-parked and are returned to you with a few cookies wrapped up with a thank-you note--a cute touch. Highly recommended for business travelers or adults traveling with either mature or nonexistent children.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: LilyPonds
Reviews.Content: For a hotel that was much more reasonable than alot of other central hotels this was a real find. The rooms were huge with lovely designs. There were quirky pieces of art/sculptures around the hotel also which we loved. The location was second to none and the staff were very friendly. Hight recommned with no hesitation. We stayed a week and would go back in a heartbeat. We travelled Oct 2009.

Reviews.Title: “West End Walkup”
Reviews.Author: Don T
Reviews.Content: We do an annual trip to Vancouver and we find the Listel Hotel to be perfectly situated for our needs. Right in the heart of the West End and adjacent shopping district, this boutique experience complete with spa area,jazz bar,and art displays provides both a homey retreat and a jump off for the sights and sounds of city life. The pluses are huge; walking distance to Stanley Park, the fabulous restaurants on West Georgia, and the entertainment in a number of great venues makes us as reliable as the annual migration of Canada geese.

Reviews.Title: “Location and reliability with an artsy touch”
Reviews.Author: K-MACH
Reviews.Content: The Good: -- Location. nicely located about the center of the city, with convenient access to downtown as well as Stanley Park, Chinatown and Gastown. -- Live jazz on the weekend, free wine tasting, friendly and helpful staff, nice artwork around. The acceptable: Room: I think I ended up in one of the older rooms here. The furniture, the tv and the accents were a bit older. The room was otherwise nicely cleaned, efficiently designed and quiet. I did get a good rest. Wifi: The reception was fine, even though I was in a corner room. Gym: i used the gym in the building, which was sufficient for what i wanted to do. There were 3 cardio and 1 weight stations. I was the only one there which also made it comfortable. I haven't tried the pass to the fancy gym. The Bad: can't think of anything. I'm quite averse to bad surprises when I'm on business travel. My impression is that this is a very reliable hotel, with a few nice perks to make your stay enjoyable. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Cookandlight
Reviews.Content: Hotel great great location rooms lovely Starbucks across the road

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hampshireman94
Reviews.Content: If you are in Vancouver and looking for a Hotel that makes you feel special then look no further then the Listel I could not fault the service original art makes the stay that bit special and try not to miss the wine tasting Monday to Thursday 5pm until 6pm a chance to sample BC wine and meet fellow guests and friendly informed staff The Hotel is within walking distance of the shops and attractions of Vancouver also they have a very good restaurant

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service, beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: diegoLaLucila
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at The Listel. The hotel staff is very friendly and helpful, the rooms are big and very clean. The area is very nice with many restaurants and shops. Free Internet and printing is a plus. The only complain, it would be nice to have a mini bar, there is even room for it and the furniture is prepared for one.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend for business travelers and leisure”
Reviews.Author: Catherine L
Reviews.Content: Put up quite a few clients and have been really happy. Guests recognition is almost immediate, great perks like free long distance and wifi and a terrific restaurant. Rates offer excellent value, especially in a such a great city as Vancouver

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in downtown Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Micheal84
Reviews.Content: The Listel is a great hotel... it's on Robson in close proximity both to the West End and Downtown. Arriving badly jetlagged after a long haul trip from Europe I was charmed by the warm and friendly service at reception. Great, spacious room with huge comfortable bed. Interesting Aboriginal art in corridors and rooms. Invited to wine tasting which was a nice touch. Hotel places an emphasis on eco-awareness and sustainability. Free, reliable wi-fi. Great mini-bar!

Reviews.Title: “Great place in Downtown”
Reviews.Author: zkotsos
Reviews.Content: Excellent customer service and attention to detail.

Reviews.Title: “Great small hotel, has it all”
Reviews.Author: Nancy P
Reviews.Content: I regularly stay in this beautiful small hotel in downtown Vancouver. Has comfortable rooms, including the special touch of window seats/lounges. The art work in the rooms, halls and lobby is spectacular, including Aboriginal artwork from the Museum of Anthropology. The rooms have great minibar selections. The hotel offers regular wine tastings in a gallery off the lobby, a great opportunity to relax, enjoy art, and chat with others before dinner. The hotel's restaurant O'Doulls has delicious westcoast fare, great service and is wonderfully spacious. So many additional tailored touches make this hotel special, such as the option of free coffee delivered to your room in the morning. The internet service is not an additional cost. All of this makes a visit to this hotel a pleasure. And for me it is also important that this hotel is environmentally conscious - its cosmetic products are not delivered in plastic containers that end up in the landfill, and multiple types of recycling are observed.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Hab2trvl
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the Listel Hotel pre-cruise in late September and had a really great time. We came in with a small group and enjoyed terrific treatment from Mia and the entire staff. They were extremely friendly and knowledgeable, answering all our many questions, making fun suggestions and helping us arrange transportation to the port. This is a gem of a boutique hotel with a perfect location on Robson St. within easy walking distance of many fine restaurants and abundant shopping. Also, it’s in walking distance to Canada Place and Stanley Park. The hop-on hop-off bus is just a couple of blocks away and we got a discount from the front desk. As befits Vancouver as a whole, this is a totally green hotel, with recycle containers in the room and the shampoo, conditioner and hand lotion in metal or glass containers. We were upgraded to a Gallery room, which includes French-pressed coffee or tea delivered to your room every morning. That was a very nice touch. The room was nicely decorated and spacious enough for our needs. The bed was also very comfortable. We had no trouble using the free Wi-Fi and took advantage of the free local phone calls. Right next to the Listel (in fact, you don’t even have to leave the hotel) is O’Doul’s Restaurant. They have a brunch on Saturday and Sunday which we enjoyed a lot. Their pleasant bar area also made for a great get-together spot for our group. All in all, it couldn’t have been a better experience!

Reviews.Title: “Classy little boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: UnrepentantFoodie
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here over and over on many overnight trips to Vancouver. The art work, the well appointed rooms, the efficient staff, the location--it's always just what I need for the price.

Reviews.Title: “I'd give this hotel a solid "B" rating”
Reviews.Author: NYC_EM
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in August and found the hotel to be a good value for the price. It's not a luxury hotel and doesn't have the personalization that comes with a luxury hotel HOWEVER it is a good mid tier hotel. The staff were always pleasant during interactions and accommodating with requests. The hotel does have a cold feeling when entering and I think this is due to the lobby setup. The rooms are adequate but could use a refurbishment. All furniture is in good working condition just in my opinion doesn't suit "coolness" that they're trying to obtain with the lobby design. Overall I would recommend this hotel in the future if you're looking for a safe, clean and comfortable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely stay here again.”
Reviews.Author: LianeLinstead
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at The Listel for a long weekend. We arrived to check-in at around 10:30pm after 2 long flights. The staff greeted us with big smiles and were helpful and efficient, which was very welcome, as we had a teen and a 10 year old with us. The room (on a gallery floor) was comfortable and clean, and had a fully stocked mini-bar. We ordered room-service on the first night, and received prompt friendly service. We had the option of receiving fresh tea or coffee delivered to our room each morning. We took advantage of this and ordered coffee all three mornings. My husband is a confirmed coffee snob, and so he was pleasantly surprised to find that the coffee met with his approval. Breakfast for 2 mornings was in the hotel restaurant, O'Douls. We couldn't fault it. There was a great range of dishes available. When we informed our waiter of our 10 year old son's picky appetite, he was more than happy to arrange a breakfast that our son would, and did, enjoy. We had the same waiter the next morning, and when my son asked for "the same as yesterday', this gentleman remembered exactly what that was, right down to how our son likes his eggs cooked, and what type of tea I liked. I'm just sorry that I don't remember his name. We found the desk staff to be friendly and extremely helpful. The various information and suggestions for family dining and sightseeing were spot-on, and suited us right down to the ground. On check-out, we were looked after by a great guy by the name of Sebastien (who we had received great service from throughout our stay). All of the staff that we came in contact with were polite and friendly. The Listel is in the middle of downtown Vancouver, and everything we wanted to see and do was within walking distance. We loved staying at The Listel, and loved the wide range of art displayed. I highly recommend staying at this great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant accomodation..”
Reviews.Author: italtraveller
Reviews.Content: We purchased coupon for our stay which allowed us a reduced rate and used it over the November 11 long-weekend to have a mini-vacation. The staff were all friendly and helpful and the rooms were more than adequate. The beds were quite comfortable, but would have been nice to have been provided with two pillows each. Eave though our room faced Robson Street, it was very quiet and the blackout curtains work well at keeping it dark. We did not order any meals so cannot comment on the room service food. I found additional the parking fee to be overpriced and some consideration should be given to guests at the hotel. Including taxes it was approximately $35.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently great service and first choice for accomodations”
Reviews.Author: yukon_cala_lily
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Listel more than a dozen times in the past year and a half while down for work. It is our first choice to stay and sigh a little bit when we have to stay somewhere else, like a convention hotel. We choose it as it is a boutique hotel, excellent staff and clean/ comfortable rooms. These people just don't miss. I like their commitment to being green -high end bathroom products in a dispenser rather than throw away containers and extensive recycling facililities. Parking fees are steep but it is downtown Vancouver. We need a car for work and have an infant; it would be nice to catch a break on parking if you are staying multiple nights.

Reviews.Title: “10 days stay and found a home from home!”
Reviews.Author: Paul S
Reviews.Content: I was a little concerned when I travelled on a business trip to stay at a hotel for 10 days. However the listel became a home from home. Comfortable, clean, friendly staff and wondrful food. Especially the breakfast!! A very well placed hotel to explore Vancouver and surrounding area. I would recommend a Whale watching trip, the shuttle bus from Steveston picks up from across the road, great day out! Thank you to all at the Listel!!

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located, artsy, ecco, clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: skeletoncrew
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights, my room was on the 6th floor (Museum floor) overlooking Robson street. Staff was very professional and polite, they made me feel welcome. Hotel is quiet and clean, room was kept clean as well. Mattress on my king bed was very uncomfortable, I have no idea how old it is, but I was stiff every morning. My second objection is the old tube TV and very loud and outdated heating unit. Hotel offers free wi fi and free local and long distance calls within Canada and US and prides itself in protecting the environment. Lots of dining options and Starbucks is across the street. This hotel has high taxes, I think it came to 20% so at the end you pay for free wi fi and long distance and all the recycling and environment protection.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting art-filled hotel in the heart of Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: FCAGENT
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Listel for two nights and found it overall to be quite enjoyable. As a travel agent, I liked that the hotel was very centrally located on the heart of Robson Street, which made for easy walking to lots of good shopping and dining. Robson Street is one of the best areas in Vancouver to explore and the hotel was in a perfect location for doing so. The rooms themselves were quite spacious: I stayed in a second floor standard room. The room itself was massive, with enough space for a nice desk, a chair and a couch in the room. The furniture was in good condition and the bed was extremely comfortable. The windows were large, allowing lots of natural light in, and the air conditioner worked well (almost too well!). Where I had a problem with the room was in the bathroom: it was quite small, and the positioning of the door made it more like a watercloset than a bathroom. The shower and toilet were inside the door, with the mirror and sink outside it. The hotel did have a boutique feel to it with art scattered around every floor I visited and in the main lobby; interesting and definitely of value if you are an artsy person. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to my clients for the right price, which in off-season, seems to be pretty frequently available.

Reviews.Title: “Two nights on Robson Street”
Reviews.Author: jetset820
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Listel Hotel this Halloween weekend. There was a Groupon available that made this a good value, however with parking and taxes we didn't end up saving that much. Parking is a bit on the expensive side (around $30), although from what I'm told that's the case all over Vancouver. The hotel itself is nice, but nothing lavish. The location is ideal for those who want to explore Robson. It's just on the outside of all of the action, making for a quick 5 minute walk into the heart of things (robson & granville). The room was clean, staff friendly and accommodating. Some features were slightly outdated such as the heating unit and TV. They skimped a bit on storage -- our room had one standard closet and only two small flimsy drawers for other items. Beds were stiff and pillows were slightly uncomfortable. We didn't spend a lot of time in the room, but we were definitely satisfied overall.

Reviews.Title: “Another one night stay.”
Reviews.Author: bradshawbunch
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in the middle of the Vancouve shopping areas. The dest clerks were way above average as they did everything possible to make our stay one of the best.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, convenient”
Reviews.Author: bassyogi
Reviews.Content: The Listel strikes a good balance between cost and amenities. Situated on Robson Street, it is close enough to be convenient, but just far enough from the center of things to be peaceful. We were upgraded by one floor (to Gallery) when we checked in (no reason given), and given the choice of street-facing or rear-facing room. Street-facing featured a comfy window seat that we used for people watching, but with the windows closed it was still quiet. The rooms on this floor also entitled us to free french-press coffee (delivered) each morning--a wonderful bonus. The staff were very helpful with activities and navigation; a slow-draining tub also was fixed immediately. There are a ton of great restaurants and shops within a very short walk. There's a great creperie a half-block away on Jervis, but the on-site breakfast is also good. (O'Douls is also a nice restaurant/jazz joint at night.) Parking is expensive (as explained on their website). I enjoyed everything about the Listel except for the bed--which was too hard. I made it less uncomfortable by folding up the spare blanket and placing it on top of the mattress, but still did not get restful sleep. (My companion had no complaints about the bed and slept well.)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel On Robson Street”
Reviews.Author: diamond6Phoenix_AZ_
Reviews.Content: The Listel is a great hotel within steps to most major attractions. It is a smaller hotel with a nice staff, clean rooms and a comfy room. This was my second trip to Vancouver and I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel. The Room was nice and warm unlike the other hotel I stayed at where the heat was non-existent. All in all this one was a winner.

Reviews.Title: “Robson Street”
Reviews.Author: madhatter71
Reviews.Content: Perfect location as you can easily walk from hotel to Canada Place (good restaurants) or the other way to the beaches and Granville island. Staff really helpful and allowed us to use the showers even after check out time.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, shame about the extra charges”
Reviews.Author: countszero
Reviews.Content: Got this as a deal and never would have chosen it otherwise. The location would be appealing to the shopping crowd as it's right on one of the main streets, but if you're looking to see Vancouver I'd go elsewhere. As an ex-resident of Van I am aware of the difficulty finding reasonable parking, but when there is a parking garage in the basement of the hotel I would have expected it not to cost a third of the price of the room(plus tax). The staff are pleasant enough as long as you don't want to use the luggage trolley without supervision (where IS all the art they talk about anyway?) but the rooms are tired and in need of renovation. With a boutique hotel you don't expect the bath tap to drip all night or the cracked bathroom sink to look like it's out of a dodgy motel. So, nice enough if you're in town for shopping, but don't think about driving in from out of town or you'll be crippled by the parking.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kalin M
Reviews.Content: We throughly enjoyed staying at this hotel, the rooms were more modern but nice and comfortable. The big draw is the restaurant in house, O'Douls. Amazing amazing food. It's within walking distance to Stanley park but it's slightly lacking in a good nightlife location.

Reviews.Title: “The Listel”
Reviews.Author: SandS_Monkey
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Listel twice whilst on holiday in Vancouver. The first room was on the small side but in much better condition that the second room we stayed in, which was in need of repair (4th floor, Gallery Rooms). Unfortuntely we weren't able to change rooms, but seeing as it was for only one night, we didn't mind too much. The hotel staff were all polite, friendly and helpful. Parking is available, but little on the pricey side. The location is perfect for the Westend and Stanley park area of Vancouver, with lots of restaurants close by.

Reviews.Title: “Wifi sucks, parking expensive”
Reviews.Author: Closetlovers
Reviews.Content: Website touted a more interesting and luxurious stay than reality. Everything was pretty average. Wifi was very poor! Difficult to get email downloaded much less view websites. Valet parking expensive- but we knew that going into it. nice wine reception each evening and good location

Reviews.Title: “The best all-around class and comfort ive had”
Reviews.Author: elle1228
Reviews.Content: I am a high-level creative professional. Picky when it comes to tastes and style. This hotel and its staff were fantastic. They gave me printed directions of each place i needed to go, were prompt and treated me very well even with the fantastic price I was able to get through a third party purchase. We recently acquired a company in Vancouver and travel here is becoming quite common. I have already recommended this hotel to our top level executives as i was that impressed. There is good jazz downstairs in the restaurant at night and a wine reception with the restaurant managers. The restaurant is not only excellent but a local favorite. Art scupltures decorate the hotel from various artists. The bed and room were excellent. Excellent location. Beside great shopping and easy to drive in and out from to North Vancouver where our new office is located. I travel alone most of the time, but i did not feel like i was, because they took such great care of me. I recommend this hotel to anyone that wants to sleep like they are at a Hyatt or Hilton high-end hotel but with the uniqueness a boutique hotel is able to offer. It offers the ability to venture out if wanted or to hideaway in your room and sleep or work late into the night if needed in quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in Listel and enjoy Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: nouran43
Reviews.Content: We arrived the beautiful city of Vancouver 4 days before our west coast cruise and it was our first visit to the city ,we made our reservation through the Internet and we were absolutely lucky , you know, when you are coming from the other side of the planet you do not need to make the wrong choice for where you stay ,the Listel hotel was the right one in every thing. From the location to the house keeping every thing was perfect , it is a walking distance from the English beach , the harbor , the bus station to Stanley park .the room was large and beautiful and best of all is the welcoming stuff , Marino ,Sherri, Anthony ,Jesse ,Cana and Sebastian,they were so helpful and friendly . The restaurant of the hotel is very classy and the food is great too.I hope we can visit Vancouver in a few months and no doubt we will stay in the Listel.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in nice location.”
Reviews.Author: MPLSKevin
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three days while on a business trip. The hotel is a little hard to find from the street, but once you are the it is quite comfortable. The staff are very friendly. The bed was comfortable, with great warm blnakets. The bathroom was a little small, but totally useable. There is free wifi throughout the hotel. There is a gym, but the equipment is pretty old. The hotel is an easy walk to museums, restaurants, and shops.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, excellent value.”
Reviews.Author: robandphyl
Reviews.Content: The room was good, and the location was excellent. MANY restaurants, bars, and whatever are within easy walking distance. The hop-on hop-off bus stop is only a block away. Having a pc rather than an i-something, I had no problems at all with internet access. The staff was helpful and very pleasant and friendly. Unlike a previous reviewer, I did NOT find the art selections to be "poncey"; rather, I thought all the pieces were exceedingly well-chosen, and I felt as though the art brightened my day. Free phone calls are a real plus. The parking charge IS annoying, but, as they say, all the Vancouver hotels charge similarly. If and when I come back to Vancouver, this is where I will stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, bad wifi”
Reviews.Author: tratliff73
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because of its location. The proximity to Stanley Park and numerous downtown attractions and restaurants was wonderful. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The 24/7 valet service was handy (and required for a price as there is no parking other than on the street). The hotel and room decor was very nice and everything I expected. The hallways were a little dark for my taste, but it did add some ambiance. We slept with the window open and had very little city noise, even in the morning rush hour. Our biggest complaint was the unavailability of the "free" wifi for iOS devices (iPhone and iPad). The contracted "help desk" company for the wifi was useless and I knew more about the routers and iOS options than he did. After referring to his manual he promised a callback after consulting a different department. We never recived the callback. Thankfully I had my Android tablet and was able to connect through it. Being from the US an not having an international plan since we were only staying for two nights, having wifi was a big deal for us to avoid data roaming charges. Thankfully there were a couple of coffee shops within a block that had free wifi. If you don’t care so much about the free internet access, this is a great hotel to stay at. Would have been a five star stay for me if not for the internet issues.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: maxepr1
Reviews.Content: Great hotel and location! Staff is very friendly, unlike the previous reviewers I believe management is reading and correcting there complaints. The staff was overly friendly and gave us some great help with things to see and do! Very clean and quite. Will stay again if we go back up!

Reviews.Title: “We would not hesitate to return”
Reviews.Author: KINGHOPWAS
Reviews.Content: The Listel was conveniently located on Robson Street (described by our 'hop on hop off' trolley bus driver as the place to see and be seen) at the heart of downtown Vancouver from where we were able to explore this fantastic city. The Waterfront, Stanley Park, Gas Town were all within easy walking distance. For trips further afield there was a bus stop close by and a convenient place to jump on the city tour buses or the free transport to Capilano Canyon outside the nearby Blue Horizon Hotel. The staff were friendly helpful and informative. Our breakfast waitress directed us to the extensive underground mall just a few blocks away and the magnificent Metrotown Mall which we reached on the Sky Train rapid transport system ($3dollars for 90 minutes use). The hotel had a lively restaurant and bar with live jazz every night. Not cheap but we didn't find anywhere in Canada that was - except for the excellent Old Spaghetti Factory chain (which has a restaurant in Vancouver's Gas Town) where we had a 3 course meal for $13. Our bedroom was large with a very comfortable King Size bed and a pleasant view of the street and glimpses of the water. The complimentary morning cup of tea or coffee brought to the room at the time of your choosing was a nice touch. There was lots of interesting art and particularly fascinating were the male and female wire statues by the elevators which, when given a gentle nudge, would dance! The free WiFi worked well on both laptop and iPhone. We would not hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Seasports
Reviews.Content: A great little hotel in a great location. The staff was very nice and accommodating. We were able to walk to Stanley Park and Gastown with no problem. Lots of great places to eat with one of them being the onsite restaurant. Room was clean and we had a great view from the 6th floor of the harbour and marina. I would pay for the upgrade to the top floors. And the window opened so no AC was needed! Be prepared for the extras costs like parking and some green fee the hotel tacks on but with free internet, free local and long distance calls, free faxing, you really can't beat it. The WiFi was pretty slow but it could have just been our location in the hotel. And the cookies on the dash of our car as we left was a nice touch. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location, good staff”
Reviews.Author: esfleming
Reviews.Content: - Very nice location, restaurants, stores, supermarket everything on walking distance - Nice staff, well informed about the city, good service - Negative point: parking VERY expensive. 32 canadian dolars a day!

Reviews.Title: “Location could be better”
Reviews.Author: Mothma
Reviews.Content: Suites much better than standard rooms. Stayed first time in same week and got an upgrade to a suite which was fantastic! Stayed later again in week returning to Vancouver and had a top floor room which was tiny! And poor views from back of hotel overlooking back street and some houses! Clean and ok though as a stop over. Plus great cloud 9 revolving restaurant just a walk away down the road.

Reviews.Title: “$22.95 plus taxes for chocolate is a sauce”
Reviews.Author: NVZ5BKUQ
Reviews.Content: IT MIGHT BE some people's cup of freshly percolated coffee and this hotel might be typical of any located in the centre of a city, but it wasn't what I needed when I stayed in Vancouver for two nights. Adding value to a hotel is difficult once you have got a comfortable bed, plenty of pillows, a decent TV and double shower curtains in every room. If you go down the boutique route, which is what the Listel has done, then you buy in a lot of poncey statuary, hang a lot of poncey limited edition prints on the walls, put in some arty chairs that are as comfortable as a park bench, put the curtains (inexplicably) on the outside of the nets and call yourself a museum. You redesign the lobby so it doesn't look like a hotel and leave your staff wondering whether you want them to be friendly or aloof. You put a small mini-mart in each room (including a hotel branded bottle of chocolate sauce branded as a Romance Kit for $22.95 not including taxes). After all, you can charge over the odds for everything because they are staying in a 'museum' and you have got to pay for that artwork somehow. Internet access is a good example. You can't use the WiFi because, thanks to the condominiums that surround the hotel, there are literally one hundred wireless networks competing for the bandwidth. You have got more chance of getting a signal from SETI than you have from the hotel WiFi. You can borrow an Ethernet cable from Reception at which point your speed will go up from 0.12Mbps to 2.14Mbps but you have to put down a deposit of $20 for the cable, which is my point. Why $20? Why not $50 or $5 (which would be the cost of replacing the cable)? Everything has been priced just below the level at which you would refuse to pay and well above the level that it ceases to be good value. Now you might say that it is refundable and set at that level to remind you to give it back, which is fair enough, to which I would retort "Have you ever tried to plug an Ethernet cable into your iPhone or iPad?" I know parking in cities is a problem. In London most people don't keep a car and use public transport. If you are on a holiday where you have just driven half-way across Canada in a car you don't have much choice. Parking at the the hotel for two days cost $70, once you have included tax (nothing is ever quoted inclusive of tax, as a rule of thumb it adds 20% to everything). This is just below the point at which you might park your car somewhere else and the hotel reserves the right to park your car somewhere else for you, including on the street. When you arrive they tell you your car will be in secure parking, then when they give you the ticket it says that it is not guaranteed to be secure, it might be parked on the street, it might get damaged and you give up all rights to sue them for their negligence and lack of duty of care and no employee of theirs in the world has any authority to say anything different. Notices of this kind (excluding liability for negligence or lack of duty of care) are not legal where I come from. If you are reading this and you are from the hotel, then I hereby absolve myself from negligence in writing this review under the laws of British Columbia. How do you like that? You can stay in this hotel despite all of the above. It is in a good area to explore Vancouver. It is reasonably quiet before 8am (we were on the back). There is a nice Italian restaurant (Zefferelli's) a hundred yards up the road. The staff are friendly and you can pick up and drop off your car as often as you like, but there is something about the whole city rip-off experience that is profoundly depressing. If I was coming to Vancouver again I would stay out of town at a car-friendly hotel and commute in (the traffic is not so bad), parking is easy at the tourist spots and if I wanted to go see a museum - I would.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great price, watch out for the service charge!”
Reviews.Author: DaveK1981
Reviews.Content: We spent 7 days at the Listel on Robson St. for a conference + 2 days of playing around Vancouver. Really nice hotel and very fairly priced. Massive comfy beds, very clean, good facilities (gym was great). The only thing we were surprised by was the additional charge that was called the spa luxury fee or something like that... we had gotten a really good deal online though, so it was still well worth it, and to be fair, it was listed in the bottom of the original online booking.

Reviews.Title: “good for Robson St. shoppers”
Reviews.Author: WhitehorseYukonJane
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Listel Hotel several times - admittedly through hotwire bookings where you get a discount, - but the hotel is pleasant, reasonably priced, has nice art and is quiet. My only criticism is that it is a little far from the train/transit system if you are going to be using that. The hotel is at the end of the Robson St. shopping area, away from the centre, so you get some walking in. If you have a car, it would probably be better than other more central hotels just to stay out of the thick of things.

Reviews.Title: “Positive Experience. Would return.”
Reviews.Author: tr8vler
Reviews.Content: My wife and I wanted to spend a couple nights in Vancouver and luckily found the Listel. We really enjoyed the whole experience--Room, building, staff, parking. The staff was especially accommodating, friendly, and competent. The rooms were well appointed, clean, and comfortable. We also enjoyed the live music at the adjoining restaurant. The location on Robson St. put nearly the entire downtown within walking distance. Overall, our stay was a positive experience from start to finish. We would stay there again and recommend it to friends.

Reviews.Title: “great location, bad value for the money you pay”
Reviews.Author: antigoneCH
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Listel hotel in August for a big conference in Vancouver. The hotel is located on Robson st, main shopping street of Vancouver and very short walking distance to main attractions. Besides this positive point, it's hard to say anything good about this hotel: it's rated four star and costs an arm and a leg, but our room looked like in a cheap motel. Bathroom was set in cheap ceramics and plastic that looked like from the 70s, and soap and shampoo was in wall mounted dispenser! no courtesy set whatsoever! (for comparison, just a few days before we stayed in Auberge de Vieux Port in Montreal which was also four star, cost less, but had wonderful wooden-set rooms and Gilchrist&Soames soaps). There was no breakfast included (though at that price it could be easily afforded); the tea service was nice but we had it just twice in six days stay. The highly advertised artworks in the rooms could not cover the miserable quality of the room. Final touch was a coffin-like ceiling you could touch with your hand and a view on gargbage containers in some side street. Overall: if it cost 70-100$ it could be ok, but at 250$ it's a robbery.

Reviews.Title: “I really wanted to love it...”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Quincers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had been scoping out hotels in Vancouver for a while for a small leg of our Honeymoon. We were interested in some pricier hotels, but when The Listel popped up on sale on Jetsetter we got excited, as it meant we could fit three nights in Vancouver (budget wise) as opposed to two and still stay someplace that seemed nice. As everyone has said, the guest services staff were very helpful and friendly. We were surprised too with an upgrade upon check in to one of the suites. Unfortunately, it was a bit of a let down. I had booked a "Gallery Floor" room, wanting to be higher up and looking forward to the decor. What we ended up with was a larger suite (didn't even use the extra space) that was hardly a step up from the Hampton Inn (except I'm sure they have in-room safes). The chairs in the living room area were so worn thin that when we sat down we were practically on the floor. The bed was also very springy. The TV was teeny. The AC worked, but was very loud and took a while to cool off. They also placed us on the second floor, right next to the elevator and we experienced a bit of noise. We also had a terrible non-view - overlooking windows and rooftop from the restaurant. A shame as if we would have been one floor up we would have seen the mountains. I also have to say, there was NO artwork in the room that made it stand out. Just a couple framed pictures of boats or something, I can't even remember. Price wise we were happy we got to stay the extra night in Vancouver. We were in walking distance to downtown and gastown (for us... maybe not for all) and Robson Street certainly had lots to offer. We took advantage of the free shuttle to Grouse Mountain and ate some pretty fantastic meals (Vij's is definitely worth the cab ride and the wait). I'm not going to say we didn't have a great time, because we really did. The staff and location were first rate. All in all, I just felt a little let deceived by the hotel website and also Jetsetter. Both really sold the property up to be something different and great. If I had a clearer picture of what I was getting I might not be so let down.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: BarryMip
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our honeymoon for a couple of nights prior to exploring the Rockies. The hotel was very clean and charming on arrival. The hotel staff were all very friendly and always greeted you with a smile. The hotel itself is a funky arty type place and was quirky and different to other hotels. It is ideally situated on Robson Street pretty much in the heart of Vancouver and everywhere of interest was easy walking distance away. We were upgraded on arrival and the suite we got was large, roomy and very comfortable. If we were to visit Vancouver again we would definately stay here. Oh and breakfast was very good too.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place, wonderful people”
Reviews.Author: awmonro
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at the Listel Hotel and I was very pleased with the personal service I received from all staff. The "art museum" qualities of the decor were captivating and at times even whimsical. For example, there are steel wire sculptures in some hallways that react should you brush by them. I grinned more than once while watching these "ladies dance" before the elevator door closed. Some rooms are specially appointed with art work that does its share of taking an edge off a busy day. I loved the location. Vancouver is an awesome city and this hotel is a 20 minute walk to Stanley Park. I rented a bike and took a spin around the bike path and was just delighted by the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Mary F
Reviews.Content: The Hotel/Gallery was so aesthetic and comfortable. French Press coffee delivered to our door in the mornings! We slept like babies. The surrounding area was active and exciting, great restaurants everywhere. The concierges helped us with driving directions, maps, and local tips.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, just a short walk from central Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: foxo_82
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my girlfriend for 4 nights in August 2011 on the first leg of a Canadian-US tour. We certainly have no complaints - the staff were very courteous and helpful. Our room was very comfortable and clean with a good sized bed. There was a mini bar which we didn't use. There was no safe in the room but valuables could be left with the staff at reception. The hotel is ideally located on Robson Street, which has many shops, bars and restaurants just a short walk away. There is a restaurant abd bar connected to the hotel which looked very nice and was always popular but we didn't go there. Despite its fairly central location the hotel is just far enough up Robson Street away from the central area tso that the noise isn't a problem. I should point out that our room was at the back of the hotel so it was very quiet, just looking out onto a residential street; however it didn't strike me as being too noisy even if we'd been based at the front of the hotel. Central Vancouver is very compact and we were able to walk from the hotel to downtown in about 15 minutes, Stanley Park in about 20 minutes and a similar distance west to Sunset Beach and the water taxi across to Granville Island. Getting from the airport to the hotel is easy enough - just catch the Sky Train Canada Line to the Cty Centre station on Granville Street, which takes about half an hour. From there it's one block to Robson Street in the centre of the downtown area and a further six blocks north to the hotel. Overall, can't fault it.

Reviews.Title: “great location, attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: hihrd1
Reviews.Content: this is one of the cheapest air-conditioned hotels in vancouver... that being said, an air-conditioned room in vancouver would only be needed a few weeks out of the whole year. rooms were tastefully done with a friendly attentive staff. the hotel is very clean. decent eats are up and down robson...greek, indian, thai, sushi, etc...

Reviews.Title: “Better than ever”
Reviews.Author: BandBs
Reviews.Content: We've enjoyed staying at the Listel in Vancouver several times and are glad we went back. The cost is reasonable for Vancouver and the quality of the breakfast is much better than on our previous visits. We got room with breakfast included, which was served in the hotel restaurant from the full breakfast menu. The location is excellent also. Lots of shops around and within walking distance of other restaurants and the Art Museum. Catching the bus for the Archaeological Museum at UBC was easy--just a ca. two or three short block walk. Staff very helpful. Decor was very good. The airport shuttle stops at this hotel, so another convenience. Overall a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was great but the Listel staff was INCREDIBLE!!!”
Reviews.Author: SKGJ
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Listel VERY MUCH! The staff was very helpful in recommending restaurants and activities that fit our style and budget! They had a wine hour while we were there that was a great way to meet and swap stories with other guests! They made every effort to make us feel at home! Thanks Listel staff!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location for Exploring Vancouver!”
Reviews.Author: MaplePondHoppers
Reviews.Content: The Listel Hotel is perfectly situated for exploring Vancouver. English Bay and Stanley Park are only a 10 minute walk; the seawall walk along Coal Harbour is even closer. The Pacific Centre and Canada Place are about a 15 minute stroll as is the Aquabus to Granville Island. The hotel is really in the heart of tourist Vancouver. Robson Street is packed with every flavor of restaurant - all conveniently nearby. The hotel staff are friendly and professional. The hotel is nicely decorated with interesting pieces of art. The rooms are tasteful and comfortable. There is free wi-fi as well as free long distance (Canada & USA). Unfortunately there are no room safes - valuables must be checked at the front desk - for us this was the only negative. All in all - a great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location...yet not as fancy as I thought it would be!”
Reviews.Author: ChristaD_1969
Reviews.Content: This place was a great location and the staff was very helpful. They had an awsome in- room recycling program. The tub was great and with Lush just down the street a great option after a long day of walking. Yet I was a little dissapointed because the art was not as intergrated as I thought (basically just pictures on the wall), the bed was uncomfortable and just not the level of luxary I thought it would be. Regardless it was still a great location and would consider staying there again but would not expect as much.

Reviews.Title: “Great Girl's Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa H
Reviews.Content: A girl's get-a-way to Vancouver is exactly what two moms from northern Alberta need in the springtime! We spent four fantastic nights at The Listel Hotel on Robson Street. The Listel Hotel is a beautiful art gallery, boutique hotel. We were treated like royalty, right down to having french press coffee delivered to our room at a time of our choosing in the morning. What an elegant treat for two tired out moms looking for some pampering! The Listel is an easy walk to English Bay, Coal Harbor, and Stanely Park. We enjoyed the warm spring air and beautiful blooming landscape while strolling around the harbor. We explored Stanley Park on foot and also on pedal bike.
