One evening was spent rockin' at The Center for Performing Arts with James Blunt live in concert. Another evening was spent at the Orpheum Theater listening to the Vancouver Symphony Orchestra perform with the talented Natalie MacMaster. Both venues were also within walking distance from The Listel. O'Doul's restaurant at the hotel served a perfect breakfast each morning. There was never any problem finding a restaurant or coffee house close by to revitalize ourselves. The Ciao Bella Restaurant on Denman Street near the entrance to Stanley Park was a wonderful choice for a Tuesday afternoon. The people of Vancouver were friendly and accommodating! One tip for future visitors: Pay attention to the parking rules!! Rush hour parking is tricky! The cab driver who took us to pick up our towed vehicle from the city impound did a great job of entertaining us and keeping us laughing. No matter what your budget, style or taste is for entertainment, food, and shopping, the city of Vancouver will definitely provide a satisfying get-a-way destination!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: don v
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Listel for 4 evenings in early August 2011. Had an upgraded room which was spacious with a sitting area, desk, mini bar at one end and a king bed at the other. Large flat screen TV and free internet as well as long distance calls to Canada and US. Bath was large with enough counter space for both my wife and I able to spread out our toiletries. (this is rare) Everything very clean in room as well as the general hotel. Location is good with plenty of restaurants and shopping within walking distance either direction from hotel. Best part of hotel may be the staff who were all incredibly gracious and helpful. After a couple of days we were recognized by several, including a waitress, bartender, hotel desk staff, and even shift managers. Definitely a place we will return to.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel ...”
Reviews.Author: lorna29
Reviews.Content: I can say nothing wrong about this hotel but if your planning a trip to Vancouver this is the place to stay. Not just for the fact that you can walk out the door and everything is at your feet that's how great it's location is ... this hotel is associated UBC museum so every room is decorated with local art, as is the hotel itself...the rooms are super clean and modern and lack nothing. As for the staff they are super helpful , they even have free local wine tastings every day ...how great is that!! anyhow as mentioned try them out they are worth it!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy”
Reviews.Author: NYandBack
Reviews.Content: Great location on the West End... 10 minute walk to Stanley Park. Very happy with the room and service was great. Stayed 3 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location for a family of 4”
Reviews.Author: jamboe10
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our 3 night stay at the Listel. Our 3 yr old loved playing with the hallway sculptures calling them her robots! I thought it would be to upscale for our two little ones (1yr and 3yrs) but there were other families there of pre teens and teens and the staff was very helpful offering a pack-&-play for our baby. Always greeted with a smile and helped with directions and loading and unloading of the car. Perfect walking distance to kid friendly eateries as well as cafes. The harbor is 2 couple blocks away and we had no problem walking to Stanley Park. Room was clean and spacious for us even with a pack-&-play in there. Got the double bed room on the 2nd floor. No problems with sound; we stayed during the week. Highly recommend!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautifulo Art Work”
Reviews.Author: Beck48
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a gem for art lovers. Throughout the hotel and around the exterior is an amazing array of all kinds of art work Rooms were somewhat smaller than in the US but were very nice and decorated very well. So great to have AC in Canada. Many places in Canada do not have air and it can get a bit hot in August. The location was perfect, close to great restaurants and shopping and close to the water. Restaurant at the hotel was pretty pricey but the food was great. Staff were all very helpful and friendly. I would certainly return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Diane P
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Listel to celebrate my brother-in-law's birthday. All four of us loved this small boutique hotel. The artwork is amazing--original prints in the rooms, sculpture and large format photgraphs in the public areas. The location is great. Right in the heart of the West end on Robson. An easy walk to Stanley Park, English Bay, Vancouver Art Museum and downtown. The staff is very helpful and matches the quality of the hotel. When we commented on the Roethke poem stenciled on the glass wall, the desk clerk gave us a xerox copy of the poem. We left our phone charger in the room, and called the hotel and they mailed us the phone charger at no charge. We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: Grandmano
Reviews.Content: Good central location for shopping, restaurants and the waterfront. The room was comfortable and the staff was good. Lots of art which was interesting but the meeting rooms were never open to see the art in there.

Reviews.Title: “We love this place when we're in Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: PamUK99
Reviews.Content: Downtown, easy walking distance to shopping, Stanley park good transport links. Nice rooms, excellent restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Very good quality, great location.”
Reviews.Author: W-Hartford_CT
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night before setting out on our Alaskan cruise. The location was a 15 minute walk from a train stop, very good restaurants minutes away and a 15 minute walk to the beautiful Stanley Park. The quality of the Listel was very good. Clean, quiet, with a very helpful staff. For the price there was a free wine tasting at night (not sure if that is every night) and a free breakfast. This wasn't a continental breakfast off to the side. You had a breakfast voucher at the restaurant--whatever you wanted off the menu. All in all, a very good hotel I would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “The reviews are wrong - I felt mislead”
Reviews.Author: NumberEleven11
Reviews.Content: I have no idea what the other reviewers are talking about, but we checked in and checked out in two hours. We were on my wife's 40th birthday trip (Seattle, Vancouver, Whistler) and her birthday was during our stay in Vancouver -- there was no way we were staying in the hotel for her 40th birthday. No bellman when we arrived, front desk help was OK, the hotel is EXTREMELY TIRED, the art thing is way overdone, decor is outdated, beds were bad, and bathroom was bad. Similar to another recent review ("I felt duped"), we felt completely mislead by the reviews. I also think that end of Robson is getting pretty spotty, you really want to be about 3 blocks further east, or a few blocks off Robson.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Excellent Service, Great neighborhood.”
Reviews.Author: JJ_492
Reviews.Content: Good service at the desk; helpful with directions. Early check-in with no problems. Comfortable room. Hotel has good security - no access to upper floors without a key card. Wonderful neighborhood for walking and eating. A far better choice than the big hotels downtown.

Reviews.Title: “The Listel: Centrally Located and Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: CDaniels16
Reviews.Content: My 75-year old mother and I stayed at the Listel during a driving trip across western Canada. Front desk staff here were the friendliest and most helpful of all nine hotels we stayed at during our trip. They were genuinely interested in finding out what we wanted to do (activities), what kind of food we wanted (restaurants) and where we wanted to go (destinations) so they could provide up-to-date recommendations and driving directions. Security is good: the hotel elevators require key cards. We didn't try the restaurant but went across the street instead to a local coffee shop and a very good creperie.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, central with jazz in the bar downstairs- perfect!”
Reviews.Author: djwgilroy
Reviews.Content: Amazing service, spotless rooms, great restaurant with jazz but a tiny bit pricey

Reviews.Title: “Nice and good located hotel....”
Reviews.Author: zielkin
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel for 2 nights with my wife. Staff at the reception was very friendly and helpful. Hotel with good location, close to Stanley Park and main shopping area!!! Room what we got was very nice, clean and spacious. Very suprised with free phone calls included to North America ;-) As a negative - parking is not included and they charge you quite a lot for stay :-(

Reviews.Title: “I feel duped by the positive reviews!”
Reviews.Author: modart
Reviews.Content: When I read the reviews for this hotel I wonder whether they can be describing the same place I'm staying in at the moment: the Listel Hotel in Vancouver BC. I'm not in the habit of giving bad reviews, but I simply couldn't let all the glowing reviews stand w/o commenting. First, the positives: .Friendly, helpful, efficient front desk .Central (though not particularly attractive) location .they tried with the furniture (though the wood is scratched and weary) .screened prints with indigenous designs .extra-deep tub .decent towels .wine in the lobby for an hour in the evening .cool concept .quiet hallway .attempt at being green .free (but slow) wifi .free phone calls to states Now, the rest: .after reading the reviews here and in trip advisor I felt shocked when I arrived at a broken down looking 1980's hotel with what appears to be public housing in the back. .booked a room on the museum floor and can't imagine what they mean by museum aside from a couple of indigenous-themed screened prints. .closet door broken .no in-room safe .tv not flat-screened and no printed guide .view from our window of the back alley facing the projects .a wad of someone's already-chewed gum in the drawer .extra-hard bed that sags in the middle, like it's been used for the last 25 years - so bad that we wake up multiple times per night in pain. .not enough pillows and the ones we have are lumpy and under-filled .no continental (or any other kind) of breakfast .running toilet .shower head keeps falling off .worn out carpet .our whole room - and indeed, the whole hotel - feels TIRED and as if they took a broken-down hotel, gave it the barest whiff of a remodel, slapped on a concept, and called it a boutique hotel. It looks not even CLOSE to the pics on the travel sites. .though location is in walking distance to downtown, it's not particularly attractive and in spite of some decent shops it feels a bit seedy. In short, my husband and I booked this hotel for our 10th anniversary, thinking it would be special. We felt deeply disappointed as we arrived, because it's not even close to what we pictured and read about in the reviews. I'd say an appropriate price for our room would be about $80/night, and I wouldn't dream of staying here again unless I could get a room for about that much. As a comparison: the night before I arrived I stayed in a Best Western hotel in Seattle that was about the same vintage. However, we had an extra-large room, an extremely comfortable bed with wonderful linens and excellent pillows, four pillows per bed, flat-screen tv w/guide, full breakfast, everything in perfect working order -- and we paid half of what we paid for our room at the Listel. Will update this later in our stay if our experience improves. For now: I feel duped.

Reviews.Title: “Best value on the market..”
Reviews.Author: f2fashions
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Listel for both business and pleasure. I found the rooms unique and most importantly clean. The Listel has invited me in to their hotels with friendly staff that create an experience similar to being right at home. I also enjoyed the bed and breakfast, finding it to be of great value. Thank you for providing your time to make my travels more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “"The Best Ever"”
Reviews.Author: brucegrossman
Reviews.Content: I know that "Best Ever" is a bit over the top but The Listel is comparable in service to any five star hotel. Every staff person was friendly and helpful in a truly genuine fashion, they ceaselessly made dinner and travel arrangements, offered insider tips and to top it off on the last night they complimented us an appetizer at the restaurant where they had made reservations for us. There are many other perks such beautiful art all over the hotel, french press organic coffee or tea delivered free to your room in the morning, a free wine reception during the week and a fine restaurant/jazz club called O' Douls attached to the Hotel. Unlike some hotels where you have to wait an indefinite period of time if you ask for extra towels or linens at the Listel whatever you ask for is delivered within minutes. Everyone smiles and is polite. The rooms are clean, light and comfortable and include free phone and internet access and the location is central to just about everything in the city. For the price it is honestly the "Best Ever" as far as we are concerned.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved it!”
Reviews.Author: andreaadele
Reviews.Content: The Listel was great in so many ways. Location-wise, it was perfect - very close to everything we wanted to do and a short bus ride from several other attractions. We also enjoyed the ambience of the place - very modern, but comfortable, public and private spaces. Art was everywhere and added a novel touch to our experience. The staff was both friendly and professional and the hotel was spotless. O'Doul's, the attached restaurant, was reasonably priced and served quality food. Live jazz was also available in the evenings - a real plus. We would absolutely return to this place! Had a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel right on fringe of Robson shopping strip - lovely, quiet & reasonable.”
Reviews.Author: j_infinity_w
Reviews.Content: This little hotel is a hidden gem. Attended a business meeting right in the hotel and stayed just the 1 night but will be back. 10 minute walk to the Fish House in Stanley Park (best fish restaurant EVER) and shopped my way all the way to Pacific Centre and back. Desk staff are very accommodating. If you put out a card they bring up fresh french press coffee service to your room in the morning - heavenly taste - way better than those 4 cup coffee makers!

Reviews.Title: “Great location to explore the city.”
Reviews.Author: dfoleychula
Reviews.Content: Great room, very quiet despite the fact that the Jazz Festival was going on downstairs.

Reviews.Title: “It's a typical hotel room - nothing special!”
Reviews.Author: rubidoe
Reviews.Content: We really were expecting an exceptional hotel, especially after all the good reviews. It's a typical hotel room. There are art galleries downstairs, but that is the only thing that makes this hotel stand out. The Pro's of this hotel is the location. It's close to all the shops on Robson street, a 10 min walk to the Sky Train, Sea Bus, and Stanley park. Also the lobby staff was always very helpful. The bad part of the hotel is the smell. It had a weird stench, like covered up smoking air freshener. Also there was not enough counter space in the bathroom. It was very noisy. You have the street noise, as well as the air conditioner noise. And I don't think it really matters what floor you are on. It's just a busy part of town with very loud air conditioners. We used the fitness center, which also had a weird stench to it. I can't get the stench out of my mind. And one of the elevators was out of service which was very annoying. There was not even a stairwell that we could use. I forgot to mention the terrible beds. They were so old. You could feel the springs on your back. And the bed skirt was falling off, and you could see just how old the mattress was. It looked pretty worn. All in all, I would not stay here again unless it was a really good deal, and there were no other options available.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & great service.”
Reviews.Author: 421b
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for 5 nights and because we were celebrating our Ruby Wedding Anniversary they upgraded our room. Service was excellent particularly from the front desk. We also had an excellent meal in their restaurant on our anniversary night.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel, great location, good service other than at breakfast”
Reviews.Author: mandr268
Reviews.Content: my wife and i stayed at the hotel for three nights, the hotel staff were very helpful, the hotel is well located making it easy to get around Vancouver. the only downside was the restaurant. we had breakfast there three times, the first two morniungs the staff were misserable, no smiles , no good days, and service was poor. we had a better waiter on the last day. we ate their one evening, the food was good but again the attitude of the staff was poor. the restaurant lacks a buzz, the restaurant mangement were disconnected which was shame as for that reason i would not go out of my way to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location. We'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: SeattleTraveller11
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the July 4th long weekend. The location is Fantastic; lots of restaurants, gelato places all around, and shopping is just one block away. You could even do a 15 min walk from here to Stanley Park. It has valet parking for $26 a day with unlimited in and outs. The hotel staff is extremely courteous and even gave suggestions for what to do in the area. The rooms themselves were decent, clean, nothing fancy though. For this price point and location, it was great and we will certainly visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel; few flaws, fantastic staff.”
Reviews.Author: ra1irc
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights at the Listel rather than the conference site hotel a few blocks away on Robson. Walkable to some delightful and long term favorite restaurants and downtown. Small amount of minor wear in the well furnished rooms, each with an art theme by floor. Most enjoyable was the the bar, the wine tastings, and the employees, all of them, who add remarkably to a delightful stay. Will definitely stay there again and recommend to friends and associates.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service, central location”
Reviews.Author: anyasp
Reviews.Content: Great central location and lovely rooms, with all of downtown Vancouver within walking distance and everything you could need by the hotel. The thing that really sets this hotel apart, however, is service. The staff are extremely gracious and warm while being totally professional. They go above and beyond to accommodate requests. Free premium coffee, wireless and daily wine tastings are nice perks, too.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in a nice location!”
Reviews.Author: opus36
Reviews.Content: I stayed here as a woman travelling solo.I stayed for 3 nights. In terms of location, being in the middle of Robson St., you are in the heart of the shopping area. Robson St, itself, has a very different vibe to it then any other place in Vancouver. It's lively and funky. The Hotel Listel, itself ,is a nice boutique hotel offering such amenities such as valet parking and very effecient room service. But a word of caution, I would have gladly spent more money for the upgrade to the waterview room. Otherwise the "view from your room is an alleyway in the back. Not very scenic. Check in was effortless with very attentive staff. The hallways in the hotel have artwork from local artists, which was an interesting aspect.

Reviews.Title: “Great little boutique hotel in the heart of Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: 08dctraveler
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal at the Listel through the Vancouver tourism site where we got a $125 gift card to Vancouver attractions (watch out, that $125 doesn't get you very far!) if we spent two nights there. Even before that, though, the rate was good. We were also pleasantly surprised that we received breakfast vouchers for the hotel restaurant, O'Doul's, which is not the Irish pub it sounds like but in fact a really nice restaurant. The breakfasts there were delicious and very filling! We also had a drink there one evening and they have a great local beer and wine selection. The rooms were also really nice - spacious and modern. I think we stayed on a gallery floor, but there is original artwork throughout the hotel and it was really lovely. The room came equipped with everything we needed. Also, they have a daily wine reception in the evening, in which we discovered a really nice British Columbia wine, which we then went out and a bottle of because we enjoyed it so much. The staff was also great - providing us with restaurant recommendations, and even writing down the name of the wine and suggesting a store in which to buy it. They also stored our luggage and let us use the gym locker rooms to change on our travel day, which was nice. Oh, also, free wi-fi is great!

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel so much I stay here even though I don't get any points for it”
Reviews.Author: PegLeg-and-SherBear
Reviews.Content: I knew I would be in Vancouver for a conference the last time I stayed at the Listel and so booked for this most recent trip as I was checking out. There are so many great things about it. It's close enough to the convention centre that you can walk but not so close that you are tempted to run back to it at every break. The reception staff is very welcoming and always make you feel special as you enter the lobby. It's right across the street from a great wine store and an amazing sushi restaurant. Two of the things I am always looking for when on the road. Free internet and free long distance calls are two other great benefits. The bathroom is pretty small but then how much time do I really spend in there. The towels and beds are great. The art work in the rooms and the lobby is very interesting. Some of the furniture is starting to show it's age a bit but in a character adding way not a falling apart way. If I am in Vancouver and have the choice I am staying here.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the location and the staff.”
Reviews.Author: Caudo
Reviews.Content: We were celebrating our anniversary, and the hotel staff (Vera) graciously accommodated our request for a king bed and a high floor. In fact, our room even had a terrace. The hotel's location could not be improved. Almost everything is within walking distance, including great restaurants and boutique shops. Do treat yourself to dinner at O'Doul's, the hotel's restaurant. The chef produced an outstanding three course meal with wine pairings for our dinner. It was one of the best meals we've had in our many trips to Vancouver. We would definitely stay again at The Listel Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely big room in good location”
Reviews.Author: 75sw
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1night at the Listel, booked via our travel agent who got us a free upgrade for early booking. We stayed on the gallery floor where each room has art work by a different artist. The room was lovely with separate bedroom and lounce; the bed was enormous and the view over Ribson street included a bit of the mountains in the background. Nice big bathroom and complimentary tea or coffee brought to the room was a nice touch. Free wifi in the room, but surprisingly no free bottled water. We didn't have breakfast there (wasn't included so we went out for it instead). Reception staff were helpful at pointing out where to eat.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place on the quieter end of Robson”
Reviews.Author: Osdanuwati
Reviews.Content: Hotel feels small - from the reception to the elevators, hallways and rooms, but everything is clean, modern and stylish. Reasonably good value in fairly expensive Vancouver. On more of the quieter side of Robson.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fabulous art work, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: ruadh_ruadh
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights with my partner. We wanted something central in Vancouver and you don't get much more central than Robson street; everything in Downtown is within walking distance. The hotel is comfortable and the staff were courteous. The bar downstairs (O'Douls) had really lovely food and a great wine selection. The staff were very prompt and knowledgeable. The hotel prides itself on its green initiatives and I have to say, I think it's commendable. More hotels should go the extra mile in conservation.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous”
Reviews.Author: shopper080
Reviews.Content: From booking, checking in to checking out. Front desk was amazing, very helpful with directions or any infromation I needed. Will stay again and would recommend others to stay. Great hotel and great staff. Jackie k and Clarie Prince George BC

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny of our stay!”
Reviews.Author: Jinky05
Reviews.Content: Probably one of the best hotel stays I've ever had. From the moment we checked in to the moment we checked out, we received excellent customer service. I believed that they went above and beyond to make sure our stay made us feel right at home. Every staff member that we came across were friendly and very helpful. It's in a great location, within walking distance of a variety of stores and restaurants. Their O'Doul's restaurant have THE BEST Eggs Benedict, you've got to try them all =) There's no doubt that we'd come back and stay here over and over again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, very clean hotel in a great location with impeccable, friendly service”
Reviews.Author: dawn1003
Reviews.Content: The staff in this hotel are very friendly, and the service was wonderful. The rooms are newley renovated. Perfect location for shopping on Robson downtown Vancouver. The price is amazing for the quality of the room and the location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service a home away from home - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Lawsonhydro
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Listel was a pleasure. The Hotel is not too large that they have forgotten what true service with a friendly smile is each time you have to talk to the staff which are more like Host's. The rooms are very clean and quite yet you are 2 minutes walk from the center of Vancouver for everything. The food was excellent with a great selection of British Columbia wines.

Reviews.Title: “Best artfull, jazzfull, boutique hotel located on the best shopping street in Vancouver with cool staff & fabulous food.”
Reviews.Author: lynnrosen
Reviews.Content: The Listel is first of all NOT a corporate cookie-cutter venue. It's a thoughtfully designed boutique hotel on the best shopping street in Vancouver (Robsen) with a fabulous restaurant featuring live jazz and a great chef. The hotel has a most unusual arrangement with local art galleries and museums and features an art floor graced with Pacific Northwest native art. You'll find original masks, prints, carvings in the hallways and in your room and suites. The staff is obviously happy to be working there and their enthusiasm is evident. The Listel is highly recommended with distinction.

Reviews.Title: “To discover Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: MaryWestCork
Reviews.Content: An arty bijou hotel in a city of huge hotels. Well located in the heart of it all. A chic, boutique hotel....aiming at the couples market, but perfectly placed for the independent, shopping, culturally- interested traveller. The staff gave me the impression that they loved the place and welcomed their guests with gusto.

Reviews.Title: “this is ok hotel to stay”
Reviews.Author: HolySoul
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel reservation through hotwire as 4 star hotel... I am disappointed as I was expecting 4 star and landed up in this hotel. Hotel is 3 star... its good as 3 star... service is good. Found that Fitness center is under renovation and front desk suggested to use fitness center 2 blocks away from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, good price, average room”
Reviews.Author: travelbirds0809
Reviews.Content: We found a deal for the Listel on Groupon so we got a great rate. However, we were surpised that although we had prepaid for our room, we ended up paying almost $150 for taxes and parking when we were checking out. (This did not include any room service or internet charges). The location is perfect, it's located on Robson in the midst of a ton of shopping and restaurants. It's also a 7-10 minute walk to Granville Street, where you can catch the bus to Granville Island. The room was average. My main complaint was the air conditioning/heating unit was VERY loud! It disrupted our sleep all night. Overall, for the price we paid, it was a really good deal and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: Akaeilla
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Listel in Vancouver. The first was in Dec 2010 before leaving for Mexico as our flight left early in the morning and the location was perfect as we just walked down to Grandville St. to catch the Canada Line train out to Vancouver International airport. Our last stay in March 2011 was even better as we went into town for my birthday, which the staff acknowledged upon our arrival to check-in and when we went downstairs for our reservation at the restaurant. Very clean and quiet considering it is downtown Vancouver. Great staff and service!!! We will definitely stay here again. Oh, and when the vallet brought our car up, there where two cookies wrapped in tissue paper with a note to enjoy our travels. Nice touch!!! Also, the restaurant staff made a great non-alcoholic "mommatini" for my daughter who is pregnant ~ she loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great price”
Reviews.Author: LynnE061
Reviews.Content: I would definitely recommend this hotel. Our room was recently renovated and very nice. The hotel is within walking distance of Stanley Park, English Bay and tons of excellent shopping and restaurants. For a downtown Vancouver hotel, the price is more than reasonable. This is the second time I have stayed at this hotel, and I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “It's all about the little extras”
Reviews.Author: OTLiving
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the Listel Hotel in Vancouver and had an amazing stay. Not only is the location awesome - right downtown on Robson Street in the heart of great shopping and dining and not a far walk to Stanley Park - but the staff are friendly, professional and helpful. We also ate in the restaurant and had a lovely breakfast. I think the best part of the stay though was all the little extras that the hotel thought of - fresh warm lemon scones as a free appetizer at breakfast, cookies in our car wrapped up as a gift, and lots of smiles from staff as well as beautiful artwork displayed throughout the hotel Those little extras, though small, were huge to us

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay”
Reviews.Author: MJB_11
Reviews.Content: The cleanliness is brilliant. The service and staff are all too attentive. Location is fabulous, walking distance to shopping and/or parks. I have stayed at Listel Hotel before and will continue to put this hotel on my top 5 list.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Quiet, Great location”
Reviews.Author: onions1
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel several times, over the years, while visiting Vancouver for both business and pleasure. Always get what you expect. I like the unlimited toll free calling anywhere in Canada (3 hours / day). Location is great for business downtown and many great restaurants are nearby. Stanley park is within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Artsy and Friendly, Listel is my favourite hotel”
Reviews.Author: AnneJF
Reviews.Content: Coming to Listel Hotel is like a home away from home. All staff are very friendly, from the greeting at front desk, to a friendly hello in the hall from cleaning staff, to coffee delivery in the morning with a smile, to wine tasting with hospitality staff and everyone else in between. I have been coming to Listel for business, and occasionally pleasure, for almost 10 years and have never experienced anything but friendly happy staff. O'Doul's restaurant has outstanding food, a great spot for a nightcap, or listening to live jazz. I always feel welcomed and safe when staying at the Listel and spending time at shops and restaurants on Robson. Great hotel. Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Found this GEM online!”
Reviews.Author: ecotravelling
Reviews.Content: Heard great stuff & wasn't disappointed. Fantastic central location, close to all the great sotres, cafes etc, great funky unique decor & nice friendly service. May want to get a phone card as intl calls are pricey but couldn't fault anything else. Will DEFINITELY stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great service and a beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: paulprescod
Reviews.Content: It's great to be in a hotel where every nook and cranny is stuffed full of interesting artwork. The staff is incredibly friendly. O'Doul's is one of relatively few places in Vancouver with jaz.. The staff there were also great.

Reviews.Title: “A True Gem”
Reviews.Author: gpoapst
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Listel for more than a decade. I go to Vancouver frequently and do not stay anywhere else. It is a fabulous location on Robson Street. Close to down town. Close to the magnificent Stanley Park. There are about 50 good places to eat within a ten minute walk. But you don't have to leave the Hotel to find great food and drink. Odouhl's bar and restaurant on the ground floor has the best wine and draft beer selection I have seen in Vancouver. Plus, the staff know all about BC wine (not to mention the rest of the world) and are very helpful. The front desk staff are great too. Same for the people who look after your room. Oh, and how about this. Free long distance calling in North America. Don't you hate hotels that nickle and dime you to death and charge 2 bucks for a local call. Forget it. No, I don't work there. i don't have a financial interest in the place. I just like great value combined with great service and very pleasant surroundings. That's the Listel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service!”
Reviews.Author: guemesgal
Reviews.Content: The friendly service began when we drove into the driveway. We were greeted by Ms. Blonde who led us directly to the Front Desk and checked us into our lovely room. The room was perfectly clean and well appointed. They think of everything...we had complimentary french-press coffee delivered to our room every morning! Another really nice touch is when we collected our car from the valet at the end of our stay, there were homemade cookies and a nice note sitting on the dash of our car! Plus, I would be remiss in not complimenting the hotel on their Green (environmentally) status.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful arty place”
Reviews.Author: Stev02
Reviews.Content: We loved the Listel Hotel. The decor was very nice, the rooms a good size, the restaurant had amazing food and the service from the staff was great. The beautiful artworks on the walls and museum pieces etc made the stay all the better. Of course being in a handy location in Robson st also helped. We would definitley stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The best kept secret hotel in Vancouver BC”
Reviews.Author: jac154944
Reviews.Content: The Listel is my favoirte hotel in Vancouver. Conveniently located, walking distance to a variety of restaurants and shopping. It is so unique. Original art throughout the hotel. Changing exhibitions on their main floor and gallery that are unusual and fascinating. Often there is a happy hour in the gallery...a very nice touch There is an excellent restaurant on the first floor with live music, great food and good wines. The rooms are very comfortable and clean and quiet but very difficult to leave as they provide more than the usual guides to the city. They have great current art magazines and a wonderful book of short stories about Vancouver. But the staff are the very special part of the hotel: friendly, courteous and willing to do whatever they can for you. And I won't tell you about the surprise in your car upon leaving if you park at the hotel. I was delighted and will return there whenever I stay in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Terrific service”
Reviews.Author: MikefromSeattle
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay for a long weekend. Centrally located on the main shopping street - Robson. Can walk to most places in or near the downtown area; West End, Gastown, Chinatown, Stanley Park, Canada Place, and/or ferry to Granville Island. Beautiful art in the hotel's public spaces. Fitness center a bit limited.

Reviews.Title: “Location location location”
Reviews.Author: catesmarty
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights in February for work/leisure with spouse. The hotel is located at the west end of Robson Street, before the descent into the Stanley Park area. Perfect location if you want to shop, easy walk to Pacific Centre, Coal Harbour, or English Bay. Also so many restaurants/bars etc, within walking distance, though some might consider it a bit far from the Granville entertainment district if you want that. We had a rate of $89 + tax, for a second floor room, which the hotel refers to as a "standard floor room". Check-in and valet were smooth, fairly quick. Room on small side with king and sofa, no mini-bar, which was odd as we were given a mini-bar key at check-in. I had called down to inquire as I was looking for a fridge, and was told I could have one delivered for $10/night for an equip. fee but this level of room didn't include a fridge, ok no problem. Level of furnishings and style were more than you'd expect for the rate we paid so I was pleasantly surprised, i.e. brand-new towels, wine glasses set out, quality coffee to make yourself. Can't comment on the restaurant or facilities such as the gym or Jacuzzi, didn't use them. Did order room service, it was professional and prompt. Our room faced the alley, and we were amazed both nights were extremely quiet, the hotel is well insulated and we didn't hear guests coming and going at all. My only complaint, the beds, they should be replaced, old and hard, but again to be expected for our rate. I didn't sleep well, but my husband had no issue. Likely the beds on the higher floors are more plush. When we checked out we were amazed by the amount of taxes, especially the BC transit tax on the parking (approx. 25%) so be aware, your end bill is much higher than the rate, no fault of the hotel, just a warning to travellers to Vancouver. The valet left us a surprise in our vehicle - cookies. Nice touch. Would definitely stay here again and recommend to people looking for accommodation in this area of the city interested in staying at a non-chain hotel, much more interesting.

Reviews.Title: “lacking”
Reviews.Author: Split-P
Reviews.Content: Art theme: to some it might be art - it looked like depressing and rather disturbing crap to me. The Room: well it had the smallest bathroom I have ever seen, a double bed not a king or queen, two beat up pillows, could not even prop myself up to read or watch the tube, they were so limp. Restaurant: Went for breakfast - it was ok. Somehow two orders of bacon and sausage, two juices and two coffees - came to $37.00? Taxes / fees included: Parking, Translink Tax on Parking, HST on Parking, Harmonized sales Tax, Hotel room tax, Facility Fee, Destiny Marketing Fee, HST on Destiny Marketing Fee, HRT on Destiny Marketing Fee, HST on Food and Beverage: This brought a supposed $109.00 including $25.00 food voucher up to a $182.00 night - lovely. Alley: loved the dumpster. Jacuzzi: Wasn't going in it - with the paper cups and towels littered around it. Smell: Motel 6 anyone? I would recommend Le Hermitage.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Meeting Experienc”
Reviews.Author: Intrepid_Mariner
Reviews.Content: I recently travelled to Vancouver to conduct a 3-day meeting with 38 participants. Although we were not familiar with the Listel Hotel, it became apparent from the outset, when working with the hotel's Events Planner, we would be in good hands. The hotel exceeded our expecations in every way. The hotel is immaculately clean and well maintained. It's art collection creates a wonderful ambience. There were nightly wine tastings between 5 and 6 pm that served as a wonderful before dinner mixer for meeting participants. The restaurant looks and sounds great. It is tastefully decorated and featured live soft jazz performances each night. The hotel kitchen is first class. Food is wonderfully presented and tastes as good as it looks. The main conference room comfortably handled our group size and was well appointed to support all our meeting and business requirements. The rooms are nicely decorated, very clean and comfortable. Internet service was fast enough to allow streaming video and Skype to work without difficulty. The location is excellent. You are a 5 minute walk from the downtown shopping district and numerous restaurants. Finally, the staff at this hotel are exceptionally pleasant to deal with. The are genuinely concerned about providing their guests with a first class experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, but ...”
Reviews.Author: ugogirl7
Reviews.Content: The location was perfect for us and the hotel pleasant (unpretentious but comfortable and clean). Very nice staff. The artwork is was a real plus. My only complaint was the LodgeNet television system which was extremely annoying. According to the maintenance man (who came promptly but we were not there to benefit from his advice) the system worked fine when he checked it out. Unfortunately, from our perspective it was basically unusable. The buttons had a mind of their own. Sometimes, all was well; other times, not even close. After a few days we figured out enough "workarounds" to (usually) access the channel we wanted. Never did manage to get the weather channel to work but, luckily, I had a laptop with me so could check online. A small matter, perhaps, but very, very frustrating. Because of this annoyance, we will probably not stay again. I recommend the hotel as a good place to stay but with a warning! Perhaps we are just inept but lots of people are, I imagine.

Reviews.Title: “More Motel than boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: gypsytravels
Reviews.Content: There was nothing wrong with this hotel, it just did not meet my expectations. The room was small but comfortable enough. The lobby of the hotel when you walk in is quite nice and the reception staff were great. The restaurant was good however, they did mess up my order each time I ordered from there. Internet was free which was a bonus and you can make local and national calls free of charge as well, which is a nice change. There was nothing wrong with the hotel, just the rooms were small and plain. The location isnt bad, however I did need to take taxis to all of my meetings, there are other hotels that would have been more suitable for my needs.

Reviews.Title: “Professional, Friendly, Unpretentious”
Reviews.Author: OggiesMum
Reviews.Content: I try and stay at the Listel when in Vancouver for business or pleasure. Considering the convenient location of the hotel close to the west end and downtown, it provides real value for money. Consistently clean rooms and amenities. Consistently professional and helpful staff. Great art. Great sleep. Combine that with the restaurant and bar at O'Douls to meet up with colleagues or friends. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with a great location in the West End”
Reviews.Author: joejulie
Reviews.Content: Great location on Robson street. 20 minute walk from Stanley Park and 15 minutes to the Pacific Centre mall. The attached O'Douls restaurant was great.

Reviews.Title: “Love Robson Street!”
Reviews.Author: montgomery98
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a few days just before Christmas before we headed up to Whistler. Had a super good experience all around, it's a really interesting hotel and a very friendly staff. The food and entertainment in the restaurant was top-notch. And everyone appreciated being on Robson St. Really nothing bad to say, we'll definately stay here again next time in Vancouver

Reviews.Title: “best location in town, excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: RT75
Reviews.Content: The Listel Hotel is a perfect choice for Vancouver, nearby several shops and restaurants right on Robson Street, with Pacific Centre Mall at a walking distance. The staff is very friendly, the rooms are very clean and well decorated, the O'Douls restaurant is a great choice for a nice dinner and wine (a little pricey, but the food quality and service are excellent and make it worth). Parking is sort of expensive (around 30$ a day), will stay at the Listel again when I return to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: El_Gordo314
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the first time while attending my company’s staff Christmas party and can’t believe what a cool hotel it is! Love the art, the great food, the commitment to sustainability, the live jazz (love Laura Crema!) and the free wine! I’ll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional, welcoming and comfy!"”
Reviews.Author: Megumee
Reviews.Content: Both my partner and I throughly enjoyed our stay at the Listel. The staff were incredibly friendly, helpful and accommodating. Had drinks one night and breakfast in the hotel lobby restaurant the following day, both enjoyable and priced reasonably. Travel was no problem with a cab always available in the lobby and the average price of a cab ride anywhere we went was approx. $10.00-15.00. During our stay it rained, and snowed!, for most of the 5 days we were there and the staff never let us leave the hotel without a comp. umbrella! A nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “An Eclectic Hotel with an Artistic Flair”
Reviews.Author: JBDuo
Reviews.Content: Our lengthy search for a hotel in Vancouver was rewarded by a unique and pleasant experience when we recently stayed in The Listel Vancouver. We booked directly and had a smooth transaction with the reservations personnel. The hotel is situated near the conference center where we had to attend a scientific meeting. The whole hotel is a contemporary museum of art from the lobby to our room. The decor is beautiful and blended well with the pieces of art seen throughout the hotel. In spite of its location, we had a well insulated /soundproof room. Our room is very clean and comfortable. There were two minor issues about our room : the pillows were firmer ( there should be a choice of soft and firm pillows) and our room lock sometimes did not recognize our key cards. We were informed that these issues were recently addressed. Security was excellent and comparable to first class hotels in the U.S. where we had to use our key cards to use the elevator. The staff was most professional and courteous. We also enjoyed the complimentary wine tasting on Tuesdays and Thursdays hosted by Mr. Jim Mockford, general manager of the hotel and Ms. Allison Westbridge, credit manager of the hotel. The food served by O'Doul's Restaurant which is part of the hotel was excellent. We certainly enjoyed our stay in this eclectic hotel with an artistic flair.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DerfM
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Listel regularly when in Vancouver on business. The staff and the location is great. I really like their restaurant, particularly in the evenings. Parkings a little steep but its the same all over Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Walking distance to many stores and restaurants”
Reviews.Author: anngel0107
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Listel Hotel during the summer of 2010. We were surprised that the location was so close to so many restaurants, shopping, Stanley Park, and the waterfront. We walked everywhere and caught the bus to Grainville Island one day. There are many great restaurants on the same street which makes this hotel really convenient while in Vancouver without a car. The lobby was small and filled with very modern art, but the service was really friendly each day we were there. The rooms are average size, comes with free internet, and flat screen tvs. I would stay here again as the location was very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Uncomfortable”
Reviews.Author: TaylorDylan
Reviews.Content: The beds and pillows were not comfortable. King bed sagged and pillows were balls of foam. Small room, small Bathroom. Check in not friendly or professional at all. Will not stay there again, there are better hotels and bargains out there.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale but not at an upscale price”
Reviews.Author: Doug4473
Reviews.Content: Small in stature The Listel does not command an upscale street presence. But the location on Robson can't be beat for proximity to restaurants, bars and shopping. Everything from fine dining to sushi takeout is right outside the front door. And it's only about a 1/2 hour walk to both hockey and football, Gastown and/or Chinatown. Great meeting location with large and clean rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Disturbing "art" and bad attitude - Stayed here for years but we'll never go back.”
Reviews.Author: JandCMO
Reviews.Content: My family and I have been staying at The Listel for years. It was our go-to hotel in Vancouver because of it's reasonable rates, clean rooms, great location, good food and friendly service. Many of the staff there know us and we always looked forward to going back. Sadly, one front desk employee and a poor choice of artwork ruined it for us. My husband and I had just been through a stressful event and decided to head to Vancouver for a weekend away to regroup. This hotel prides itself on being art-focused and always has interesting work in the lobby area, sometimes very tasteless. On this occasion they had an exhibit of photography depicting men with hyenas, baboons and monkeys on chains, some of them holding sticks in threatening stances as if they were about to beat the animals. We read the posted synopsis of the artists work and were even more disturbed after reading that the men in the photographs often had "brutal and cruel" relationships with their animals. Now let me make the point that I fully understand that art does not have to be my taste to be good or worthy of appreciation. However, when I go to a hotel, I want to feel welcomed and relaxed, not offended and upset. I am a huge animal lover and since The Listel had become a sort of home away from home, being faced with huge depictions of animal cruelty was really disturbing. Upon checkout I mentioned this to the young man named Sebastian at the front desk. He proceeded to explain to us that "good art is always thought-provoking" and proudly told us how one guest had actually canceled their stay because she had been so offended by a piece they had displayed. He spoke to my husband and I as if we were children and it was his job to school us on art appreciation. If I want to be challenged or have a though-provoking art experience I will go to a gallery, thank you very much, but when I stay at a hotel I want to feel warm and fuzzy. My husband (who has a degree from a prestigious art school) and I (who worked at a Four Seasons hotel for years) were so flabbergasted we couldn't even speak. I am pretty sure this was a new employee since we'd never seen him before, so I asked for his name and the GM's card and we left. We are extremely busy people and I never take the time to write reviews, but even though it has now been months, I thought it was important that others hear about our experience. If you are not bothered by this type of thing, than this might be a great hotel for you, but if you want to stay somewhere where you are surrounded by beauty and graciousness, look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, arty, comfy and fun.”
Reviews.Author: Swildon
Reviews.Content: Not the cheapest place, but the room was large, the staff were great and the art was interesting and challenging. And it's right in the middle of West Vancouver, close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Even the Windows Open !”
Reviews.Author: 100cc
Reviews.Content: Always a worry when the list of amenities and services at the hotel include: ‘windows that open’!! But the location is good and rooms large. Cost of overnight parking at $26 was high. Most of the staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Vancouver and You Will Too”
Reviews.Author: FoodnWineGalSW
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Listel for 5 days and had an enjoyable time. The location was excellent. Yes, it was on busy Robson Street, but we were not bothered by the noise emanating from downstairs ... the windows blocked out the sound. We found the hotel in very good condition. The highlight of our stay was the high quality, very friendly staff. all of whom were extremely helpful and very knowledgeable about the city, it's restaurants and tourist destinations. There was a happy hour one night during our stay which we enjoyed tasting wines from the nearby Okanagan Valley. This was a great way to meet other guests and staff from O'Douls Restaurant downstairs as well as taste great wine! Lastly, we appreciated their emphasis on art and the environment. I totally got it about the liquid soap and conditioners in shower dispensers--bravo! We hope to visit the Listel the next time we're in Vancouver. Thanks for making our stay most enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Vancouver in this price range”
Reviews.Author: jeffreyp07
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Listel about 10 times over the past 10 years. It is one of my favorite hotels in the world, and for the money, I think it is the best hotel in Vancouver. The location is ideal. You can walk from the Listel to most Vancouver attractions--Stanley Park, Yaletown, even the ferry to Granville Island. The downtown SkyTrain stations are also a short walk. Best of all, the hotel is located right where Robson Street starts to turn quieter and more residential--a perfect short distance away from the crowds of shoppers and nightlife. I've stayed in all three of the advertised room types, as well as one of the penthouse suites. In all cases, the rooms are excellent--clean, fairly sized for the price, and quiet. Each room is its own little art gallery, and the public spaces in the hotel are all filled with various art. I prefer the rooms that face Robson Street, as they tend to have better views even if they are a little less quiet. Free wired and wireless internet access as well as limited long distance phone calls are included with the room. The rooms come with coffee and a typical minibar, as well as Aveda bath products. There is no laundry service. The staff is awesome. I stayed in the Listel on the night of my engagement, and before we arrived, I called and someone helped me "secretly" upgrade to an Artist Series Suite to surprise my fiance. Our room service orders have always arrived promptly. A front desk clerk once gave us free coupons for drinks at O'Douls while we waited for our room upon early arrival. The maids are fast and do a great job. And the valets always leave cookies in the car when we leave. The Listel is my first choice in Vancouver. I heartily recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “average hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: mirrored
Reviews.Content: We got a good value deal via lastminute.com for 3 nights - not sure we would have stayed here on full price. Average hotel, room quite big (king bed on museum floor), facing Robson street. There is a constant 'humm' noise all through the night, so make sure you bring your earplugs. Parking is outragously expensive: $35 per night plus tip. It is a valet service. Across the road the public parking is only $17.50/day. The restaurant is overpriced, there are plenty of good places to eat on Robson and Denman streets.

Reviews.Title: “Wrong location”
Reviews.Author: GinaDoo
Reviews.Content: It is hard to know where to stay in Vancouver by reading the reviews. Robson Street is not the place. The Listel itself is okay, not really special though. They use the modern art to try and make it unique but it isn't enough. Robson St. might is probably okay for shopping if you are in your 20's but these aren't the nice shops or restaurants. Stay somewhere on the harbour with a view to appreciate Vancouver. Wherever you stay in the city, you are going to be all over the city so might as well stay somewhere that is attractive. Our view was of an overflowing dumpster in the alley. Also, we wished we had included a night in Victoria. We found the shopping and beauty surpassed that of Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room in the end.....”
Reviews.Author: SSMLondon
Reviews.Content: We were booked into a standard room. The first one we were shown looked out directly onto a brick wall. The second standard room we were shown was fine, but just a bit dingy and depressing. We finally moved to a Museum floor room which was perfectly pleasant and comfortable though I suspect the hotel really needs to spend some money on the property as furniture was chipped and a bit tatty. The location of the hotel is very good (and incredibly well soundproofed given that it is on quite a busy road) and the staff were helpful. Overall a reasonable experience but nothing like as good as we had anticipated given the reviews we had read.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly Friendly Service”
Reviews.Author: DanishAccent
Reviews.Content: I'm a weird man. I like people to be nice to me. And everybody at Listel was downright friendly. They actually seemed as if they liked tourists. They should've had their heads examines. And I mean that as a compliment! We got our hotel room early. It looked like something you could find at Days Inn, but it had a great panorama window with a small view of the bay. A very small view, but it was kind of hard to remove the buildings outside, so we lived with this "handicap". Yes, we would stay there again, even though it was a little too expensive. But that goes for everything in Vancouver. It thinks it's Manhattan, but it's actually ... Vancouver!

Reviews.Title: “Where "art" thou? For us: in the lobby only.”
Reviews.Author: gfselect
Reviews.Content: This is the first time we've ever played "hotel roulette" on one of those well-known travel websites. We purchased three nights at a mystery "4-star" hotel in downtown Vancouver for a rate comparable to many listed as "3-star". We typed in our credit card number, crossed our fingers, and hoped for the best. Our expectation was we'd end up in a nice hotel in a flawed location, either far away from the attractions we planned to visit and/or bordering on a seedy part of downtown. When the hotel name was finally revealed, we were THRILLED to see we were booked at The Listel, with its desirable location on Robson Street. We also liked the idea of an art-themed boutique hotel and the prospect of having interesting visual treasures filling the walls our room. This is where we allowed our expectations to rise too high. We ended up with room on the second floor, where the "standard" (read: almost art-free) rooms are located. All artsy rooms were on the floors above us. Although comfortable and tastefully designed, I think we would have been a tad disappointed if we had paid the hotel's full-rate for this type of room. Some details about our room: Room Temp: very comfortable, even though it was quite warm outside during our stay. TV: nice wall mounted flat-screen Internet: wireless and free Mattress: adequately comfortable Shower Head: adequate Cleanliness: I noticed a little tiny bit of mold on the permanent part of the shower curtain, but otherwise, clean. Bathroom: TINY! (and I didn't expect to see the glued-to-the wall plastic shampoo pump dispenser in this class of hotel) Outlets: only one located near the bed, which is for the lamp and clock radio to be plugged-in. This was a problem since my wife and I both like to plug-in our laptops close to our bed, plus I use a CPAP. However, the staff was quick to provide us with a powerstrip. FRONT DESK / VALET / MISC Check-in / Check-out - Fast and friendly. Valet- Not around when we arrived. We had to mention this to the front desk person who was checking us in. However, during the rest of our stay, they were very responsive. Valet Parking fee - $35 per day! Gulp. The desk clerk claims this is a very reasonable price for downtown Vancouver. I'm not an authority on this topic, but other reviews on this site suggests a lower price can be had. Restaurant - Didn't get a chance to eat there. It looked very nice though.. and appeared to be a great jazz club in the evening. We would certainly consider The Listel when visiting Vancouver in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Was perfect for us!”
Reviews.Author: oregonpoppa
Reviews.Content: I just don't understand TA's rating system. Everyone seems to like the Listel and yet it keeps dropping down the rating list. We found it to be perfect for us. Right from the greeting at the front desk and for valet parking, everyone was pleasant, helpful and efficient. In fact, after calling down to have the car ready, it always was there when the elevator delivered us to the lobby. We never had to wait. The wine tasting reception was a nice touch and the gift of wrapped cookies on our dashboard on departure was a pleasant surprise. We had two rooms for the four of us and, although we asked for the same thing, our room was a corner room with a large balcony. My wife was thrilled with the view, directly in line with the gap between high rises so we could see the boats in the harbor. Until the sun set, it was also a great site for our evening hearts games. We were on what is called the Museum Floor and, unlike a previous reviewer, we were fascinated with th First Nations artwork from the Univ. of BC Museum of Anthropology and, indeed, led us to include the museum on our itinerary. We were a bit disappointed with the renowned Robsson Street shopping district, but not with the Listel's location right in the middle of town. Our afternoon walks always yielded interesting neighborhoods and people watching. Our one regret: we were always a bit too pooped to partake of the late evening jazz session in the adjacent O'Douls next time in Vancouver, we'll allow more time for an afternoon nap so we can do justice to the night time offerings..

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for central Vancouver”
Reviews.Author: saddlers88
Reviews.Content: This is the ideal place to stay for a short stay in central Vancouver. The location is fantastic - very central and a short walk o everything in the downtown area or out to Stanley Park. But despite its location the rooms are perfectly quiet - we had no noise at all. it was also excellent value by the eye-watering standards of big city centre hotels in holiday season. If I return to Vancouver I will stay here.

Reviews.Title: “friendly & helpful staff, great location, wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: kathy3030
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at The Listel Hotel while in Vancouver for a girls weekend. We had a wonderful time at the hotel and the staff was excellent. The location was perfect as we could walk to almost everywhere we needed or wanted to visit. Anytime we had questions the front desk was very helpful. The restaurants and nightlife nearby were great. The complementary coffee service in the morning was amazing and very much appreciated as well as the cookies in the car the morning of checkout. It's all the extra touches, friendly staff, location and clean rooms that will have me recommending your hotel to anyone I hear is visiting Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LN303
Reviews.Content: Lovely large room. Great service. Front desk personnel were well informed about sightseeing and willling to investigate options. Downtown location afforded walking to Stanley Park and Gastown, if you are a walker. Attached to a wonderful restaurant with live jazz.

Reviews.Title: “convenient, modern no frills hotel , very good restaurant”
Reviews.Author: hkwoofs
Reviews.Content: Would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting a simple, modern, stylish hotel without frills . Rooms furnished simply but tastefully with quality linen. Some wear and tear on wood work but all in all clean and well maintained. Bathrooms tiny and lighting could be better; surprisingly no in room safe. Our room had a non existent view so some more prominent examples of the art work would have been a welcome diversion. Reception staff slightly abrupt and some "attitude". One feels that there is a slight image over service attitude . O Doul's Restaurant attached , here service friendly and first class; food quality excellent and menu choices local and fresh. Extensive wine list. The hotels policy of a facilities charge for internet and local calls irritating. why not include it in room rate at outset?. Valet parking very expensive. remember all rates quoted are subject to taxes which can be a sting in the tail at check out.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - good value”
Reviews.Author: SimonBangorNI
Reviews.Content: I stayed in room 318 with my family (two young teenagers) as it was one of the few locations in Vancouver centre which offered a room suitable to sleep a family of four. 318 is on the museum floor which I thought would have more museum displays, I noted only one just at the lifts. The hotel rooms are a bit dated but acceptable. There is a lovely view of the hotel bins from 318 but this did not worry us as we were rarely in the room. I would highly recommend this hotel due to the excellent staff and superb location. You can walk within 20 minutes to all major sites and there is a good selection of shops and restaurants including Earls and Moxie's within 2 minutes walk and the main shopping centre is 15 minutes away. Just ask for a front facing room onto Robson. I can not praise the staff enough. There was some mention in other reviews about beggers in the area. I did see one but he was harmless and it appeared to be a common problem throughout Vancouver especially around Gastown.

Reviews.Title: “Just gorgeous”
Reviews.Author: welshpenguin
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Listel while on our honeymoon in March. We'd booked it on the recommendation of the travel agent who'd stayed there previously, and we were a little sceptical! We'd chosen a mix of budget and luxury hotels during our trip, this was one we'd splurged on and we were so happy we did! The Listel is absolutely beautiful inside, it's stylish without being overly styled. Our room was enormous, with two queen sized beds and all of the things we'd need. The free WiFi came in very handy to check our flight. The staff were very friendly and welcoming, and hugely helpful in telling us where to go and what to do. Make sure to check out O'Doul's on the ground floor for fabulous jazz and cocktails.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not all 4 Star”
Reviews.Author: mintcreative
Reviews.Content: Great location, good rooms, good service, excellent sleep quality, but this place could be better. The Listel prides itself on being described as Vancouver's most 'art-full' hotel, however I'm not entirely sure that that description extends to their standard rooms - ours had a single piece of art tucked away on a side wall next to the wardrobe. After staying at another 4 star hotel in Vancouver, I would say that the standard floor rooms at the Listel are more like 3 star. A pity really, as the other rooms look gorgeous from the photographs and I would expect a hotel like this to maintain 4 star standards across the board. Still a good place to stay, still decent rooms, just feel a little let down by our 'standard' room after reading the hotel descriptions. For a boutique place, I would have expected more little touches.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location”
Reviews.Author: ShippyEastKilbride
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Listel for 2 nights at the start of our trip to Canada. A friend collected us from Vancouver airport and drove us straight to the hotel. Traffic was a bit busy and there are some road closures on Robson Street which delayed us slightly but were still there in little over 30 minutes. The hotel is located in the Downtown area of Vancouver. As locations go you cant complain. Bars, restaurants, shops, the waterfront and Stanley Park are all within a couple of minutes walk. The hotel staff at check in were very pleasant and polite and the check in process only took a matter of minutes. A free safety deposit box is provided. Our room was situated on the fifth floor and was one of the rooms that is themed with artwork (which is avaliable to buy!). The whole hotel is actually filled with paintings and sculptures which makes it a very pleasant place to be. The bedroom was immaculate as we'd expected and had a very nice 32 inch plasma TV on the wall!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Lcrich56
Reviews.Content: The Listel was our home for 3 nights during a wedding over Memorial Day. The staff went above and beyond making everyone feel welcome. We were in a room on the fifth floor right over the lobby. We could see the water and boats. After seeing the rooms on the lower floors, I would insist on one higher. The rooms were large with a wonderful bed. I loved having my complimentary coffee delivered at 8 every morning. We removed most things in the mini bar and put our purchases in there. Very nice. The Listel is walking distance to just about everything downtown. We walked to the convention center and Stanley Park. The restaurant is wonderful Great food and service. The breakfasts were so yummy.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel; very helpful, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: mcharan
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights in the Listel. Great location within walking distance of shops,restaurants, Stanley Park. Comfortable, nicely decorated rooms. Relatively low rise; Attractive bar/restaurant with free live music each night. Friendly greetings from all staff and particularly helpful front desk. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel, Good Art, Lacks Polish”
Reviews.Author: JMfromTO
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel was a good place to stay. Clean rooms, comfy bed with nice sheets. Location is awesome on Robson street (there is a Starbucks across the street and a great restaurant next door called O'Doul's). The art in this "art hotel" is fantastic when I was here. A very interesting photography exhibit. The downside of this place and why it only gets 4 out of 5 stars (I was tempted to give it a 3) is that is bills itself as a "arty designer" type hotel. You would expect this place to be decked out with fancy, modern decor. Other than the great art on the wall, this place is barely a 3 star hotel. Room furniture is average at best. The TV is circa 1996. The bathroom is from a mid-range apartment in 1989. The AC hums and the carpet hasn't been changed in some time. Now I normally wouldn't care about any of this except of how this hotel sells itself and my expectations. The airport Radisson I stayed at the first night in the city looked 10 times better in terms of an interior. So, do you need a nice clean hotel with great staff in a fantastic location in Vancouver? Then stay here. Don't expect to be blown away with the decor. NOTES: Free Internet Great Staff Awesome eats next door at O'Doul's Great Location Vancouver is awesome

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: Vacationer31250
Reviews.Content: We were staying at another hotel just down the street and having a lousy time. Eating at O'Doul's one night, the wait staff suggested we move to the Listel and could get us the same rate. I went and looked at the rooms they had available, and moved the next day. Saved our holiday big time. I was truly impressed with all the staff from the front desk to the restaurant were we eat on numerous occasions. They truly treat you like family. We also got a welcome gift on arrive, and were called by name each time we came in or went out. As for the art work, my husband is an artist and we loved the paintings. The wine reception was also wonderful. Great place, great staff, will stay there again!! Thanks, guys!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel With Great Service”
Reviews.Author: peterlc63
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights recently and had a nice time. Everyone at the Hotel was polite and attentive. The car valets were also very helpful and cheerful. We had lunch at the restaurant which was also pretty good. A little pricey but, good. Lots of shops and restaurants nearby. Parking is $26.00 a night if you're driving there. Hotel room was spacious and clean. We were on the second floor on the back side of the hotel so we had to listen to the trash trucks doing the rounds early in the morning. Other than that, it was still quiet. I guess the cheapest rooms are on the lower floors. Overall, it was a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Low Key Unique Very Welcoming Professional Staff w/ surprise Rare Welcome Gift!”
Reviews.Author: to335i1
Reviews.Content: Stayed during/for the Vancouver 2010 Olympics! Man oh man what an experience.. One hell of an experience not to forget! I was nearly depressed to come Back home to Toronto! I loved the city, the culture, some of the unique restaurants & the very fine west coast chilaxed laid back Vancouver People & Atmosphere to make it an overall great experience! But Than again maybe it was like this more so like this for some aspects because it was during Olympics! This was by the way our first leg of hotel stays on this trip & one of the better ones too! Now onto THE HOTEL! :) Upon arriving the concierge/valet was extremely friendly, warm & helpful! Made me & friends feel like we were a somebody. :) Pretty decent location for the most part! Not really far from anything. Nice n' cozy low key quiet boutique like hotel! Very clean hotel & rooms too! Rooms seem quite well designed..at least ours was! I loved the chaize lounge cozy comfy full length couch by the window where you can chill lay back with couple people. Also rarely do u have hotel rooms these days where windows can be opened. The top window opens allowing nice fresh air into the room. Unfortunately did not get to experience their restaurant... I understand the hotel is trying to go GREEN & I guess to cut costs but I still prefer personally branded mini bottled Shampoo &conditioner over dispensers which I've never seen before...but I guess it was still pretty cool & the quality was good. Our room was facing the rear of the hotel which very much reminded me of Europe/middle east particularly Istanbul, Turkey which I really liked...It probably felt this way due to the apt. design setup w/ the small groundfloor basic parking lot & narrow street etc looking out the window. What I really appreciated & quite surprised to find was the welcome package (red wine w/ a O'douls Wine/Bottle Opener), Exquisitely delicious Premium ARTSY box o' Chocolates, & a welcome letter that was sitting on the coffee table. It really made me feel "special & welcome". Concierge very friendly professional & never made you feel it was all about "the tip" ! I could see the caliber class of hotel I was dealing with as soon as I booked as well as when I had to call the hotel to to discuss a few things. Very professional, friendly, Courteous Staff who seem to really care about your stay/experience. I would definately stay at the Listel again! P.S I forgot to mention that upon my request,to have as a souvenir, the hotel sent me a complimentary wine/bottle opener by mail

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations - again!”
Reviews.Author: branmuffin7
Reviews.Content: Once again, the Listel has amazed me with it's geniune service, extraordinary housekeeping and fantastic dining. As someone who also works in the hotel industry, it's easy for me to "nit pick" any flaws, but I must say it was very hard to do so! The front desk agents and valet drivers were all so positive, friendly and shown a general interest in where I was even from. Housekeeping was prompt and any special requests I had for the room (more body wash, shower cap etc), they attended to. The dining room was unbelievable. Even though I went in by myself, the bartender was very personable and kept me company. Not to mention the food was to die for. Accompanied by live jazz as well! Overall my stay was a 10/10. I truely mean that too.. I would never recommend a hotel to anyone if I didn't honestly think they should go there. My only "complaint" is that the air vent was a bit rattly, but I just turned it off anyways - didnt need it when I had a balcony! :) Also, if anyone else were to bicker about that, can they honestly say their vents at home don't make noise too? Keep up the phenomenal work!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but barely.”
Reviews.Author: ewingard
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights with my family for fun leisure time. Booked through a major online retailer and they noted that at check-in. We ended up with a room facing the back alley and parking lot. The windows are NOT double insulated and you can hear every car and truck rumbling down the alley. We could overlook that, but could not overlook the art work that we had to confront every day getting on/off the elevator and in the lobby. We understood that the Listel proudly displayed art work from different sources, but we are here on VACATION and were confronted with huge pictures of chained, abused monkeys and hyenas in Africa (amongst other animals and people) and pictures fairy tales'heros' in various states of social or medical angst; think Rapunzel with a bald head staring at her hair in her lap, sitting on a hospital bed with the chemotherapy dripping into her. One of many pictures in the hall and lobby. This is hospitality? This is a relaxing place to come with your family? It was a total downer after coming back from great experiences to confront this day after day after day. Please Listel, I can deal with push button vats of shampoo and body wash (thank god i brought my own though), and telling the staff for three solid days that there were FOUR of us in the room (more towels, cups, glasses-again-please), but ditch the depressing art work for something more fitting for a HOTEL, with TRAVELERS, and offer something SOOTHING, and less confrontational. Even on business travel, the last thing you need to stare at in the evening is a manacled chimp staring back at you.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and service”
Reviews.Author: sarahpalama
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I booked a trip to The Listel Hotel over Easter weekend. We drove up from Seattle and arrived about 4 hours before check in time. The front desk let us check in 4 hours early. They have valet parking which works out well since the hotel is right downtown where parking prices are ridiculous. The hotel room was nice. It wasn't the most modern hotel room but for location and the cleanliness of the hotel made it a very comfortable stay. The hotel staff was friendly, free internet service and free long distance calls to the US for up to 3 hours a day. We booked a Gallery Floor room and were very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Awful don't go!”
Reviews.Author: AndreaE3
Reviews.Content: This hotel was rated as a four star in the brochure we booked with but we've stayed in better Travel Lodges! The reception area was very modern and contemporary but the rest of the hotel was just awful. Run down and more of a glorified backpackers than a Four Star Hotel. We didn't stay in the end, decided to book a room in another hotel at our own expense.

Reviews.Title: “Artful hotel in great location.”
Reviews.Author: EarthAirFireWater
