Reviews.Content: Nice style and ambiance; local artists' work displayed. Moderately sized hotel in the heart of Vancouver's beautiful West End. Our sixth floor room was very quiet and clean and had an outdoor rooftop patio. The fitness area had machines and a hot tub only, but was nicely designed and well maintained. Recycling and other environmentally friendly practices were used. A small surcharge allowed for unlimited wireless and three hours of North American phone calls per day, plus faxing and printing. O'Doul's Restaurant & Bar downstairs had good food, friendly staff, and live jazz some evenings. It was a little pricey, though.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy boutique hotel is a repeat time and time again”
Reviews.Author: nikki_raven
Reviews.Content: This is a quiet clean funky boutique hotel centrally located on trendy Robson Street in Vancouver. Food is great, staff is friendly and helpful and the price is great. I really enjoy the fact they are very environmentally conscious with built in dispensers for shower gel, shampoo and conditioner and they have recycling facility's and blue boxes in the room! This ( along with the big comfy beds ) makes it an A+ for me

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable stay - well placed”
Reviews.Author: chepstu
Reviews.Content: Booked a couple of nights here after our Whistler stay (through airmiles) and weren't dissapointed. It is based on Robson street - which is one of the busier streets in Vancouver, lots of Restaurants and shops to keep everyone interested. We walked everywhere (a little ambitious) - but covered a lot of the island and can recommend Granville Island and Stanley Park as must visits. The bad bits first - we had a room on the Museum Floor (6th) and it was still quite noisey with the busy street traffic outside, and the Aircon/Heating system was perhaps the noisiest i've ever encountered in a Hotel room - easily solved by turning off. Neither points were really detrimental to the stay. The good bits - very nice staff - without exception. The room was very big - with a huge (& comfortable) King Size bed. The museum floor means you get some nice First Nation pieces of art in the room - and some good publications to read. We went just on a room only basis (lots of cafe's around for breakfast) but on our second night when it was raining and we were tired we decided to stay at O'Douls the Hotels restaurant. Prices were on the 'upper' end of our normal scale - but the food and service was a real treat. We paid $69 for a 3 course set meal including a wine paired to each of our choices per course. Lucas the waiter was very knowledgable and made us feel very welcome - excellent way to spend the last evening. Overall - recommended - we wouldn't hesitate to return if we go back to Vancouver

Reviews.Title: “Great room, clean and very classy”
Reviews.Author: Powpow4ever
Reviews.Content: I thought I should contribute here as I had a lovely time at the Listel. We were on the 5th floor in a Gallery Room. The check in was efficient and lacked warmth of information. On the 5th floor, the lift door opens onto a nice exhibit in a glass case. The corridoor was decorated tastefully with very nice choice of paintings. Upon entering our room we found 2 big Queen size beds and lovely appointment of furniture. On the Gallery Floor rooms, you get free high speed internet , free coffee service (really nice coffee). The Internet speed is fine and I had no cause for complain. The gym is very small and not worth the floor space. The location of the Hotel is excellent. As most of the reviewers pointed out, Hon's just opposite and a multitude of great sushi shops and creperies. The housecleaning was excellent. As I was travelling with my 2 teenage sons, the room was left messy and when we return, order has been restored. The shower is too small, but the little alcove where you make coffee is nice enough. We dined at O'Doul's for breakfast and for dinner. Both occasions the food was good. The waiting staff at the restaurant were not really friendly. After Whistler I must admit it will be hard to find good waiting staff. The dinner meal took 30 minutes to arrive and the restaurant was almost empty. The waiter made wise remarks when we did not order desserts. We were so bored after waiting so long for our mains so decided to skip dessert. We walked over to the creperie instead. The benes were divine, some of the best we have had. I really like this hotel for its cleanliness, location, furnishings, safety, green motto. I will return without hesitation. The warmth of staff is patchy. Only met one nice and helpful guy from reception who ordered our cab when we departed. The others mostly ignored us, did not greet when we entered foyer and mostly wore a disgruntled expression.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & location..”
Reviews.Author: carmensandiego90
Reviews.Content: Too bad the weather was horrble. The hotel was very clean and staff were friendly. Also a good value for the money. Close to shopping and restaurants. Just dont eat at the restaurant next to the hotel- the bartenders do not know how to make drinks. The room was a great size. Its just too bad it rained every day of the 4 days we were in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “great value, great staff, wouldn't choose to stay in a standard room again”
Reviews.Author: emah
Reviews.Content: I picked the Listel after reading all the Tripadviser reviews: I like a bit of luxury and class, but my budget is more modest than my tastes so I tend to do a lot of research before I book. I originally booked directly with the hotel ($146 Can) but Expedia came out with a fantastic deal ($89 US) for the first 3 nights so I booked that, and then the LIstel had its own sale in early December and I was able to rebook the nights I had booked directly with the hotel for Can $89 - at that price, this hotel is a steal. The location is very central - it's down the West End end of Robson Street - a six block walk from the Skytrain station and even with my case and after a day of travel, and in light drizzle, it was a cinch to find (and by the by, CONGRATS Vancouver, on the new Canada line - its awesome to be able to jump on a train at the airport and 25 minutes later be in the centre of town - for the grand total of $2.50 - amazing. Back when I lived here in the mid 90s, you had to choose between an expensive shuttle, or a time consuming and luggage unfriendly public bus. but i digress...). I was given a room on the 2nd floor (our first floor), room 209. The bed was too hard for my poor back but within an hour they had put a down topper-cover on the mattress and I was perfectly comfortable with that addition. They also emptied the mini-bar so I could put in my milk and yoghurt etc (I like to have cereal and fruit in my PJs without having to be presentable for room service staff early in the morning!). The room was a decent size, good sized desk and bureau, a chaise-lounge (which I used for my case, which I live out of when travelling), 4 table lamps (all with different and somewhat fiddly knobs or levers), and two spare outlets which I was able to find and access without too much difficulty (one under the desk, which is a bit of a pain) and one behind the easy chair. The bathroom had an ante-chamber, one side with the sink, and one side with a vanity. the bathroom had a deep 3/4 length bath (tricky to get into if you are, like me, a shortie), and lavatory. Shower was perfectly serviceable over the bath, but poor water pressure and the shower nob could not be altered to up the pressure if you like a water massage. Nice towels and flannels. One thing I loved was the wall-mounted dispensers for shampoo and condition and shower gel - SO much better for the environment and access than fiddly little bottles. I use my own hair products, so can't report on those, but the shower gel was citrus and really yummy. Same with the handwash by the sink. Also, a first, a proper recycling bin under the vanity for bottles etc. Fantastic idea. The staff were incredibly helpful and professional - and I admit that I am a bit of a challenge (the bed, the fridge, the need to access my safe deposit box twice in 2 hours because I was somewhat disorganised...) - they never blinked - kudos. One day I left my diamond stud earrings in a glass on the vanity (this is my invariable practice at hotels but I usually wear them: this morning I was out early walking, and decided not to wear them) - when I got back to my room at 3.30 they were gone and the glass was turned upside down: freak out. I rang the front desk, she rang housekeeping, and 10 minutes later the head housekeeper was handing them back - luckily the glass had not yet been put in the dishwasher. So my assumption that glasses are rinsed and put back in the room does not hold here - they are taken down to the kitchen for cleaning. That's good service. I asked for and was given a slightly later checkout on my last day (1pm instead of 12pm) and the option of paying $85 for a 6pm check out - but I left my bags with the front desk and my stuff in the safe, and went to the cinema instead to while away the hours til i had to be at the airport. It rained all week, and wandering around in the damp loses its appeal after a while! Room Service: I had breakfast delivered one morning; it was delivered promptly at the time requested and was still pretty much warm; the blueberry banana pancakes were delicious; the poached eggs were sad wee things, minus most of their whites and overcooked. I had a momentary issue with the bill: the menu clearly states that the bill includes an 18% gratuity and a room service fee (standard) but the bill when it arrives, had a huge space for 'gratuity' in the middle of the bill, and it took me 60 seconds to ascertain that in fact the menu-stated gratuity WAS in fact included already: why do they do that? Why do you have to be made to feel cheap when you don't add on an extra tip to what is already a very generous included tip? So, things I didn't love: Internet: the hotel has both wired and ethernet and it is promoted as high speed. It is the slowest high-speed internet I have ever experienced. At home (Melbourne), I can download a TV episode on itunes in 12 minutes. At my hotel in LA it took 2 hours. Here it took about 14 hours to download an episode!! I borrowed an ethernet cable to see if that would speed things up, but no luck. It's incredibly slow. Room: Noise and Smells. I can't comment on whether these problems are endemic or relate only to rooms on the standard floor, but I would not choose to stay in my room again for these two reasons. The aircon was on when I moved in, and I immediately turned it off and opened the small window above the main window in my room. What this meant was that at night after the ambient noise died down, there was an almighty racket coming via the air con ducts in the room and the bathroom; it sounded like a toilet 'running' all night long - I am guessing it is the echo of the air con operating elsewhere in the hotel. I have never heard it before and its incredibly noisy. The only way I could sleep was with my foam earplugs, which I carry for plane trips. The other issue was an intermittent and somewhat unpleasant invasion of my room of cooking smells - I am not sure if these aromas came from the air con vent or from the restaurant which my room window overlooks - but it was weird and not very pleasant. The only other issue I had was lighting: it rained all week so outside was grey and dim. The lighting in the room is via table lamps - there is one behind the Chaise lounge, one on the desk and one of each of the bedside tables. Even with all of these turned on, the room is dim. At night this is not really a problem, but in the day time when you are trying to get motivated to get up and get going, its a problem! The problem in the bathroom was of a different nature - there is a light over the sink and one over the vanity, and one in the bathroom - nice and bright BUT incredibly fiddly; a total of 5 switches need to be played with and turned off before you head out; it seems like overkill - surely a maximum of 2 is all that is needed? Overall: for the price I paid, I thought this hotel was good value - comfortable, stylish, great staff, and an excellent location. However, I would not choose to stay in a standard room again so whether I would stay here a second time would depend on the cost of the next grade up.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: gadds
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 5 nights last year, after arriving fron n. ireland 24 hours on the go we were met by very nice staff. rooms were very clean and food first class . the desk staff were really helpfull and nothing was any trouble,also a great location.iam a fussy traveler and like the hotel to be good, this ticked all the boxes dispite some bad reviews, would return any time.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: cdntravels80
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Listel Hotel from December 31st, 2009 to January 4th, 2010 for a quick getaway for New Year's. This was our first time staying in downtown Vancouver. This is a truly amazing hotel. The service is excellent and the location right on Robson Street can't be better. The rooms are very clean and quiet. This is definitely the place to stay for us when we'll be back in Vancouver. Cost for valet parking is a little steep ($26/day), but this is common for the area.

Reviews.Title: “Super Nice Listel”
Reviews.Author: JoLee
Reviews.Content: We won 2 nights stay at the Listel Hotel. Arrived very tired from a long flight and were welcomed by friendly desk staff. Found a lovely clean End room on the Gallery (5th) Floor ,with a very good view of Robson Street and the Harbor . In room coffee maker with supplies was complementary, with very good coffee. Nice bathroom. Nice window seat to sit and people watch. There is a Hot but and exercise room on the 2nd. floor. Umbrella's at the desk for quests use (found this out after we got rained on). We were treated very well ,no difference than any paying guest. We enjoyed our stay and would return to the Listel.

Reviews.Title: “POSITION WITH A TOUCH O FLAIR”
Reviews.Author: akmacca
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for three nights with my partner in mid-November. This hotel is rather unique as some room's and most of the corridors contain artworks on loan from local museums. The room I stayed in on the sixth floor contained local first nation artwork from the University of BC. Some of this artwork can be purchased. This alone separates the Listel from most other hotels. I stayed in a room with a king-size bed which was as comfortable as it was wide and I had a view over Robson Street which was welcome. For the first night of our stay we were on the second floor and this room faced a bleak back street and we were woken by the noise of a garbage truck. When we bought thgis to the managements attention they had no hesitation in moving us to a room on the sixth floor with a view and less noise. One difference between the rooms was that the second floor room had a large flat screen tv mounted on the wall, whilst the sixth floor room had an old-style tv in a cupboard. The bathroom was small but adequate. There was a mini fridge in the room stocked to overflowing with every type of drink imaginable. You would have to be a heavy duty drinker to even go close to emptying this bar fridge. There were coffee making facitities in the room, but as is usual for North American hotels no hot water jug for tea drinkers like me. The water from the coffee pot is never hot enough to make a good cup of tea. The service was excellent and all the staff I encountered were extra friendly. The Listel is located at the Stanley Park end of Robson Street, but still within an easy walk of most Vancouver attractions. The only negative of the stay was the high price of parking ($20 I think) at the hotel. Way too much for guests!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Lamsteropolis
Reviews.Content: From the reservation booking agent, to the front desk staff, to our room, it was beyond our expectations. Our room had a huge balcony with a view of the harbour and mountains. We could walk to everywhere from the hotel and enjoyed great restaurants in the area. I really liked how environmentally active the Listel is. Everything from their heating and air conditioning to their soap dispensers had the environment in mind. The King sized bed in our room was the only thing that could have been a little less hard, but was certainly adequate. There was lovely art throughout the hotel, including in our room.

Reviews.Title: “Love It!!”
Reviews.Author: AdrianeYos
Reviews.Content: Well after reading the petty reviews on here I have decided to write review as I am laying in bed right now at The Listel. They have a great early check in I didn't have to wait until 3pm like some hotels. It's everything even a Bon Crepe (japanese crepe stand it's closed until the 17th) a great parfait place up the road. Nothing is out of reach for this hotel. If you need supplies two blocks up is a London Drugs, 7eleven for prepaid phone minute refills (lol) and a Money Mart. Very sweet and professional staff even though they were more interested in hearing me speak (Southern Accent). I didn't too much like using the key to work the elevator, it was a bit of a hassle every time I went out but meh the price of safety lol. They currently have one elevator working due to maintenance which is cool. I don't believe there are enough ppl staying here to bother with it. The hallways are pretty dark, but I like it less light saves energy. My room is great I was put in a room with a King sized bed and plenty of space. closet is a bit dated but hey, its a closet. They should just upgrade these rooms a bit but whatever, I'm happy. I had to call the hotel on my cell phone to inform them that the phone didn't work in the room. Besides that I love this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Mandm61
Reviews.Content: The cleanliness of my room on arrival was such that I had to be moved to another room. Beware the breakfast vouchers in the restaurant. You get an inferior menu with no flexibility whatsoever as to what you can choose to eat. Altogether very disappointing ... and the hotel foyer is freezing as the doors are left wide open.

Reviews.Title: “through trip”
Reviews.Author: tripfoot
Reviews.Content: very good couple night stay with great amenities and service and staff and location

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel, Excellent Customer Service, Great Food & Location!”
Reviews.Author: heather_and_nick
Reviews.Content: This was probably the best hotel I've ever stayed at. Not only was it a great value, it was located right in the heart of the Robson Street shopping district, it was close to the waterfront, and everything we wanted to see in Vancouver was just a quick walk or a short bus ride away. CLEAN rooms! Amazing housekeeping staff. The customer service here was exceptional - I have never had such great service. The people were all so friendly and really cared about their guests. The Listel Hotel also has a restaurant called O'Doul's whose food was SO good!! The hotel also has an art theme, which I absolutely loved. Great people, good food, close proximity to areas of interest - we had a fabulous time and would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “what a find!”
Reviews.Author: karen339
Reviews.Content: located in vancouver in an area alive with restaurants and shops.beautifully appointed rooms. wonderful staff. gallery art decorating the rooms and hallways. walking distance from the waterfront. and best of all a pot of french pressed coffee delivered each morning!

Reviews.Title: “A Gem of a Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: WhirledTravelor
Reviews.Content: Booked at the Listel for a stay after a cruise on NCL Pearl. Took a short cab ride from farthest cruise ship terminal for $12. Arrived at 10am, checked in and left bags for later room assignment. Folks were very helpful and friendly. Gave us a map of how to get to various attractions on foot and even circled a few highlights. Easy 15 minute walk to Gastown and 10 minutes to Stanley Park from hotel. Good mix of tourist stops and nice places to eat/drink and two markets one block over . Listel also offers a card for free cab ride to selected restaurants. More about food/drinks in other reviews but we recommend O'Doul's connected to hotel. The hotel has many extras that add up to a very good value. Booked one night for $120 USD w/tax and fees Hotels.com. We were upgraded from a Museum Room to a Gallery Room for free without asking. Heard several people walk in asking for rooms and they were turned away for at least the next two nights. Room 400 is a corner room w/ very nice king bed, big screen tv, mini bar, sitting area, chair/table and good bathroom area w/ plenty of towels. Lots of windows. Room also come with free internet connection (no computer) free in room phone calls (check details at hotel) and free use of lobby computer and free printer. I would suggest asking for extra pillows. Stay was glitch free and pleasant from start to finish. One of the nicest stays at a nice basic hotel in years.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: happy_sigh
Reviews.Content: We stayed one week here in August 09. Can't say enough of every staff member we met. They made our stay very enjoyable with their friendliness and knowledge of their town. The rooms were clean and comfortable. I wouldn't hesitate recommending this hotel. Just loved the staff, from the front door to the people who cleaned our rooms, fantastic all of them.

Reviews.Title: “Great "Art-full" Place--in the center of things”
Reviews.Author: JBHope2001
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel simply from an online referral, and I could not have been more pleased. This small hotel has quite a European feel, and has an art emphasis--some floors are decorated with artifacts from the Pacific Northwest native tribes, while others focus on different artists. The staff was very helpful and considerate. They gave good recommendations for dining and directions for shopping. The hotel is located within walking distance of the Vancouver Art Gallery, as well as all the good downtown shopping areas. The restaurant, O'Doul's, had an excellent menu and great waitstaff.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: livinonadream
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at The Listel Hotel in beautiful downtown Vancouver. I got a deal on travelzoo.ca and we couldn't have been happier. We had booked for the Museum floor and got upgraded to the Gallery Floor. The room was clean and roomy. It was a bit dated but the space was amazing and the service we received was wonderful. As well the size of the TV was great big and easy to view from anywhere in the room. Being on the Gallery floor we got either fresh coffee or lose leaf tea delivered to the room when we wanted it. (we just had to fill out the form in the room). We has a great stay. We didn't eat at the in house restaurant but the area is not lacking in selection of restaurants with in steps of the hotel. We had a great stay and most certainly would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid rooms on the second floor”
Reviews.Author: 9april9
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location and the staff are very helpful. However, we stayed there twice during our honeymoon trip and had problems with the rooms on the second floor both times. The first stay saw us in a room that faced on to a brick wall and had a really tired bathroom, but it was okay. The second visit, we were right next to the vents from the restaurant below which were exceptionally noisy and asked to be moved. They had another room on the same floor which was quieter, but the bathroom looked like it was pre-war. Having said that, the hotel is very clean indeed, provide great coffee in the room, has a nice bar with informative tenders on the ground floor and -as I said - is in a really handy location. I get the impression that if you go higher up the hotel the rooms get much much better, so worth bearing in mind when booking.

Reviews.Title: “Love those huge flat-screen TVs!”
Reviews.Author: Kanaman
Reviews.Content: Had a great room on the Museum floor. Especially loved the huge - I mean huge - flat-panel TV on the wall, perfect for viewing from the bed. Really cool was also a USB port for charging my BlackBerry. Delightful staff, both at the reception and in the attached restaurant. The only point for improvement I could think of would be to design the bathroom as one room instead of the currently separated toilet/bath and sink areas.

Reviews.Title: “Ended up being expensive!”
Reviews.Author: shouston
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I were attending a concert at the Commodore so wanted to stay overnight in a hotel. I searched online through many reviews of downtown hotels and went with something that seemed upscale, cozy and fairly priced. The room rate was $117 for the gallery floor which seemed like a decent price. The mandatory valet parking ended up being $24 per day. We also had a last minute change of plans and our friends needed a place to stay as well so we switched (via telephone before our arrival) from a king bed to two queen beds instead. Upon checkout we were informed that the extra two people in the room amounted to $60 extra. SIXTY EXTRA?? I wish we had been informed about this extra charge (the hotel had lots of opportunity to advise us). Nothing was said upon our check in or our friends check in. We ordered the Classic Eggs Benedict room service the next morning. It was OK. I asked for soft eggs, they were hard. The potatoes were cold. The hollondaise was a bit gritty. NOT worth the $15 PLUS mandatory 18% gratuity charge. A $40 breakfast? Wow. I did like the noon check out time and appreciated the art pieces in the hotel lobby area. I would not pay extra for the gallery room -- we had 3 pieces of average looking art in our room. So overall, we started out with a $120 hotel and upon checkout had a $280 bill. Yikes!

Reviews.Title: “Very professional staff, rooms okay, wrong location”
Reviews.Author: Sonilein
Reviews.Content: From the outside the hotel didn't look inviting. Kind of 80's, with brownish windows. From the inside it's totally different. The lobby is nice, arty, spotless. The staff is amazing, maybe the most professional and helpful staff I ever met. We had a reservation for a Standard 2 queens room on the 2nd floor (at a great rate through travelzoo.com). Earlier check in was no problem. We had to wait some time, but the staff made sure we got our room asap. The room looked nice and clean, recently renovated, with a flatscreen tv, fridge etc. But... it faced the 'alley' behind the hotel. What we saw: ugly 10-15 story buildings, garbage cans and a homeless guy with a shopping cart, looking in the garbage cans. We like to sleep with open windows, so when we heard the noisy a/c unit from the back of the restaurant adjacent to the hotel we asked for another room. That was no problem at all. The 2nd room also faced the same alley, only there was some kind of electrical or water pump kind of thing (really don't know) that sounded like a constantly running engine. We felt terrible to ask for another room (I guess we were the staff's worst nightmare...), but again, that was not a problem. We upgraded (+ $20) to a room on the highest (6th) floor (616). I guess the $20 extra was for the higher floor, because the room was not recently renovated, there was no flat screen tv and we noticed orange mold in the shower. We spent the 1st of 3 nights in this room but didn't sleep well due to the same noisy a/c from the restaurant that we even heard on the highest floor. And we woke up early from noise around the garbage cans outside. The 2nd and 3rd night we slept in 617, which faced the street. We could even see the water. It was a 1 king bed room, but much nicer, cleaner, less worn out than 616. We didn't care about the street noise and were happy that we weren't bothered by the buzzing a/c. The valet service ($24/day) is very fast. The guy who works during the day turned out to be from the Netherlands (where we live)...so we spoke dutch. Nice. He recommended a couple of streets/areas we might like. He even left two cookies in the car when we checked out. When the wireless internet didn't work properly one of the staff members immediately brought a cable and arranged assistance from the internet company (that fixed the problem). We booked the Listel because we wanted a good hotel in a nice neighborhood with coffeehouses, shops and restaurants. When we arrived we were disappointed. Robson Street is a weird conglomeration of expensive shops, cheap restaurants, good and bad hotels, tourists, totally dressed up girls and homeless people. One day around 6pm we saw a guy peeing on the sidewalk. Pro: There is a Starbucks on the other side of the street, a Capers (organic food) and a Saveway a couple of blocks away. Skytrain a 10 min walk away. The art work in the lobby, the hallways and the rooms is nice, but on the other hand....it doesn't add comfort to the visit. The hotel itself is great, we felt welcome. But -for us- the hotel and the neighborhood just didn't match. So...yes, we would recommend the hotel to people, but we would tell them about the neighborhood. The next time we would probably not come back and choose a hotel in a quieter, nicer location instead.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: olgaehr
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located on the quieter end of Robson Street. Everything you need is there. The art gallery is only a few blocks away. We had a wonderful view of the waterfront and the main street. I was a bit disappointed we were not notified that we had to pay for parking. Although it's our fault for not checking but it would have been helpful if I was notified that the price for the hotel did not include the parking fee.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: drkc
Reviews.Content: A perfect place to stay for a couple of nights in Vancouver, Access to food and entertainment is perfect. Close to Stanley Park.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Choice for our Canadian Getaway!”
Reviews.Author: Centa11
Reviews.Content: I went to Vancouver to meet up with my husband while he was there for work. Our first night together we stayed at the Hyatt as that is where his conference was. For the rest of our long weekend we moved to the Listel not wanting to pay the outrageous cost for the Hyatt! Having stayed at the 2 different hotels in Vancouver, I strongly recommend the Listel over the larger chain hotel! The Listel was trendy but welcoming at same time! The staff was very friendly and approachable! My husband and I are not very "artsy" but appreciated the local art displayed through out the hotel! I especially enjoyed the complimentary french press coffee delivered directly to our room in the morning and the free upgrade to a room with an ocean view! I was a bit concerned our room might be noisy as it over looked Robson St but this was not an issue at all! Also felt O'Doul's restaurant not all it was cracked up to be, although we just dined there for breakfast only. Over all Listel was a perfect choice for our Canadian get away!

Reviews.Title: “You will be impressed!”
Reviews.Author: jeremygriese
Reviews.Content: My family enjoys staying in a hotel the night before taking a flight. We tried many different hotels in Vancouver and Richmond but none have made me want to write a review until we stayed at The Listel Hotel. First class service right from the moment we arrived at the front door. A highly trained and skilled front door man by the name of Marinho was there to treat us with honour and respect. He insisted on taking our things, parking our car and explaining how their top notch service works. He was incredibly helpful throughout our stay and so was everyone else. We were treated like VIP's at The Listel Hotel and I would never consider staying anywhere else while in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: Chiquita8888
Reviews.Content: Nice room, nice décor, helpful front desk staff, great location. I’ll be back! Liz, San Francisco

Reviews.Title: “sleepless in vancouver”
Reviews.Author: Willem51
Reviews.Content: the staff where friendly and helpfull and the hotel is nice but the bed was very uncomfortable and lumpy in our room. We then checked three different rooms untill we found a bed that might be better but still had a terrible sleep on this lumpy old mattress.For what I paid for this Hotel room compared to other hotels of comparable rating these beds are unexceptable. At least in mexico where the beds are about the same the weather and tequila make up for the discomfort.

Reviews.Title: “All to be expected”
Reviews.Author: shannond
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for our 2nd night in Vancouver. The first night I just booked a cheaper one, as we were only using it for limited hours and didnt see the point in spending more. Well the listel was only about 30$ more and was a difference between night and day. I dont have to much $ to spend as a student but this hotel was worth it, with the online prices/specials tho!. It was a great location for shopping -on robson- , dining, and a quick taxi ride to Granville, on the bus route, or a 10 min walk to the sky train. Upon arrival the front desk was very curtious, polite, and helpful. I asked for a king size when we got there but there was none left, and to make up for it he put me in one of the nicer standard rooms on the 2nd floor (note my reservation said a queen so this was no fault of theirs) . One of my biggest memories still, is the aroma of the room. They use aromatherapy everything, for lotion, shampoo, conditioner... the smell was wonderful and lingered lightly throughout the room. The room was also very clean, and full of all the extras you may need -or like- including the flat screen on the wall and fully stalked mini bar, nuts, snacks, reading material, etc. There is also an optional quick-order breakfast card for your desired time. And a complimentary french press coffee-or tea delivered to your door in the morning, also at desired time. Check out was also a great time, 12pm, instead of the standard 11pm. They even gave us an extended check-out to suit our needs. We didn't have time to check out the business center or fitness area, but we did use the internet in our room. Wireless was a little slow, so we asked for a cord to plug in at our desk, with no problem. If i had to pick some negatives, room service was a 'tad' expensive. Well breakfast anyways. Could use a little more art on this floor, as it is a featured art-hotel. Valet was curtious, but more a pain for us when we are not used to it.. because if we forgot something in our car we couldn't just go down to the parking and get it, we had to be escorted every time. Also remember the parking fee, that your pretty much have to pay anywhere you go downtown Vancouver. If you pay for over night parking at a standard parkade it is $20, the Listel is $24 because of the extra security/valet, although it wouldn't hurt to for them be a tad cheaper than parkades as a kind gesture to guests. All in all good stay, look forward to the next one.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms, Nice staff, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: zo0sha
Reviews.Content: The Listel couldn't have a better location in Vancouver, if you are into hanging out downtown. Located a step from tons of shops and little asian restaurants, the Listel is a must for its great price and clean rooms. Also, if driving in, they have a valet service and a gaurded parking lot which is a must because parking is close to impossible to find in the area and requires a constant trip to the parking Meter. Overall I would stay here again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Solid downtown value”
Reviews.Author: WineTool
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Listel twice now on business, and both times it's been a very pleasant experience. Tastefully appointed rooms, professional staff, a good bar, reasonable prices, and excellent location all contribute to an overall more-than-satisfactory stay. LOCATION The Listel is located downtown on Robson Street. Although I didn't get much of a chance to do any exploring, there are plenty of good places to eat and drink in walking distance, and the area has a good downtown vibe to it. There's a nice mix of business and residential buildings in the area. It's also close (10-minute walk) to Skytrain, which I found to be a good way to get places around the city (and much cheaper than a cab). Make sure you know which line you're on and which direction you're going, though; it can be confusing at first. ROOMS I've stayed in both Museum and Gallery level floors; both are stylish and well-appointed. Both rooms had a large work station, which was important since I had a fair amount of work to do. The beds and linens were high quality, bathrooms were small but pleasing, and everything was very clean--cleaning staff defintely gets high marks. If you want to run up your minibar tab, there are a wide variety of drinks and snack that will help you accomplish that. (There was even a "lover's package" container in the minibar; I'll leave its contents to your imagination. Useful if you're traveling with your spouse or love interest; not so much if you're by yourself, although be it far from me to judge.) The rooms are very quiet--always a bonus. FACILITIES The lobby is small and functional; not a place you hang out (go to the bar next door). I managed to drag myself to the exercise room for a quick workout. It's very small, with a few cardio machines and a universal gym. There's also a jacuzzi, which I didn't use. If you want a more serious workout, there's a gym that you can use, free of charge, a few blocks away. The equipment at the gym was fine, but it was crowded and a bit grimy. Bring your own lock if you want a locker. Odouls, the restaurant, has a good bar with friendly staff. There's frequently jazz playing in the later evenings. It's a comfortable place to get a drink and unwind, and the guys behind the bar are attentive and make a good gin and tonic. There are some decent beers and wines by the glass, and the wine list does a nice job of highlighting local vintners while providing plenty of alternatives from Europe, Australia, Washington, and California. The food's pretty good, too. You can get both wired and wireless internet access. I found the wired to be much faster, and I always bring my own cable so I didn't have to get one from the front desk. Generally, it has pretty much everything the typical business traveler needs. STAFF Hotel staff was helpful and professional. Both check-in and check-out were swift. I didn't really have any challenging requests, so I don't know how they'd handle those. SUMMARY Comfortable rooms, good restaurant/bar, satisfactory amenities, good location, good price. If you want to stay downtown, don't want to spend a bundle, but still want to stay in a nice place, you can do a lot worse than the Listel. I'll be back whenever I travel to Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: hmmCanada
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Listel for 2 nights in January. Got a reasonable price on Expedia. Stayed in a gallery room on the 5th floor- was very nice. Bed was comfortable, huge TV, clean bathrooms, and very quiet. Staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful. We were able the check in early as well as store our luggage before we left the city after we checked out. Complementary pot of coffee was great in the morning. Great location on Robson, close to everything. Great pieces of art through out the building, dancing sculptures were my favorite. I would recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Great Bargain”
Reviews.Author: jimreb
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of December. It was clean, modern and in a great location to shops, innumerable restaurants, and close to English Bay. The city was bustling and it was great to see. I had only been to Vancouver once before in the Summer, and stayed outside the city. I highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Snotty staff, basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: game_misconduct
Reviews.Content: Had a very mediocre 3 night stay at the Listel in November 2008. Front desk staff, with the exception of one person working the graveyard on a Saturday were rude, making snotty comments about guests within earshot of other guests. Although Housekeeping was polite and seemed a bit overworked, they disturbed our room despite the do not disturb sign. The rooms were basic, despite the pretense on the website of being a boutique hotel with aboriginal art in every room. One framed print in the room does not make for a unique aboriginal art experience. Beds were insanely uncomfortable and the washroom was incredibly cramped The jacuzzi was not operational during the stay. The only good thing I have to say about the hotel is the location is close enough to the central downtown core for the average tourist. If you're looking for a comfortable room with friendly staff, go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Central Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Geordie_Paddy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Listel Hotel twice during our recent trip to Canada. The first time we stayed was for 4 nights and we had booked a room on the Gallery Floor. The room was equivelant to a very good 3 star room with all the amenities you would expect. The only thing I could complain about is the lack of safes in the rooms. Although they do provide a service at reception where you can access your own safety deposit box. This seems perfectly safe as only staff have access but it is a bit inconvenient. The hotel has a lovely bar and restaurant and is decorated to a high stadard throughout. However the best thing about the hotel is the location. It is a 20 minute walk from Stanley Park, 15 minutes from Canada Place and right on Robson Street (the main street in town). There are some great restaurants within 5 minutes walk and we found the area to be very safe at night. However, the views from the rear of the hotel do overlook some rather run down high rise appartment blocks. Dont be put off by this. We returned for 1 more night after spending some time in Whistler and Victoria before leaving for Toronto and the hotel kindly accomodated our request for the same room, despite only booking a standard room. We found all of the staff to be pleasant and some very pleasant. Free internet access in reception is also a nice touch. We definately recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: TeeboneAustralia
Reviews.Content: Great location, nice room, friendly staff. Will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beware!”
Reviews.Author: roryCalgary
Reviews.Content: Upon check-out I discovered I was being charged $200.00 for smoking in my room! Although I had not smoked in the room and all the front desk staff admitted they had seen me going in and out to smoke, they would not reverse the charges. I had 3 different staff members come to the room and all admitted that there was absolutely no evidence of smoking in the room, they would not reverse the charge. They said they had to spray the room the day before and for that there was a 200.00 fee. No-one approached me about it at the time...they waited until I was checking out to inform me of the charges..had they informed me the day of the so called infraction...I would have gone to another hotel, they chose to wait until I was checking out and had no time to make an issue of the matter, and because I cannot prove what I did not do, I have absolutely no recourse. Be careful!

Reviews.Title: “Agree a room rate up front.”
Reviews.Author: RobbNevadaCity
Reviews.Content: It's a pleasant enough, if an expensive hotel. but they tried to charge > $7/day additional for "facilities charge" - not mentioned on web site or at check in, only on a paper note hidden in the key-card envelope. Also another $3/day for "destination marketing fee". in other words the room rate they quote you is increased WITHOUT YOUR AGREEMENT, by $10/day - so you need to get their agreement to waive these fees ahead of time, otherwise you will be informed they are MANDATORY. Turns out "facilities charge" is for unlimited LD calls in Canada (we don't know anyone in Canada), 20 pages of fax/day (haven't sent a fax in years!) and unlimited internet (didn't have a computer with me). Parking is an extra $24/day, you can't self park. Breakfast in the room is $18, plus $2.5 delivery charge, plus GST, tip NOT INCLUDED (their Capitals) - so breakfast for 2 in the room runs $50. The tea left in the room is undrinkable Nestea Orange Pekoe, so take your own tea bags!

Reviews.Title: “Unique Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Supertramp08
Reviews.Content: We checked in very late with no problem. They were helpful and friendly which was especially nice when we were tired and needed rest! The Listel is attractive and funky with art suprising you around every corner. Even the luggage cart was sculpted metal. Price was high, but maybe not compared to other hotels in the area. There wasn't much there that wasn't expensive. Our room was great - comfortable, clean, terrific view, and a "balcony" big enough for a party!! We loved it. It was also in an ideal location to grab food at midnight when we arrived and again in the morning before we had to take off. By the way, we were leaving for a cruise and one of the staff took it up on himself to confirm our boarding pier without us even asking him to. It was extremely thoughtful and a big help to us!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant 'Art' Hotel Listel”
Reviews.Author: GwennyLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Listel Hotel in Vancouver in early August. It was a joy to stay there. The art gallery theme extended to the bedrooms which were well appointed. The staff were helpful. Free internet access and telephone calls to the US and Canada were provided for three hours a day. The O'Doul's Restaurant and Bar downstairs served excellent food for breakfast, lunch and dinner. The location was convenient and we would certainly recommend this small hotel to anyone visiting Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Try another hotel”
Reviews.Author: srqtraveler_8
Reviews.Content: We checked in late and were given a simple room on the second floor of the building. The location is excellent, as there is shopping and even a whole foods market nearby. The bed was not comfortable and was extremely hard. We called the front desk at 8:00 AM and inquired about having some laundry done. They instructed us to place the laundry bag outside our door and they would retrieve it withing a half hour, send it out and it would be ready by 5PM. We checked and the bag was picked up in short order. At 5PM we checked with the front desk to see the status of our order. The gentleman said he had just delivered all the laundry that came back that day. He went back behind the desk and found the laundry bag sitting in a closet. Was given directions for a laundry 3 blocks away if I wanted to take it myself. We were there to take a cruise and had to check out the next day, so we had to take our dirty laundry with us. I expected better service at a hotel in this price range. Another beef: the elevator carpets looked as if they had weeks of lint and dirt and were never cleaned. Not a first rate hotel. I like to stay somewhere that gives great service and is clean and comfortable. The rest of the family stayed at the Comfort Inn and they seemed to receive much better value for their money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: bn1
Reviews.Content: We have just arrived back from a holiday in Canada that included a stay at the Listel. I must admit I thought the decor was dated for what is billed as a trendy boutique hotel, however the location is great & the rooms are clean & quiet. The front service especially from Anita was excellent. She took on a problem we had with a double booking and persued it where we had failed. She has conatcted us when promised and even though we are back home she is still working to resolve it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: katkat17
Reviews.Content: We paid £545 for 4 nights at The Listel and had a great stay. The room was very clean, comfortable and quiet. Staff were very friendly, Sebastian was particularly helpful. We used the whirlpool in the small gym pool area which was empty, great after a day of walking! The lobby area was quite small. We found there to be a lot of homeless people in Vancouver which was quite upsetting but we didn't feel threatened by any of them. The Listel is in a great location although we weren't keen on Robson Street, too commercialised, a bit like Oxford Street in London! Easy to walk everywhere and the transfer bus from the airport drops you right outside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location (at a price)”
Reviews.Author: ZachariahBullfrog
Reviews.Content: Excellent location - right on Robson Street. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Parking at the hotel + taxes priced this hotel at just under CAD$300. A little bit expensive for what it was. Would i stay there again? Not at that price.

Reviews.Title: “Underwhelming”
Reviews.Author: sphinxridd
Reviews.Content: Considering this is a 4-star hotel (according to Kayak.com), I was quite disappointed. Below are the things that contributed to my negative impression and disappointment: 1. I had a car with me, after I pulled up in front of the lobby, the valet stand wasn't attended. I had to walk into the lobby and ask for the valet person. 2. When I walked into the lobby, I noticed flies circling the lobby. the lobby wasn't well lit and was quite small. 3. They were overbooked for the type of room I requested and I got bumped from a 1-king-size-bed room to a standard-2-queen-size bed room. 4. This one was personal preference - the mattress was quite firm and wasn't very comfortable. Listel is towards the north end of Robson St and I drove over from the South side and passed quite a few hotels. If you are looking for a hotel on Robson Street, I'd suggest that you look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown Listel”
Reviews.Author: rizzle
Reviews.Content: The Listel Hotel was our second stop on our honeymoon. Our first stop, The Coast Hotel Victoria, BC was so great that it was hard to transition to Listel without noticing a few minor flaws. On the plus side: The Location- It couldn't be better. Right in the heart of the city. The Customer Service- We attended the Managers Reception on the first afternoon we were there and enjoyed free wine and appetiezers. We briefly met one of the managers and were discussing our honeymoon plans. The next afternoon we returned to our room and there were chocolate covered strawberries and a card welcoming us to the hotel and congratulating us on our marriage. How thoughtful! On the down side: The room was a bit dingy and small with a few small rips in the curtains. Our windows just faced the alley so we didn't have much of a view. It wasn't really a big deal but it was hard after coming from a great hotel and view in Victoria.

Reviews.Title: “Art hotel”
Reviews.Author: bug09
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Listel for two nights on our way to the east coast. We found the staff friendly and helpful, and the room spacious and clean and tastefully decorated. I did have a problem with noise however, with the room we booked backing onto a side street. The hotel restaurant was good, not excellent, and a bit pricy for us. Location was excellent, with attractions within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, perfectly decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: EmmaM2006
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Listel for just a couple of nights. The staff were friendly and polite, and the room was smart and a decent size. It was nothing special, but the location was good - walking distance to downtown, Gastown, and Stanley Park. We didn't try the restaurant as we didn't see many vegetarian options on the menu, but it looked smart/"comfortable" and not too pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Home from home”
Reviews.Author: CarolineMiche
Reviews.Content: My friend and I booked this hotel after reading relatively good reviews. We were not disappointed. Bearing in mind that we are both hygiene freaks, we were both pleasantly surprised to find that the room and bathroom were very clean, and spacious. However, what sets this hotel apart from its peers is the fantastic customer service. The staff always went out of their way to help us, whether it be with directions, tours, or even tips on good night spots. Jesse and Sebastian were particularly nice and always on hand to help when needed. Also, the hotel is in an ideal location, right on Robson Street, five minutes from Stanley Park (rent a bike, it's amazing), and within walking distance from anywhere in downtown Van. We had a really good experience there, and would definitely recommend it. If you want good value for money, and an overall great experience, the Listel is a perfect choice. Caroline and Michele from London

Reviews.Title: “not that keen on the Listel”
Reviews.Author: CassGeorge
Reviews.Content: I am quite ambivalent about the Listel after staying there for 3 nights in May. The hotel is in a great location - right on Robson Street and easy walking to all the sites. Having said that Vancouver is an easy city to walk around and any centrally located hotel will give you a good base. The on-site restaurant and bar O'Douls served excellent food , and the staff were really knowledgeable and helpful with wine selections. However, the room was average. Whilst the hotel attempts to project a groovy ambience, this is not really reflected in the room decor, which is tired, with a very old TV . As others have commented, the bathrooms are small - in fact ours was tiny - you could stretch out your arms and easily touch the walls. It was so tiny, the sink/basin wasnt even in the bathroom , but in the room, just inside the door as you walk in. The 'Art Hotel' moniker was also a puzzle. Our room (on the gallery floor) did have 3 lovely pictures but there was no information at all about the artist in the room. When I asked at the desk, I was told that the plaque with the artist information must have fallen off, and the front desk could not give me any information about the artist. The corridors on our floor were also completely devoid of any art, other than a display at the lift. Whilst the Listel tries to position itself as a boutique hotel, it really isn't up to that standard. Overall, I was disappointed with the Listel and would stay elsewhere next time I visit Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Merce70
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights a couple of weeks ago and found it to be a nice twist on the usual big city hotel. As other reviewers have mentioned the art dotted around the hotel adds to it's feel and the staff was always very friendly and helpful, particularly the valet parking staff. We had a few drinks in O'Douls downstairs and again the staff were always friendly and chatty. The location is great and within easy walking distance of the Pacific Centre, Canada Place and Gastown. The only drawback was that we were constantly accosted by beggars upon leaving the hotel - which isn't the hotels fault ! - but it was a little offputting. I have visited Vancouver many times and this was the first time I'd seen such a large homeless population on Robson Street and it became a little awkward every time we left the hotel. As I said this isn't the hotels fault but perhaps visitors with small children might be a bit put off as some of these characters were quite intimidating.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort, service and location: a winning package”
Reviews.Author: felipeordonez
Reviews.Content: The Listel is a real "find" in Vancouver. I had never heard of it, and accepted my travel agent's recommendation. I didn't want to pay 5-star prices but wanted something modern and comfortable in a good location. The Listel Vancouver combines comfortable, spacious rooms with impeccable service at a great location on Robson Street steps away from boutiques and restaurants, all at an affordable price. The hotel is dedicated to contemporary art: it decorates the rooms, the public spaces and on several floors the lift lobbies; the effect is most pleasing. Throughout the Listel, from the front desk to the housekeepers to the restaurant (O'Doul's, a jazz venue), the staff are unfailingly helpful. After two days, the waiter at breakfast knew what I was going to order, even down to the English-strength tea. One small niggle is that bathrooms are on the small side, though adequate, and could use some updating. Overall, I found the Listel an excellent place to stay, and would happily return there if I am again in Vancouver, a delightful city.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, warm, and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: mfgtravel
Reviews.Content: The staff would stop what ever they were doing to help you. Everyone from management, concierge, housekeeping, and waiter (from restaurant) always had a smile on their face. I had some bad luck hit right before my conference and they made sure it got arranged. I would definately stay there again just for the hospitality. Great location too.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, great staff, superb location!”
Reviews.Author: CorrieExtra
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights at the Listel from May 15th to May 19th. I am a Travel Agent in the UK and I have stayed at many great hotels worldwide, this hotel is in a fantastic location and within walking distance of all Vancouvers attractions. Front desk staff and Valet Parking staff are excellent, nothing was too much trouble, they were always willing to assist with whatever you required. We had a Gallery Floor room, the room could do with some modernisation, the bathroom was very small. Wireless Internet is free in all rooms, a nice change from high charges in many other hotels. Book the Listel and enjoy, we will definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Finally, exceptional customer service”
Reviews.Author: SaltandVinegar
Reviews.Content: Hands down the best parking\ valet service and front desk service in Vancouver. The Listel on Robson may be just a 3 star hotel, the room rate reflecting this, and our room was small and needing a bit of a face lift - but listen, the manager of this hotel is doing something right because his staff offer a level of customer service that is unmatched - and we have stayed in them all in Van - 3, 4, and 5 star .... to be disappointed more often than not with the lack of customer appreciation and service, and parking nightmares come true. Not the Listel, though, give the Listel manager a call, fellow managers - and find out why. A perfect location in the heartbeat of Vancouver, this is a clean, perfectly friendly staffed hotel. With the added and often sought after bonus of knowing my vehicle is parked in a compltely secure lot accessd exclusively by valet staff.

Reviews.Title: “Loved, Loved, Loved the Listel!”
Reviews.Author: ShugaC
Reviews.Content: This review is a little late - I stayed for my honeymoon last August for a week & absolutely fell in love with the Listel! Perfect location for walking all over & right near the Hop On Hop Off Tour bus, which was great for us. Bed was comfortable, bathrooms great & we had a nice high view. Everyone working there was courteous & helpful. We especially looooved the food at O'Douls. We had a bed & breakfast deal at Listel & enjoyed breakfast everyday as well as 2 dinners while listening to live jazz. Loved the "artsy" feel of the hotel. We have recommended it to several people who are going to Vancouver this year & I know we'll be back there very soon. Thanks Listel! Maybe we'll see you on our 1 year anniversary!

Reviews.Title: “In the middle of the action”
Reviews.Author: CanadaFlygirl
Reviews.Content: Visited Vancouver for two (sunny!) days mid-February 2008. The airport shuttle ($13) dropped me at the front entrance of the hotel. The room overlooked Robson Street and all the pre-Olympics construction in the area. Everything was clean, the bed was comfortable, the pillows fluffy and there were a few extras that made the stay very enjoyable. We were invited to a wine reception the first night of our stay which was a nice perk and met some interesting guests there. There is an internet kiosk just off the front desk as well as wireless access. The hotel is right in the middle of Robson Street which made it very convenient to do some shopping (and eating) in the area. Granville Island (what a great public market!) was quite convenient as was the skytrain station, each several blocks away but still in walking distance. The staff were all eager to help with directions and maps. I would definitely recommend the Listel if you want to be on Robson.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, I guess...”
Reviews.Author: urkidn
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night following a concert at GM Place. Upon check-in, we noticed we had accidentally booked dbl beds and asked if we could have a king room instead. The man at the front desk seemed to be annoyed at this simple request and gave a rather curt "NO" and went on with the check-in process, no explanation and no further acknowledgment of the request. It's not a big deal, but I felt like he was belittling us. Mind you, it was after midnight and we had just walked from GM Place in the pouring rain so we were looking somewhat bedraggled. Next we asked about late night eating in the area, and he proceeds to tell us about a pizza place across the street that would be fine as long as we didn't have any meat. What??? I think we'll pass. Exhausted, we entered the room and were hit with a wave of heat, tried to adjust the air con which didn't want to work. It was already quite late, and judging by our earlier encounter at the front desk, we decided to just sleep with the window open. This was fine until the early morning when the gulls came around the garbage dumpster in the alley below us and started squawking. Oh well... Other than the heating problem, the room itself was pretty typical in an unmemorable way. We opted for a standard room as we were only there to sleep.The TV was something out of the 70's but it was fine for the morning news. We couldn't find a remote which was annoying. My initial reaction was that the mattress was like a brick but we slept fine on it. Overall, it's an ok hotel but as the saying goes, you can never get a second chance to make a first impression. Based on ours, we won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: binderfrank
Reviews.Content: Judging by some of the reviews in Trip Advisor the Listel was enjoyed by many but panned by some regarding the quality of the bathrooms. We were prepared to see a few faults, but when we walked into our room, the bath and room were in top notch condition! Overall, the hotel was terrific. Nice rooms, decent bed (although with seemingly polyester sheets), great location, helpful staff, all the things one could want. A special applause for the recycling basket in our room, which my wife and I have never seen on our frequent travels. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not as advertised - great disappointment”
Reviews.Author: emm23
Reviews.Content: Other positive reviews may have been the case at one time, but it certainly does not reflect my experience or reaction when there for a three night stay over New Year's Eve 2007/New Year's Day 2008. Having done quite a bit of research on hotels here, I chose The Listel based on the website and many positive reviews it's received on the travel blogs. I chose The Listel particularly because it was a boutique hotel, with art. The photos and text on the Listel website and in its brochures in no way resembles the hotel rooms as they presently are. Initially, I was taken to a suite which featured only three works of art - and NO other color in the living area, bedroom, or especially the bath. We asked to see two other suites and they were little better. I then went down to the front desk and asked for the manager, but was told there was none onsite to speak with. Pointing out that nothing we'd seen even remotely resembled the website photos, I was shown the suite actually shown in the photo. It was unmade, but it was offered. There is little in the way of décor, other than a few paintings and two ceramics. There ARE colored pillows, but they are few. There are no flowers, books, etc. as shown on the website, and the furniture is worn and shabby. The drapes in the bedroom do not come all the way down to the ledge, and so bright lights from Robson Street stream in all night for the person sleeping closest to the window. A small television in the living area, an armoire that is very difficult to use and no two-line phone as advertised. The lighting - area lighting, task lighting, etc. is poor or nonexistent. MOREOVER, the bathroom should be an embarrassment to hotel management. Plastic, prefabricated, monotone color, no décor whatsoever, a cracked sink, low water pressure and, to top it off, the toilet backed up and we had to call maintenance. I will say that the porter was very helpful and friendly. He was the highlight of our stay. I debated long and hard about leaving the hotel early, and the manager offered to move us, but did not want to waste our time moving when we came to explore and enjoy this city. The Listel Hotel has a good premise and it appears that it once was what it purports to be - special, sophisticated, wonderful. It certainly is not that now - it is badly in need of refurbishment and attention. It was a great disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Location - so close to everything!”
Reviews.Author: laurabanff
Reviews.Content: I only stayed for one night but this little gem stood out from the rest: Loved: * Great internet connection * Nice original artwork in each room * Friendly service * Location - close to everything Not so much: * the view to the alley I would recommend it and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: matsurfer
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 nights with my wife at this hotel. Really clean, quiet and good size rooms, make sure you book 2 queen beds though as we had a bigger room this way, even if you are using only one. Check in was good and quick, although they didnt give us much info on the hotel, we only found out by accident that they had a gym, whirlpool ect. Dont go expecting art filled rooms though, we cracked up laughing when we saw the two supposed art pieces on our wall, which looked like something you could buy at dollarworld. although the corridors are filled with nice work. Best bit of the hotel is the location, right on robson, and the jazz bar downstairs where the service and atmosphere made us return 4 times, just fantastic. all in all, a great hotel and i would stay here again and reccomend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Bad Service!!!!Bad Receptionist!!!!”
Reviews.Author: PAMportland
Reviews.Content: I AM STILL VERY UPSET about the happen end of last week. We stayed in Vancouver-when we checked in the hotel receptionist recommended stay the upgrade floor and he said we can get morning coffee service. I was look forward to get morning coffee service and he did not mentioned about "SIGN UP" coffee service outside of the door. I called next morning 8:35am and women receptionist said” Coffee service is until 8:30am and we can't" I told her receptionist never mentioned the sign up the paper, she said “IT WAS ON THE BED. HOW YOU MISSED THE PAPER BEFORE YOU GO THE BED” SHE WAS SOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOOO RUDE! I talked another people and he said OK. But completely mess our great escape weekend! In fact, coffee service was until 9:00am!!! I don’t know how you educate people. I NEVER RECOMMEND TO OTHER PEOPLE to STAY THIS HOTEL!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased.”
Reviews.Author: NatGreen
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights (5th - 11th September) in one of the 'Museum' rooms. The 'in town' location is good, just far enough up Robson to be away from some of the hustle and bustle and, northwards, a reasonable walk down hill to Coal Harbour Seawalk. Reception was always highly manned, pleasant and very helpful. We thought the general ambience of the Listel was very tasteful and a very definite improvement on the corporate hotel model. Furnishings and artwork were modern and of designer quality. One slight criticism would be the limited amount of drawer space for smaller items of clothing etc. O'Douls restaurant attached to the hotel is to be recommended. Booking, other than for breakfast, is a wise move.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Listel”
Reviews.Author: grainte53
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights from 19 to 23 Sept 2007. Found the hotel via Expedia and booked 2 months in advance. Arrived on the book in day and the staff were excellent. Allowed us to store our baggage from cruise ship gratis until rooms ready. Same with check out day - we flew at 7.30pm and the hotel allowed us to store baggage after we checked out until time to travel to airport. Rooms very spacious and clean. I though the Listel was better than the Sheraton Wall where we had stayed for 3 days. It appears that some of the hotel we saw had been renovated recently. Our rooms were 327 and 329 facing Robson Street. We were there from Wednesday to Sunday and loved going to bed with the window to Robson street open listening to the traffic signals chirping away. Weren't kept awake by any noise at all. Staff were very heplful and cheery all the time. Thoroughly recommend Odul's and Moxies restaurents. Great town and will definaetly stay again at the Listel

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with personality!”
Reviews.Author: sydneysider
Reviews.Content: I travel widely and to be honest I am fussy. We booked our visit to Vancouver as a spur of the moment and therefore could not get into other "preferred" hotels..what luck! We stayed in suite 511..at first I was a little disappointed. Yes. there is the odd stain on the soft, wool carpet and the light fittings and parts of the bathroom are dated BUT the quality of the bedding, fixtures and personality of the room made up for it. I loved the bay window seat and because we had a lot of rain I was very happy to sit in this comfy seat and watch the world go by(there are water views as well!/). Room service was amazing! We ate breakfast via this way each day. Beatiful and hot, including the coffee. Upon ringing room service we asked for poached eggs and we were asked "How would we like them" and then "what kind of toast" etc etc. Very professional and special. These guys understand service and customer support! Lots of little extras with room service including lovely biscotti with our coffee. Fab location to boot!!!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing stay at the Listel”
Reviews.Author: Austravel
Reviews.Content: I had a very relaxing stay at the Listel Vancouver. A great property that is very well located on Robson Street, the main retails street in Vancouver. The staff were excellent - nothing was to much trouble. The rooms are comfortable and the restaurant very good. I would definiely recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “The Listel is A Gem”
Reviews.Author: bonophile
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Listel on August 17 for one night prior to cruising. This hotel is just gorgeous. The artwork is beautiful and added to the hotel's charm. The staff is friendly and extremely accommodating. I had booked directly on their website. I had several questions for them prior to our visit, which were answered immediately. When we arrived, we were told we had been upgraded to a suite on the 6th floor. It was fabulous and such a nice surprise. We had a view through to the harbor where the cruise ships were coming in. The onsite restaurant -- O'Doul's was very nice. We had dinner there -- great place to watch the activity on Robson Street. And the food was terrific. This hotel is convenient to shopping, Canada Place and lots of restaurants. We rented a car for the day -- valet parking is available at the hotel and we took advantage of it. We only wish we had more time in Vancouver and at this lovely property. If we ever get back to that part of the world, we would definitely stay at the Listel again.

Reviews.Title: “great location - wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: RRJBoston
Reviews.Content: lovely boutique hotel in wonderful residential but convenient location -- lots of restaurants and activities nearby -- rooms modern and very well kept -- excellent comfortable beds -- would stay here again happily made for a great vacation spot

Reviews.Title: “Love, love, love the Listel”
Reviews.Author: reveredelafrance
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at The Listel. The first was by chance, the second was very much looked forward to. The hotel is beautifully decorated with art; local and otherwise, and keeps a theme throughout. If the Vancouver Art Gallery is showing French Impressionist paintings, then so does the hotel. They also have gorgeous sculptures throughout the lobby and common areas. The hotel's restaurant, O'Doul's is really good. Decorated beautifully, the menu is excellent and changes daily (from what we could see). Their wine cellar is excellent and decently priced. Staff are very friendly. Other hotel guests seem to be all European (and us!). Makes for interesting conversation at breakfast; who's going where (cruises, train travel, Whistler, Vancouver Island, etc.). Great hotel, GREAT location, as it is steps away from all the fab shops on Robson Street. Great gelato shop a few doors down, too. Aveda products in the room! Can't say enough great things about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, esp with all the free jazz”
Reviews.Author: crazychets
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights before flying back home to London, excellent stay, lovely hotel, completely sold out the weekend i stayed there as it was the jazz fest. live jazz in the bar and free to the hotel residents, added bonus. but never felt like there other people there, no screaming kids, no loud people, nothing it was great. Hotel excellent location for shopping, right on the main strip, lots of places to go out to eat and drink in located with 10mins walking distance, view of the ocean to one side and mountains to the other, lots of arty deco throughout the hotel, room was nice and spacious.

Reviews.Title: “Godd hotel. Good location.”
Reviews.Author: harriskris
Reviews.Content: DATE: Aug 19 – 21, 2007 My wife and I and another couple spent 3 nights at the Listel Hotel. We liked it. The rooms were clean and comfortable; and it’s centrally located in a fun place of Vancouver. The hotel staff was especially helpful. It seems we were always asking them about how to get somewhere, or a recommendation for a restaurant. They were great. It’s always difficult to find a place in a city you’ve never been. I hate it when we wind up with a turkey. The Listel Hotel is a winner.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: tony2mayston
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Listel for three nights.The ambience and the service is very good.O'Doul's restaurant is part of the hotel and there is nightly easy listening live music.The hotel is on Robson Street which is at the hub of Vancouver .If you are going on a cruise it is quite near Canada Place. Tony and Liz Mayston

Reviews.Title: “Just a wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Elvin224
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled up from Oregon for the first time in many years, all in all we had a really good trip, but our stay at the Listel was particularly enjoyable. The location can't be beat, all the staff that we dealt with were just great and the room we had was nicely decorated. I really prefer smaller hotels and the Listel and hotels like it are the reason, My only complaint, and its a minor one would be the price of parking, expensive parking seems to be pretty standard for hotels in large city's, and it can really make a big impact on a hotel bill!

Reviews.Title: “What a find!”
Reviews.Author: Kit75
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel because it was one of the few that we found two queen beds in one room. Upon arrival, we received a welcome and most gracious customer service. Anything that we phoned for was delivered to our room promptly. The room was clean, spacious enough for a hotel (museum floor), and we found everyone from the front desk to the bellmen/valet to be extraordinarily cordial and helpful. The rates are reasonable for this small classy hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding stay at the Listel”
Reviews.Author: PATRICE52
Reviews.Content: My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay at The Listel Hotel! The staff provided a warm welcome. Daily recommendations were given to us on sites to visit as well as directions and travel tips. Upon our return to the hotel, inquiries about our day ended in discussions of Vancouver and its various attractions. It was obvious the staff was proud of its city. The room was attractive, clean, and we loved the iPod dock provided so we could listen to music on our iPod in the evenings. The valet parking was prompt and worth the cost to avoid the hassel of finding parking in the city. When our car was delivered to us on the day of check out, a parting gift was left in our car - two homemade cookies and a thank you for our stay. We couldn't have asked for a better accommodation. Frommer was correct in calling The Listel Hotel a "find." We would definitely return and suggest it to our friends!!!

Reviews.Title: “Simply fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: miless
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights in June. Emailed hotel before we arrived to request a sea-view room in a quiet location, high-up with a huge double bed! Also explained it was a special wedding anniversary for us. Got an email back the next day confirming they would do their best. Guess what, they got everything right! Room was on the top floor (6th), had a view of the harbour (I worked out only 1 or 2 rooms per floor would have this view) and the bed was enormous. To top it all, there was a tray of complimentary strawberries dipped in chocolate with a nice orchid flower plus a card wishing us happy anniversary. The team at the hotel were first class. The location is great. The double glazing ensures NO street noise is apparant. I would recommend anyone who is visiting Vancouver to try the Listel - simply fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Listel is a good choice”
Reviews.Author: Yukonner
Reviews.Content: The Listel is perfectly positioned in the vibrant Robson Street, where there is an incredible variety of restaurants. The response to my booking inquiry was very quick. I felt that they really try hard to respond quickly to requests, whatever the request might be. For me, a clean and tidy room is very important. I made good use of the Fitness Facility. I thought the price was competetive and it appears to attract the type of guest that doesn't make a noise and ruin it for the other guests. Altogether, I would certainly go back to the Listel.

Reviews.Title: “Overall pretty good”
Reviews.Author: Belcasino
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through Trailfinders in the UK. Stayed here on the last leg of our holiday after spending over a week in California. The hotel is in a good location, on Robson Street, and the staff were efficient and quite friendly, though not overwhelmingly so (or this could just be after spending time in California where people can go over the top!).
