Stayed in a Museum Floor room which had a huge, comfy bed, desk, table and chair, large wardrobe with mirrored doors. Bathroom pretty pokey, actually, with sink/vanity unit outside main bathroom. No real complaints to make, everything was clean but not terribly exciting. For our "Museum" room, we had two (2) pictures on the wall which weren't exactly Picassos, but we didn't spend much time in the room. On our last night, we were woken up by a dripping noise and discovered a leak from maybe the air conditioning unit inside our wardrobe. Luckily we had already packed otherwise our clothes would have been wet. We reported this to the reception so presumably they will have rectified the problem now. Ate breakfast in the restaurant attached to the hotel - a bit pricey for some things, but very fresh with a good choice of food. Also had some drinks in the bar area at night - they have a good selection of wines from Canada which are definitely worth a try, and the waiters were really friendly and knowledgeable. No real negatives about this hotel. You have to insert your room card into the lift for it to work which, while being a good security measure, is a bit fiddly and hit-and-miss meaning we had an unexpected tour up and down some floors until it decided to work!

Reviews.Title: “Great location,but ask for alley side”
Reviews.Author: Recoveringlawyer
Reviews.Content: Great location, but avoid rooms on 2nd floor Robson side if you need quiet. We got one that was right over the courtyard for the bar and they played jazz music until midnight(if you like jazz and stay up late, ask for room 225). They moved us the next night. Housekeeping and front desk staff were very good. Exercise room contains hot tub, so be prepared to sweat and not just because you are working hard. "Business Center" is a high speed internet access computer and a printer in a nook next to front desk. Close to Stanley Park and all your entertainment needs.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Corkonienne
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed in a room on the museum floor for three nights over the Victoria Day weekend and found the Listel to be a comfortable & quiet hotel, good value especially considering the location on Robson St. Our room faced the alley behind the building, but that didn't bother me. The artwork in our room was very nice, Haida style prints & carvings. The beds were large and very comfortable. The staff were helpful and friendly, including the staff in O'Douls, the bar/restaurant which is attached to the hotel. We had brunch there one morning, which was relatively expensive but nice, would be a good place to go with family etc. I would recommend this hotel if you are looking to stay somewhere central in the West End, it's certainly worth what you pay - having said that I think we were still paying winter rates!

Reviews.Title: “A relaxing stay at the Listel Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Seattle_Traveler_07
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our recent stay at the Listel Hotel (May 12-14, 2007). It was our first visit and I can't recall a more pleasant stay anywhere (and I stay in a lot of hotels for work). The room was delightful, the ambiance of hotel elegant, and the staff so helpful. The artwork throughout the hotel is a real treat--it as if you are staying in a gallery of superb local art. The valet parking is very helpful for downtown accommodation. I would stay here again and heartily recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “just okay, but certainly not great”
Reviews.Author: k_cooper_nyc
Reviews.Content: while the lobby is warm and inviting, with a big fireplace and nice places to sit, once we got to our room we were somewhat disappointed. the view from our window was horrible, we were over-looking a korean barbeque restaurant that had an adjoining karaoke bar that was loud enough to keep us up at night. the drinking glasses in our room were dirty and the bathroom was quite dark...especially when you took a shower, as the shower curtain was big and heavy and blocked out even more light. the room was pretty drab and old fashioned and dark, not really like the way the public parts of the hotel look. in addition, we were told at check-in that this hotel featured local art on most of its floors (including ours) but the paintings in our room looked nothing like the art featured in the public areas. it was basically just the kind of non-descript paintings you see in other hotels. at check-in, the concierge also proudly announced that we would receive free french press coffee every morning, but we only received this one of the mornings we were there. while the service was generally great, we did have trouble getting room service to answer the phone in the morning, even if we called well after they began serving breakfast. all that aside, the staff was very friendly and helpful (since we had to call them so many times to ask for things or have things in the room fixed), they offer a computer for guest use in the lobby, the bathrooms feature aveda amenities and we even received a nice parting gift of chocolate chip cookies in our car as we left. so, all in all, it was okay...but not so great.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Bagpuddycat
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the Listel at the end of our Vancouver/Whistler/Vancouver trip. We wanted to say at the Barclay House B&B, where we stayed for the first weekend, but they were fully booked. The Listel was second best to the Barclay House, but was still a very pleasant hotel in a superb location. We had a B&B package and stayed in a Gallery floor room (the 4th floor). Our windows looked out over Robson, which made for great people-watching opportunities, and we could see down Jervis to Coal Harbour and the suburbs and mountains beyond. There was no problem with noise at all, despite being in such a busy location and staying on Saturday night. The staff were pleasant and helpful, the room was very comfortable (the window seat especially) and the food in O'Doul's was excellent. Checkout time is relatively late (12 noon) which made our lives a little easier on our last day, with an evening flight home. I can't really fault this hotel - the worst I can say is that I can't see the point in having good coffee and a proper coffee machine in the room if the only "milk" provided is CoffeeMate - even UHT milk in teeny plastic pots would have been an improvement. It's a very very small thing to complain about though, and I only really noticed it as a contrast to the otherwise high standards. In fact, the only reason it doesn't merit 5 stars is that, having stayed at the Barclay House B&B for our first weekend, nothing else could really warrant the same score I gave that!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Listel”
Reviews.Author: lajollauser
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Listel in early April in a Gallery Room. Ask if you reserve through the hotel about different views - we were very lucky to have an amazing view of the water, mountains, and Robson Street out our windows. I believe the Gallery Rooms might be on the higher numbered floors with better views? (Paid $155 Canadian per night.) The Gallery Rooms also come with free delivered french press coffee or tea every morning until 9, which was a nice way to start the morning. The room was everything one expects in a quality boutique hotel - comfortable bed, good pillows, good shower with consistent water pressure/temperature, nice toiletry items (Aveda shampoo, conditioner, soap). The location here is fabulous, and it's great to be right near the shopping and restaurants of Robson Street, but we did not have any noise issues at all (either from other rooms or from Robson Street itself). And I know we had neighbors in both rooms next to our room, so at least in my experience, the soundproofing is quite good. The location was wonderful - central to almost everything. You can easily walk to Stanley Park, the waterfront, downtown, or towards the water in the other direction to get a little boat to Granville Island. Renting bikes to ride through Stanley Park was very fun! It is also central to the city buses, so we took the bus to other areas of town. We took a bus to the Seabus port, and then transferred to another bus to get to the Lynn Canyon Suspension Bridge (the "free" suspension bridge). City buses are $2.25-$2.50 Canadian and include all transfers (including the seabus) for up to 90 minutes. We ate light dinner (salads and desserts) in the hotel restaurant one night and breakfast. We also later discovered the hotel restaurant has a bar menu that has lower priced menu options than the regular restaurant dinner menu. The hotel has live jazz every night, although it seemed like the musicians took a lot of breaks, more than average? But we enjoyed the live music we did experience! The food we ate there was very good. In my experience, regular downtown Vancouver was more business oriented. Gastown seemed a little too touristy but was nice for walking through. I think the West End part of downtown is a perfect location for a pleasure trip (or close enough to the other parts of downtown if you're there for business). There were fabulous fine dining options near the hotel, as well as lots of international and fast food options that were very reasonably priced (Japanese noodle houses, pizza by the slice, etc.).

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel - great price”
Reviews.Author: ellie50
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights while attending a downtown conference. We got an excellent rate on Expedia at $114/night Cdn. for a Museum room. Valet parking was $24/day. It's a smaller boutique-sytle hotel, which we liked. Loved our room and the West Coast native decor (which might not be to everyone's taste). It was a pretty standard size hotel room (roomier than some, smaller than some) and I liked the separate sink and vanity area outside the tub and toilet area. The quality of reading materials on the desk and in the rack by the window were a far cry above the usual tourist brochures and advertising stuff in most hotels: Books, anthology magazines, art and dance magazines. Very much appreciated. The staff was warm and friendly, valet service prompt., and you can't beat the location for ease of getting to shops and dining. We've already recommended The Listel to our son and his girlfriend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jimm1107
Reviews.Content: I just loved this hotel! The staff was absolutely wonderful, the location is great and I really liked their connection with the art... I stayed on one of the art gallery floors, but friends stayed on one of the museum floors, they're nice but I preferred my art gallery room. Lot's of good restaurants and shops nearby, Vancouver's a very walkable city and the hotel is centrally located right downtown... we'll certainly stay here again next time up.

Reviews.Title: “Nice But Could Get Pricey”
Reviews.Author: Houston111
Reviews.Content: Listel is located in the heart of downtown Vancouver. It is a nice hotel but I did find some problems, 1. They only have valet parking ($25 a day, so if you have a car there it could get expensive really fast) 2. Room we stayed in had a queen size bed for 2 people and was rather small compared to a standard hotel room. 3. Room needed some repainting and remodeling altought the fixtures were quite artistic. 4. No complimentaly breakfast, not even a cup of coffee in the lobby area. 5.Wireless access is $10 a day (most hotels now a days provide complimentary wireless web access) 6. Also, they had lots of goodies in the room, like chocolates, chips, juices, water and blah blah blah, almost like a sales counter on a rack in the room. The water bottle was like close to $6, you can imagine the prices of other stuff (People with kids will specially have a hard time, so prepare to spend some more money) The hotel itself is nice and the service is wonderful. I would give them a rating between 2.5 to 3 stars. Have fun in Vancouver, its a nice place and we really liked it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: spectres
Reviews.Content: Last weekend, my boyfriend and I took a weekend trip from Victoria to Vancouver. We chose the Listel Hotel because of it's central location - and once we got into the city, it was very easy for us to find. We arrived at around eleven in the morning, and because check in time wasn't until three, we were hoping to check our bags at the hotel, and to return a few hours later. Much to our surprise, they had our room ready, and we were told that we could go straight up there. There was a little confusion at the front desk - and after looking at my boyfriend and I, the receptionist asked if we'd meant to book two twin beds instead of a king sized bed. We were delayed at the front desk for about ten minutes while she asked for ID from us, and seemed a bit concerned that we were under aged (we're both 19). After confirming this, we went upstairs. Our room was very basic, with a large comfortable bed, and a disappointingly tiny bathroom. There was a mini-bar, which was locked, and after looking around, we saw that there wasn't a key for it in the room. When I had a shower, the water never really reached a 'hot' temperature, even after I turned it up all the way. It took about ten minutes for it to really warm up. That night, after exploring the city, we came back to the hotel and ordered room service. Our order came very quickly - in about fifteen minutes. The meal came out to about $30 - including a tip, and the food was good. A few things were forgotten, however - dips and certain condiments that were promised on the menu - but otherwise, it was fine. Checking out was quick, and all in all, my stay at the Listel was pretty average. I think if I went back into Vancouver I'd try a different hotel. My experience wasn't bad, and I did notice that the staff (especially the doormen, the maids and the room service workers) were very polite and kind.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great area”
Reviews.Author: JennyOnTheGo
Reviews.Content: It was my first time in Vancouver, and being someone who likes to eat, shop and walk, I think I picked a great spot. The Listel is on a nice main shopping and eating road (Robson) and is close to many other parts of town by walking or hopping a bus. The lobby was contempoary and clean. The staff was friendly and attentive. Only being able to access room floors by using your room card key in the elevators adds an extra sense of security, not that at any time did I feel it was necessary. Great area. I had read previous reviews where people complained about the size of the bathroom. Yes, it was small - containing only the toilet and the shower/tub leaving the sink in an alcove just outside. But really, how big need a hotel bathroom be? It was fine. All of the hotels appear to be expensive to a degree when compared to other vacation spots. Just comes with the Vancouver territory. The room was comfortable, clean, met our needs, and the maids were timely and thorough. Overall, a nice place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “I liked the Listel”
Reviews.Author: PG_Coach
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Listel recently and it is a nice place to stay. The beds were awesome. I slept very soundly throughout the night. Noise never bothers me, because I always carry earplugs, which is something I'm surprised more people don't do when they travel. The front desk staff were awesome, and the room itself was nice. I was facing the alley, but sometimes thats a better view. For what I paid for the night ($110 govt. rate), it was more than enough. Good work Listel. PS. I loved the Aveda products in the washroom.

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic Hotel with staff who care and really want to see you return.”
Reviews.Author: WottonGlos.
Reviews.Content: My wife and her friend stayed at The Listel Hotel Vancouver in August 2006 when they visited Vancouver & Seattle to meet up with some old school friends. The high standard of service from all the staff and the superb accommodation made both ladies feel like millionaires. Eating at The Listel was so convenient and you must tackle the Yukon breakfast it will last you all day and enjoy O'Doul's Restuarant & Bar for that special evening meal as they did with friends, the silver service just makes it perfect. There are many good points and the very thoughtful staff ensured the ladies were served a complimentary pot of tea and the morning newspaper, it is these little touches of personal service that make for a memorable stay. The Hotel location is so handy for all the shops in Robson Street and convenient for all transport. My wife enjoyed her stay so much, we have just booked a week there in July 2007 as part of our vacation in Canada and we will stay at other Listel Hotels. Thank you to all the staff at The Listel Hotel, you made my wife feel special and she deserves it. William Cox Gloucestershire, England September 2006.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not Excellent”
Reviews.Author: katgut
Reviews.Content: The Listel hotel is a nice hotel very centrally located, but not in a downtown/ business area. We stayed over the Labor Day weekend in one of the Museum Rooms which are also nice and roomy. The service at the hotel was excellent and was probably the best thing about the stay. Overall though I found the hotel to be pricey relative to what you got. Despite billing itself as the "Art Hotel" there wasn't much of an artist feel there. It felt like a typical business hotel -- comfortable, but lacking character. We spent about $220/ night and I think we probably could have stayed somewhere more interesting for that amount of money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: reisefan
Reviews.Content: We booked Gallery room on Internet, and were upgraded to an one bedroom suite when checking in. Nice livingroom with wiew over the bay. The bathroom was spacious with shower and bathtub, but a little bit old fashion. The location was excellent, short distance to shopping, Stanley Park, the harbour and all the other interesting sights in the city. We stayed for three nights. The service was excellent, the attendants in the reception where friendly and gave us good tourist information, and we also appreciated the good service during breakfast. We would definitely stay at the Listel again if returning to Vancouver. We bought a package including breakfast, which we also can recommend. Regards from 2 satisfied norwegian tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the place”
Reviews.Author: jls38
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel for tourists who want to spend a night or 2 in Vancouver, very clean, great service, staff very friendly. It is right on Robson which is great fo shopping, I defenitly recommend the place, very good value

Reviews.Title: “Listel - not the top choice”
Reviews.Author: World_Vagabond
Reviews.Content: It was my first experience of Vancouver and the Listel Hotel seemed like a hip, centralized place to stay. After spending three days there I would not recommend a stay there unless you come across a really good rate and there is value involved. Here are the cons: - As stylish as the lobby looks, it is small and practically on Robson street itself. Robson street is tourist central, with tons of walking traffic so the lobby is not relaxing. - The bathroom in the gallery room is truly old and pink and does not match the rest of the room which is very nicely decorated. It is also very small. - Our rate was comprable to the Pacific Palisades (a Kimpton Chain) across the street, that has a larger property off of Robson and therefore you have a little respite from the tourist traffic. - no free wireless in the rooms, which I think would have made a friendly touch Pros: - There is art in the room and lobby - The service was excellent - the fastest valet service I have ever had anywhere - A lovely package of cookies were on our dashboard in our car thanking us for our stay (I am a sucker for little touches like that)

Reviews.Title: “Appreciated the Listel Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alohatraveler
Reviews.Content: The Listel was recommended by a friend in Seattle. We were first impressed by the unique design. Impressive art is everywhere but there are also many small touches that show care in trhe design of the hotel. Even the luggage carts were designed and added to the ambience of the hotel. The design provided a warm, friendly feeling and this was carried over into the way we were treated by the staff. We had a lot of interaction with the staff and every contact with the staff was marked by sincere consideration for our needs. The staff went well beyond what would normally be expected. The attitude of the staff and their excellent service made our stay memorable. The rooms are nicely designed and very coimfortable but what we found impressive was the careful design of the hallways, the elevators, all elements of the hotel. I have traveled a lot and, overall, this was one of the best hotel experiences I have ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but not what expected”
Reviews.Author: Boodkins
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from our vacation in Vancouver. We spent the first two nights at the Listel Hotel in a Gallery room with a king size bed. Although we were impressed with the small trendy lobby, the very nice small gym and the corteous staff we did not feel the same way about the room. The room consisted of a desk/ entertainment center/minibar made of cherry wood, two night tables, mirror closet sliding doors, a plush chair and a window sill seat. The room size was small. The small bathroom although very clean it desperately needs to be updated. The bathtub tiles were color pink and you felt like a giant while taking a shower in it. The shower head had good pressure and hot water. The sink is outside the bathroom. Since the room felt like a Holiday Inn room for over $200 a night, we decided to move to another hotel for a small price difference for the rest of our stay in Vancouver. In our opinion, the Listel hotel is an ideal room for business travelers or for tourists that want a clean hotel in a good location but do not plan to spend much time in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great position good value”
Reviews.Author: Paul Bris uk
Reviews.Content: Very good location for sight seeing , good clean rooms no complaints

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: mr_expresso_king
Reviews.Content: Just stayed there last week. First it is a very good location right on Robson street. So if you like to shop, then it's very good. The staff was friendly and attentive and a great resource for local picks to eat/drink. The restaurant was nice as well and had jazz from 9-12pm each evening. The room was nice and comfortable and will definitely go back when in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Listel last october with my boyfriend on a 3 week holiday across canada. We stayed at the Listel for 6 nights and both loved it. The location was perfect,right on Robson Street and easy walking distance from everywhere. The staff were very helpful in giving us directions etc. The only down side was the size of the bathroom, it was tiny. Other than that we had a large room with 2 double beds and everything else we needed. I would recommend the Hotel to anyone looking for a centrally located Hotel in Vancouver.

Reviews.Title: “They do try”
Reviews.Author: Robwash
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 4 nights late April. Great location. If you are there as a tourist, don't even THINK of staying "downtown", unless you like deserted streets at night with plenty of homeless and drug addicts to keep you company. Very San Francisco like in that respect. The hotel staff was fine, as was the housekeeping. I like strong, hot showers...something not to be had at this hotel. If they had bathrooms with showers on commercial aircraft, this is probably be what they would be like. This was our first time in Vancouver. We enjoyed our stay, and liked the ambience of this hotel. If you don't want to stay in a place where you are the only one not on a package cruise trip, this might be the place. If you are in your 20s, stay in Yorktown. If not, and you are an independent traveler, this is a fine choice.

Reviews.Title: “Get the middle tier (Gallery?) room”
Reviews.Author: boberonicus2
Reviews.Content: Booked two rooms for three nights. One "museum" room, one "gallery" room. The deficiencies of the cheaper "museum" room are all made up for in the "gallery" rooms. The problems with the museum room include: 25 watt bulbs, no luggage racks, skimpy closet and drawer space, rickety desk chair, "cadet" sized tub, very little space for toiletries. The gallery rooms address all of these issues and are more richly appointed: better artwork, interesting ceiling moldings, etc. That being said, both room styles have comfy beds and are quiet. Neither room had a loud night, from Friday-Monday. No free Internet access, either wired or wireless. Staff were very friendly and helpful. I would love to stay again, but I'd pick a Gallery room.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: Sar_979
Reviews.Content: We got a good deal on the Listel from Expedia, but if we paid the full price, it would have been one of the worst hotels I have ever stayed at. The hotel was in a great location, but when the limo pulled up nobody came out to help us with our bags. Check in was also a problem. Since we booked with Expedia, we were not told that we had to have a credit card to book into the room. We offered a large cash deposit with our passports, but the hotel did not accept it. The only reason we got was because "it was hotel policy". At every other hotel we have stayed at, they have accepted a cash deposit in lieu of a credit card. We had to have an authorization from someone else faxed to us. If we didn't already pay for the hotle, we definatly would have gone somewhere else at this time. The room itself was alright, although we had to take our bags up there ourself. However, you have to insert the keycard in the elevator before you can choose a floor. The front desk staff did not make us aware of this, another guest at the hotel did. It was not a boutique hotel as advertised. The only good thing about this hotel was the location. It was close to good shopping and restaurants. However, there are other hotels in the area, hopefully with friendlier staff.

Reviews.Title: “very mixed experience”
Reviews.Author: OneKnite
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel, it actually looked nicer than the pictures seemed, so that was a nice surprise. A great location. Very friendly staff. The museum art all over the place works very well, quite tasteful. A few problems however. The staff while friendly and nice, but were not truly service oriented. For example, no one ever offered to help with bags, they actually seemed to turn away whenever bags were around and had to be asked. This was quite weird as sometimes there were three or four staff just standing around smiling. The most serious problem is that we were put in room 321, right above the restaurant roof. There was a loud clanging ventillation fan on all night, which meant we had to keep the windows closed. There also was a vent from the hot tub right below our window, with a strong chlorine smell, another reason the windows had to stay closed. We asked to move and they were happy to move us while we were out -- but to a higher floor in the same vicinity with the same problem. We finally were moved to a rear room in the low number side of the buidling and these problems disappeared. Restaurant was pricey, good food, mediocre service.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, room a little tired”
Reviews.Author: Namcan
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Listel for a three day weekend in Vancouver. We got a great rate for it on Hotwire - $85/night!!! I'm glad that we did, because if we had been paying the regular rate I would have been fairly dissapointed. The room was a room - no real boutique type atmosphere. It was clean and comfortable and the hotel's location was fabulous!!! Good dining, shopping and Stanley Park nearby. My husband had a great seafood salad at O'Doul's the hotel restaurant. We also had a great meal at Tropika - malaysian/thai cuisine just a block down from the hotel. The staff were friendly and courteous (although their attire left something to be desired with dirty/blackened shirt cuffs . . .a good go through the laundry would be nice). A nice perk was the fitness center with a very comfortable jacuzzi. We would stay here again if we got the Hotwire rate, if not we would look for slightly better value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Yakima_WAKaytee
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Listel for 2 nights over New Year's weekend. The staff was great and the location was awesome - perfect for shopping and people watching. While we were there we found a great new restaurant called Saltlik on Alberni Street - incredible food and cool lounge vibe, very friendly staff. Also, don't walk down Robson with stopping at Cafe Crepe - you'll be entertained by the staff and the crepes are out of this world! The Listel may be a tad overpriced but the location makes up for it!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!!!!”
Reviews.Author: dcapestro
Reviews.Content: We booked our stay via the internet (very straightforward) a month beforehand. The Museum Room with a King size bed was comfortable, stylish, clean, and modern. It was our first stay in Vancouver, and the Listel Hotel is located right in the middle of Robson Street, with great shops and restaurants on either side. The front desk staff recommended Cardero's for dinner our first night, which turned out to be a highlight of our trip. The valet service was prompt and responsible; they even helped retrieve some items from our car for us and delivered them to our door. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay. I am impressed by the knowledgeable and friendly staff who were ready at all times with suggestions, maps, directions, recommendations, and smiles. We even had a goodbye gift waiting for us in our car on the last day. Cookies for the roadtrip ahead!

Reviews.Title: “Understated excellence”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A quiet, low-key, and very well-maintained hotel in the heart of downtown Vancouver, offering excellent value for money. We were particularly impressed by the staff, the service (very good without being intrusive), and good, complementary coffee. We chose this hotel based on TripAdvisor reviews and we were not disappointed. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “One More Great Vancouver Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MrsBicep
Reviews.Content: The Listel is a lovely Hotel in a great downtown location. The room was above average, extremely clean and any staff I came in contact with was helpful and friendly. I can't think of anything that I would improve on. If you want the authentic Downtown Vancouver experience this Hotel would be an excellent choice. I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bridgemagoo2
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed our stay here in mid September 2005, good hotel and good service, and location good for Robson Street and Stanley Park. Lovely room on the museum floor, although we had expected a number of exhibits rather than just one on the floor and a couple in the room. We stayed 2 nights here and 2 at Le Soleil for very similar cost and I have to say we would return to Le Soleil first, but would not be disheartened if that was not available and this was.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed...”
Reviews.Author: Debits2000
Reviews.Content: While the location was convenient (we walked everywhere: Gastown, Chinatown, Yaletown, Stanley Park) the hotel was only average. From their website, I thought we were staying at a small" boutique" hotel. It really wasn't anything special. It was clean and the room adequate but far from luxurious. The furnishings seemed "tired." We had a Museum KING on the 5th floor and were [just] able to see the water (between 2 buildings) from our window. The staff seemed to be "twenty-somethings" with very little professionalism or friendliness. They rarely said hello as we came and went (we were there for 3 nights). And lastly, we were told when I made the reservations in February, that we should ask for an upgrade when we checked in...we did to no avail. And it was nice to read a review on here that they were on their honeymoon and got strawberries and a note. We were also on our honeymoon [which they knew] and didn't get as much as a "congratulations". We are a mid-aged professional couple that has done extensive travelling and we overall unimpressed with the Listel. Vancouver was great...

Reviews.Title: “Really happy to have been a guest”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Listel as the third part of our honeymoon, previously at the Omni in San Fransisco and the Andra in Seattle. This hotel was different to the relative luxery of the Omni and the Uniqueness of the Andra. It is in a FANTASTIC location right on Robson Street which is the main shopping road in Vancouver and about 2 blocks from the waterfront and only a 5 minute walk to the beautiful Stanley Park. We had a great reception from the staff, most of whom seemed to have been Aussie and our room was ready on our arrival. The Room was a reasonable size and very comfortable with a view of the street and the statatory free paper on the door step. The Gym was fine and the hot tub was excellent. Thats the great thing about Canadian hotels, all the ones I have stayed in have always had a hot tub! When the recieptionist found out we were on our honeymoon a plate of Strawberries were sent up with a card which was very sweet. We would definatly return to the Listel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: purplecat22
Reviews.Content: Average hotel, nothing fancy to write home about. After looking on their website I thought I had made a great choice for the price. Once arriving I doubted my judgement. We exited our cab to only not be greeted by the bellboy standing there, he never acknowledged us, nor help us with our bags. I think if you are going to hire someone to do that job, they should know what their job description is. Checking in was great as we arrived in the morning and were given a room right away. We were also upgraded, again a nice surprise, but I was curious what our original room would have looked like. We had no veiw, and the decor needs some major work. Very blah and average. Also twice, a staff member entered our room without notice. The maid walked in our first morning while I was laying awake in bed, I heard no knocking what so ever. The second night another staff member entered the room while we were watching T.V. again we heard no knocking. I don't think that I would stay here again if the only draw is Robson Street, which wasn't all that great either.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location - Nice hotel - Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The subject line says it all. This hotel is located near the end of Robson - close to the gardens. Shopping is a bit of a hike - as is Canada Place and Gastown. However, being near the end of the street has its advantages. We were there on a Friday night and anticipated being kept awake with exterior noise. We fell asleep with the window opened and never heard a thing. The floor we were on was showing some age - wallpaper was coming off the wall and there was a bad smell in the hall - but none of that came into the room. Bathrooms are smallish - with the vanity outside of the toilet/shower area. (think old holiday inn) Closets are very small. The staff on the other hand is excellent. They went out of their way to accomodate us and bent over backwards to meet our needs. In addition, the adjacent restaurant is fabulous. We had brunch there as well as drinks the evening before. Excellent staff, great prices, and outstanding food. All in all a very good hotel for a short stay (we were there one night - before joinging an Alaska cruise). Would not want to spend a week here, though. Smokers note - this is a non-smoking hotel. Don't try to trick them. My father-in-law smokes and was smoking in his room with the windows open and used Febreeze when he was done. When they came in to do turn down, they noticed and left a very nasty voicemail threatening severe service charges if he continued. Needless to say - it scared the pants off him!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place, close to everything”
Reviews.Author: nireno
Reviews.Content: I think this hotel is really nice, very central, large rooms. On my next visit I will stay at this hotel again

HotelInfo.Name: The Listel Vancouver
HotelInfo.Address: 1300 Robson Street, Vancouver, British Columbia V6E 1C5, Canada
